loans.name: Chrech's Group

texts.en:
Chrech, who is a farmer of the Sambour district of the Kratie province, is 35 years old and a married mother of a child who is in school. She grows rice to earn the main income to support her family. She sometimes works for others for a fee to supplement that income. She has been involved in her business for 17 years already. 

This year, her cash crop has been destroyed by pests, so it has produced her lower-than-expected outputs. As she is able to earn about 36,100 KHR per day to support her family, she cannot afford to save her business better. Chrech is now applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR for each group member; this will be her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

As a leader of a group of two, she will use her loan to buy a new type rice seeds and to buy fertilizers to enrich the crop with nutrients so that she can get more outputs than before. She hopes to earn more income to support her child’s studies and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a new type of rice seeds and to buy fertilizers to enrich the crop with nutrients so that she can get more outputs than before.

loans.name: Grupo Tzamjuyup Sector Escuela No.01 Group

texts.es:
Sara (la primera del lado derecho)es una mujer de grandes objetivos en la vida, y para hacerlo posible se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de ropa típica, Sara cuenta que gracias al crédito ella pudo comprar más mercaderías para su negocio y afortunadamente le fue muy bien porque obtuvo muy buenas ganancias y con ello logro comprar una estufa que ahora lo utiliza para preparar los alimentos de su familia, y ahora  se encuentra muy satisfecha, pero Sara y su grupo con el afán de seguir prosperando solicitan un nuevo crédito, que lo invertirá en la compra de y venta de ropa típica compra de blusas, fajas cortes, para satisfacer mejor  las necesidades de sus clientes.
El gran sueño de Sara es construir una casa más grande para que su familia tenga más comodidad.
texts.en:
Sara (the first on the right side) is a woman with big life goals and to make them possible she puts a lot of effort into her business selling traditional clothing.  Sara tells us that thanks to her loan she was able to buy more merchandise for her business and fortunately it went very well for her because she made very good earnings, which allowed her to buy a stove that she now uses to make food for her family and she is very satisfied.  However, in order to keep prospering, Sara and her group are requesting a new loan, which they will invest in buying and selling traditional clothing, such as blouses and short sashes, in order to better meet their customers' demands.    

Sara's big dream is to build a bigger house so her family can be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing

loans.name: Fousseyni

texts.fr: Fousseyni est agriculteur inscrit à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Siby au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Âgé de 49 ans, Fousseyni est le père de 7 enfants âgés de 2 à 26 ans, dont 4 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille ont incité Fousseyni à devenir agriculteur. Il cultive le maïs sur sa parcelle de 1 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles et de pluie. Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour cultiver le maïs et d'autres si possible. L’accès au semoir lui permettra d'être rapide en semis. Fousseyni espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants  et assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Fousseyni is a farmer. A member of myAgro, he lives and works in the village of Siby, southwest of Bamako, in Mali. Fousseyni is 49 years old and the father of seven children between the ages of two and 26. Four of the children are currently in school.

Fousseyni was motivated to become a farmer by a family tradition anchored in agricultural practice as the main source of household’s revenues and food self-reliance, but also because farming allowed him to guarantee his family’s independence. He farms corn on his 2.5-acre lot, but as a farmer confronts difficulties such as droughts and lack of farming material.

This year, he wanted to purchase a seeder to farm corn and other plants if possible. Getting the seeder will allow him to be faster at the seeding stage. With increased productivity and revenues, Fousseyni hopes to be able to cover his children’s school expenses and guarantee his family’s food independence.

loans.use: to own a precision seeder.

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.pt:
O senhor Anselmo de 40 anos de idade trabalha como inspetor, casado pai de 2 filhos dos quais 1  frequenta o ensino primário, e  ooutro ainda sem idade escolar, tem também 1 irmã sob sua responsabilidade ,vive em casa própria.
Diz que com os empréstimos anteriores conseguiu levantar a casa tipo 3  e com este crédito irá comprar cimento, varroes, pedra, e pagar a mão-de-obra para dar continuidade da sua obra.
O seu sonho é terminar a obra, mobilar para oferecer um melhor conforto a sua família, concluir a faculdade e construir um aviário em sua casa para aumentar a renda familiar
Tem como desafios financeiros tem  estado a trabalhar,e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
Anselmo is 40 years old and works as an inspector. He's married and has two children, one of whom is in primary school and the other child is below school age. He also has a sister under his responsibility. He lives in a house that he owns.
He states that with the previous loans he was able to build his three-bedroom house. With this loan he'll purchase cement, rods and rocks and he'll pay for labor so that he can continue the construction work.
His dream is to finish the construction work and furnish the house in order to provide more comfort for his family. Another dream is to finish college and build an aviary at his house as a way to improve his family's income.
His challenge is his finances. He's been working hard and intends to get other loans so he can overcome the struggles and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods and rocks, and to pay for labor so he can continue the construction work.

loans.name: Maclaud

texts.en:
Maclaud, who is in his mid 50s, is married with three children who are still in school. He has been running a bar and a restaurant business for nine years now. He works from 5 am until midnight daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be Maclaud's 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to expand and repair his restaurant/bar, which used to be small but is now big and attractive. 

He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, build his house and cover household expenses. He is now requesting his 11 loan cycle which will use this loan to buy beer, wine, spirits, soda, juice, water and restaurant coking items. He dreams of improving his lifestyle. Maclaud will be accountable for paying back this loan as per schedule.

loans.use: to buy beer, wine, spirits, soda, juice and water and restaurant cooking items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, shampoo, bath soap, detergent, instant noodles, etc.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation) to purchase ingredients like fish, canned goods, eggs, etc. for her food vending business.

Elvira has been in this business for five years. Elvira earns additional income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like fish, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marites is 44 years old and two of her children are in school.

Marites has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines. Marites has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell.

Marites has been in this business for six years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 26 years old. She is married and has five children. Three of her children are in school.

Rhoda is in the agricultural business of farming seaweeds in the Philippines. Rhoda requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation) to buy plastic bags and other supplies.

Rhoda has been in this business for two years now, and she has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rhoda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags and other supplies

loans.name: Saroeun's Group

texts.en:
The farmer living in Kam Rieng district of Battambang province.  Saroeun is 44 years old and she is a mother of six children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To support her living, she grows cassava as the main source of income. Sometimes, she works for others for a fee in order to earn additional income. She has been involved in this job for 12 years. 

As she lacks of capital to support her business, Saroeun is applying a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. Through the previous loan, she has improved her living standard much better than before. This time, Saroeun, the group of leader of three members, will use her loan to pay for plowing fees, buy cassava seed and organic fertilizers to increase the crop products. 

She hopes to earn more income to renovate her house more comfortable so that the whole family can live in healthier environment.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, buy cassava seed and organic fertilizers to increase the crop products.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: Moussa est agriculteur inscrit à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Kafara au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Âgé de 40 ans, Moussa est le père de 1 enfant âgé de 5 ans, dont aucun d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance pour sa famille a incité Moussa à devenir agriculteur. Il cultive le maïs sur sa parcelle de 1 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour me rendre les tâches plus faciles. L’accès au semoir lui permettra d'être rapide et faire une économie d'efforts physiques. Moussa espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir acheter de matériels agricoles et étendre mon champ.
texts.en:
Moussa is a farmer and a member of myAgro. He lives and works in the village of Kafara, in the southeast of Bamako in Mali. He is 40 years old and has one five-year old child who is not in school. Moussa has become a farmer since farming helps him to ensure his family's financial independence. He grows corn on his field of 1 ha [2.5 acres], facing challenges such as droughts and lack of farming supplies. 

This year he decided to buy a seeder in order to make his work easier. Having a seeder will allow him to work faster while reducing physical exertion. With the increase of his yield and his revenues, Moussa hopes to buy agricultural supplies and be able to continue working his land.

loans.use: to buy a precision seeder.

loans.name: Dramane

texts.fr: Dramane est agriculteur inscrit à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Siramana au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Âgé de 75 ans, Dramane est le père de 16 enfants âgés de 9 à 40 ans, dont 14 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture ont incité Dramane à devenir agriculteur. Il cultive le maïs, l'arachide,  et le riz sur sa parcelle de 4.5 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Il a partagé que, ""La rentabilité dépend des matériels agricoles et de bons engrais"." Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour m'épauler dans le semis et usage d'engrais. L’accès au semoir lui permettra d'être moins fatigué . "Le semis est le plus dûr des travaux champêtres". Dramane espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir acheter un moulin de mil pour les femmes et une machine de décorticage de maïs pour les hommes.
texts.en:
Dramane is a farmer. A member of myAgro, he lives and works in the village of Siramana, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. Dramane is 75 years old and the father of sixteen children between the ages of nine and forty. Fourteen of the children are currently in school.

Dramane was motivated to become a farmer by a family tradition anchored in agricultural practice as the main source of household’s revenues and food self-reliance, but also by the love of farming. He farms corn, groundnuts, and rice on his 11-acre lot, but as a farmer he confronts difficulties such as the lack of farming material and quality fertilizer. He shared that “productivity depends on farming tools and good fertilizers.”

This year, he wanted to purchase a seeder to help him with seeding and using fertilizers. Getting the seeder will allow him to feel less tired: “seeding is the hardest field work.” With increased productivity and revenues, Dramane hopes to be able to buy a grinder for millet for the women and a corn husking machine for the men.

loans.use: to buy a precision seeder.

loans.name: Marin's Group

texts.en:
Marin is a farmer living in the Kratie District of Kratie Province. She is a married mother of three dependent children. Two of her children are in school and the other is not of school age yet. 

Marin has been working on her rice farming business for 25 years to earn the main source of income to support her family. Moreover, she fishes the inland water in her community to earn additional income for her family. This year, her crop has been destroyed by pests and she harvested lower-than-expected outputs. 

Marin is not a new client because she has been with VisionFund for two cycles already. With her past loans, she managed to improve her family’s living conditions. This third time, Marin is applying for a loan to pay for plowing fees and to buy fertilizers that are expected to increase the productivity of her crops. She hopes that she can earn more income to support her children’s studies until they graduate.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and to buy fertilizers that are expected to increase the productivity of her crops.

loans.name: Pacifica

texts.en:
Pacifica is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Pacifica is 59 years old now.

Pacifica has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Pacifica requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other supplies.

Pacifica has been in this business for four years. In the future, Pacifica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other supplies

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo es un  joven que se ha dedicado al cultivo de maíz y café desde hace 10 años, vive en una comunidad del departamento de Copan en Honduras donde no cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica. Actualmente vive con su padre quien también se dedica a la agricultura y le ayuda en los gastos de la casa. Una de sus principales aspiraciones es tener su propia familia y   poder darle un mejor ambiente a su futura esposa por lo que está solicitando financiamiento a Soluz Honduras  para la compra de un Sistema Solar y está seguro que de esa manera mejorara sus condiciones de vida y le ayudara en sus labores agrícolas.
texts.en:
Hugo is a young man who has been making a living growing maize and coffee for ten years. He lives in a community where they don't have electricity in the Department of Copan. He currently lives with his father, who also works as a farmer and helps him with the household expenses.

One of his main aspirations is to have his own family, and to be able to give his future wife a better environment. He is therefore requesting a loan from Soluz Honduras to buy a solar power system. He is sure that, in this way, he will improve his living conditions and it will also help him with his farming.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system which will benefit his home

loans.name: Emilia Del Rosario

texts.es:
Emilia, de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, es viuda desde hace 22 años, producto de los últimos daños de la guerra, tiene tres hijos y vive solo con un nieto.  

Emilia, su negocio es vender artículos para el embellecimiento de la mujer tales como cremas, maquillajes, labiales, entre otros; todo esto lo hace por medio de catálogo, sus productos son de buena calidad y es así como ella ha sobrevivido;  además sus hijos se dedican a la agricultura y todos están al pendiente de ella; su trabajo lo realiza tres días por semana en diferentes lugares, ella recorre por lo menos seis kilómetros a pie en cada ruta. 

Emilia, está solicitando el crédito para comprar cinco sacos de fertilizante para sembrar 3,500 metros cuadrados de plátanos, con ello se beneficiara hasta que salga la cosecha.

El sueño de Emilia, es que su plantación agrícola le dé buenos resultados, ya que es primera vez que siembra este tipo de cultivo y su único objetivo es tener un poco de dinero para ayudar a su mamá de 75 años de edad.
texts.en:
Emilia is 42; she studied up until the third grade; she has been a widow for 22 years as a result of the last casualties of the war; she has three children and lives on her own with one grandson.  

Emilia's business is selling women's beauty products, such as creams, makeup, and lipsticks, among others; she does all of this through catalogs.  Her products are of good quality and this is how she has survived.  Additionally, her children work in farming and they all look after her.  She does her work three days a week in different places; she covers at least six kilometers on foot on each route.   

Emilia is requesting this loan to buy five sacks of fertilizer to plant 3,500 square meters of bananas; this will help her out until harvesting time.  

Emilia's dream is for her crop to provide her with good results, as this is her first time planting this type of crop and her only goal is to have a little money to help her mom, who is 75 years old.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of fertilizer to plant 3,500 square meters of bananas.

loans.name: Roqueta

texts.en:
Roqueta is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Roqueta is 37 years old and has two children who are in school.

Roqueta has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Roqueta requested a PHP 29000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other supplies needed.

Roqueta has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Roqueta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other supplies needed for her weaving business

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan, es un hombre trabajador, que ama el campo y a su familia. Desde los veinte años se ha dedicado a ser agricultor; trabajo por muchos años en haciendas cafetaleras y empresas que procesan granos básicos, sin embargo con la ayuda de sus siete hijos, junto con sus ahorros, logro adquirir parcelas de tierra para sembrar y empezar a trabajar por su cuenta, además también invirtió en una pulpería.
Él ha recurrido a Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita comprar pesticidas, abono entre otros insumos que necesita su siembra de frijol, también para abastecer de productos su pulpería, la cual crece de forma exitosa. Este hombre es un ejemplo a seguir, es muy emprendedor, sabe que para tener éxito tiene que esforzarse, es por eso que es agricultor y comerciante a la vez. En el futuro desea explorar otro  negocio como la ganadería.
texts.en:
Juan is a hard-working man who loves the fields and his family. He has been working as a farmer for 20 years, having spent many years in the coffee fields and also working for firms that process basic grains. However, with the help of his seven children and with his savings, he was able to acquire  some parcels of land to plant and work for himself. He also invested in a general store.

He has approached Kiva and MiCredito to apply for a loan so he can buy pesticides, fertilizer and other supplies he needs for his crop of beans, as well as to buy products to stock his general store which is growing successfully. 

This man is an example to take note of. He is very enterprising and knows that in order to become successful one must push oneself.  This is why he is both a farmer and a businessman.  In the future he would like to explore another business such as livestock.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizer and other supplies.

loans.name: Sophary's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Kam Rieng district of Battambang province, Sophary is 33 years old and she is married. She struggles for a living via growing cassava as the main source of family’s income. She sometimes works as a paid worker to earn more income for better support. She has been in her business for 10 years. 

Now, she lacks of capital to support her business’s growth; she forms a group two to apply for a loan of 1,400,000KHR for each with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and this is first time of her. As a representative, she will use her loan portion to pay for the plowing fees and buy cassava seeds so that she can get more yields from her business. She hopes to earn more income to renovate her house much better and support her family’s needs.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fees and buy cassava seeds so that she can get more yields from her business.

loans.name: Kan's Group

texts.en:
Kan is a local farmer living in Kampong Cham province and she is a married mother of four dependent children. One of her children is in school and the other one is under the age of school. She has been growing rice on two and half hectares area of farmland for 15 years to earn the main source of income. Meanwhile, she also makes desserts to sell in her community to earn additional income. This year her cash crop has been seriously destroyed by pests. 

Therefore, she is leading a group of three members, which is the first time of her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), to buy rice seeds, organic insecticide and organic fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income to improve her living standard and support her children’s studies until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, organic insecticide and organic fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 49 years old, married with two children.

Charity works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell in her general store, like canned goods and personal care products.

Charity has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

Charity aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, like canned goods and personal care products

loans.name: Nesteria

texts.en:
Nesteria is 54 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Nesteria is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Nesteria has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nesteria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Grupo Sector Instituto Por Cooperativa. Group

texts.es:
Maria (la primera del lado izquierdo de blusa color azul) es una  mujer de 32 años de edad, es soltera y tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 2 y 10 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Maria para salir adelante con su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes, ella lleva 10 años de ejercer esta labor, pero para poder mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica a la venta de pollo, gracias a estas dos actividades logrado mantener a su familia, Maria es una de las mujeres que se caracteriza por su amabilidad, respeto y carisma con la gente, es por ello que cuenta con mucha clientela  con sus dos negocios y sus productos ya no se dan abasto, por tal razón tomo la decisión de solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de productos de abarrotes y compra de pollos.
El gran sueño de Maria es que sus negocios sigan creciendo para poder mejorar sus ingresos y que sus hijos sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria (first on the left, in the blue blouse) is a 32-year-old, single woman with a lovely family of 2 children who are 2 and 10 years old. This humble family lives in the community of Sololá. 

In order to support her family, Maria makes a living buying and selling groceries. She has been doing this work for 10 years, but in order to increase her income, she also works selling chicken. Thanks to these two jobs, she has managed to support her family. Maria is one of those women who are characterized by their friendliness, respectfulness, and charisma with people. For this reason she has many customers, such that her supply of products is not enough, and so she is requesting a loan to invest in groceries and chickens. 

Maria's great dream is that her businesses keep growing, thereby increasing her income, and that her children become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy groceries and chickens.

loans.name: Grupo Chuachinup Sector Escuela Group

texts.es:
Magdalena  (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) es una mujer trabajadora, muy humilde que vive en una comunidad de la aldea Chuachinup, tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera y cuenta con una familia de tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos ya estudian y el más pequeño aun no estudia. Magdalena con el afán de obtener algo de ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica como ambulante en las aldeas circunvecinas de su comunidad, con este negocio lleva ella 10 años de realizarlo, Magdalena ahora ha considerado necesario invertir un poco más en el negocio  pues solo así podrá vender mejor porque contara con la mercadería necesaria para los clientes, pero una de las dificultades que Magdalena tiene es no contar con el capital suficiente por tal motivo solicita un crédito junto a un grupo de señoras que tienen el mismo fin que ella.
El gran sueño de Magdalena es contar con un local donde ella pueda exhibir mejor sus productos y que sus hijos sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Magdalena (the first one on the left side of the photo) is a hardworking, very humble woman who lives in a community of the town of Chuachinup.  She is 38 years old, single, and has a family of three children, two of whom are in school already, while the youngest is not yet in school.  In order to make some income, Magdalena works buying and selling traditional clothing on foot in the towns surrounding her community.  She has had this business for 10 years and Magdalena now believes she needs to invest a little more in this business as that is the only way she will be able to sell more because it will allow her to have the merchandise she needs for her customers.  However, one of the challenges Magdalena faces is not having enough capital, which is why she is requesting a loan along with a group of ladies who share the same goal.

Magdalena's big dream is to have a stall where she can better display her products and for her children to become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to own a precision feeder.

loans.name: Mercedes Johana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 9 de Abril se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 16, 14, 12 y 5 años de edad, todos estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Mercedes es una mujer que le ha gustado trabajar, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como granos, detergentes, carnes, pescado, camarón, legumbres, entre productos de primera necesidad, así como también artículos de bazar entre otros productos, trabaja todos los días y sus  hijos y su marido  le ayudan atendiendo la tienda pero eso es solo por momentos ya que ella es la que siempre está atenta a las necesidades de sus clientes, lleva más de 2 años con este negocio el cual le da lo necesario para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar víveres para surtir su tienda y mariscos para la venta.  Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con  los créditos aumenta su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The 9 de Abril Credit Group meets every 15 days in the community of Leonidas Proaño in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are heavily visited during every season of the year, as well as for being a city of incomparable beauty with many tourist attractions.  

This is where Mercedes lives.  She is 32 years old and is in a common-law relationship that has produced four children, who are 16, 14, 12, and 5 years old, all of whom are in high school and elementary school.  Her partner is a businessman.  

Mercedes is a woman who likes to work; she has a grocery store in her home where she sells all kinds of products, such as grains, detergents, meats, fish, shrimp, and beans, among other necessity items, as well as convenience store items.  She works every day and her children and her partner help her run the store, but only for brief moments, as she is the one who is always there for her customers' needs.  She has had this business for over two years and it provides her with what she needs to get ahead.  

She will use this loan to buy groceries to stock her store and seafood to sell.  She has been with her credit group for four cycles and she likes it because the loans have made her business grow.  Her dreams are to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy groceries and seafood.

loans.name: Chhlonh

texts.en: Chhlonh is a 29-year-old, single construction worker and an only son who resides with his widowed mother in Takeo Province in Cambodia. He has worked as a worker since 2013 and earns $8 per day. Chhlonh always goes to work away from home, that’s why he is now applying for a loan to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work in order to earn income to support the family. This loan will help Chhlonh have enough funds to afford the motorcycle and improve his traveling conditions. In the future, he wants to run his own business and have enough money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 57 years old and married. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more grocery items to sell. Marilyn has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending. Marilyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Junalyn

texts.en: Junalyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase more household goods to sell. Junalyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more household goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Benidecta

texts.en:
Benidecta is 56 years old and has six children. She is married, and two of her children are in school.

Benidecta is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Benidecta has been in this business for ten years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Benidecta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Phen's Group

texts.en:
Phen, who is a farmer from Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng province, is 56 and a mother of six dependent children. To earn the main sources of income to support her family, Phen grows rice and weaves scarves. She has been in these businesses for 35 years already.

Now, the price of crop products in the market is declining so that she cannot earn as good an income as before for better support. She is now leading a group of four members to get a new loan, which will be the second time for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan was repaid successfully. Through the past loan, she has improved her family’s living condition much better.

As the leader, she will use her loan to buy fuel, pay for plowing fees, and buy fertilizers to enrich the crop with nutrients for better growth. She hopes that she can improve the productivity of her crops to earn more income so that she can update her living standard better than ever before.

loans.use: to buy fuel, pay for plowing fees, and buy fertilizers to enrich the crop with nutrients for better growth.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various types of vegetables and leaf vegetables

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin is a 21-year-old single student who is from the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree majoring in public law in his third year at a university in the city. His mother is a rice farmer and his father is a village chief. Previously, Rin worked as a gas station attendant. 

He is now lacking the funds to pay his tuition fees from the third through his fourth year, therefore he he has decided to request a loan through Kredit MFI. This is his second loan with Kiva, which will help him graduate successfully with skills to build his future.

In the future, Rin dreams of being a lawyer and he hopes to have enough money to build a new house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees in Public Law from the third through his fourth year

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary is a rural smallholder crop farmer from the Molo area of Kenya. Besides crop farming, he also ferries goods and offers transportation services on his motorcycle for extra income. The key lesson he has taken away from being in crop farming is that quality inputs yield quality harvests. 

Hillary is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity. With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Hillary’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jorge Ivan

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 9 de Abril se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Jorge, tiene 41 años de edad, está separado  y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos, uno de 14 y dos de 13 años (gemelos) todos  estudian en colegio, uno es discapacitado  y viven con la mamá pero dependen de él.
El señor Jorge es un hombre que le gusta trabajar y así ganarse la vida honradamente, el tiene un taxi y ofrece el servicio de taxi a domicilio, a él sus clientes lo llaman y le piden sus servicios, el también realiza transporte escolar lo cual es un ingreso extra. Lleva más de 6 años dedicado a esta actividad con la cual se gana el sustento diario.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar llantas nuevas que necesita el carro y para ciertos repuestos. Lleva más de 1  año en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos para salir adelante. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
The Credit Group "9 de Abril" meets every 15 days in the Leonidas Proaño citadel in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequently visited in every season of the year, and for being a city with a beauty like no other with attractive tourist sites.

This is where Jorge lives. He is 41 years old and is separated. From this relationship he has 3 kids, one age 14 and two age 13 (twins). They all go to school and one is handicapped. They live with their mother, but depend on him. Jorge is a man that likes to work, and in this way earn an honorable living. He has a taxi and provides a home taxi service. His customers call him and ask for his services. He also performs school transportation which is an extra income.

He has been doing this job for more than six years, and with it he earns his daily bread. He will use this loan to buy new tires that his car needs, and for certain parts. He has been in the Credit Group for more than one year, and he likes it because of the help he is given with the loans in order to get ahead. His dream is to keep improving his life.

loans.use: to buy tires and parts.

loans.name: Kiyeng

texts.en:
Kiyeng is a rural smallholder crop farmer from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Besides crop farming, Kiyeng also offers transportation services to other farmers using his motorcycle as a means of securing extra income. The key lesson he has taken away from being in crop farming is that quality inputs yield a quality harvest.

Kiyeng is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity. With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Kiyeng’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 63, is a smallholder farmer from a village in Kiminini, located in the western region of Kenya. He owns a tranquil, rustic farmstead where he lives with his spouse and lovely children. For the last five years, Joseph has been practicing mixed farming--growing maize and keeping dairy cattle. Joseph also runs a side hustle business.

Some time back, Joseph joined a Namwamba senior group composed of mostly marginalized farmers who could not secure loans from formal financial institutions. Through the group, they secured loans from Juhudi Kilimo through a group-based guarantee mechanism. Group members are a source of encouragement and empowerment to each other. After being successfully registered into the company, they went through a training of basic financial and business skills.

Joseph has applied for a loan of 15,000 KES to purchase poultry. He is looking to venture into poultry farming. With time, he will expand. Income generated from these investments will enable him to meet high farming expenses. He stated that his family will also get to enjoy all the benefits that come along with increased income.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Jessica Beatriz

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 9 de Abril se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Jessica, tiene 32 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 11, 10  y 9 años de edad, todos estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Jessica es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja casi todos los días, aprovecha las horas de la mañana ya que a esa hora es más fresco y sale con más facilidad, aunque si sus clientes desean algo de lo que ella les vende la visitan en su hogar, tiene mucha clientela ya que les da buenas  ventajas como darles a crédito y cobrar cada 8 o 15 días. Lleva más de 3 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganarse sus propios recursos.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas entre otras prendas que vende. Lleva más de 2 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos y su  familia.
texts.en:
The "April 9th" credit group meets every 15 days in the Leonidas Proaño community of Manta, a city known for its gorgeous beaches that attract visitors year-round, and for its city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

This is the home of Jessica, who is 32 years old and married with three children of ages 11, 10, and 9, who all attend the elementary and middle school. Her husband is a businessman.

Jessica is a homemaker who, in order to obtain her own resources, works selling clothing of all types from door to door. She works almost every day, taking advantage of the morning hours when it is cooler and easier to get around. However, customers will also visit her home if they wish to buy something in particular. She has many customers due to the advantages she offers, such as payment by credit, which is collected every 8 or 15 days.

For over 3 years, Jessica has been working this business which allows her to earn her own income. This loan is to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and other garments that she sells. She has been in this credit group for over 2 years, and she likes it because the loans finance her business. Her dream is to give the best to her children and her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and other garments.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Daisy works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling cashew nuts. Daisy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Nang's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng province, Nang is a 63-year-old-married mother of eight children. In order to make a living, she grows rice and weaves scarves for her main sources of income. Sometimes, working as a paid worker enables her to earn additional income. The two main businesses, in which she has been involved about 30 years, now face the some difficulties. 

The price of crop products and scarves has been declining while the cost of production has been increasing. Nang will be with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the second time as she is applying for a loan to save the business. 

Based on the previous loan, she has improved the living standard much better. Leading a group of five, Nang will use her loan to buy silk and cotton threads for weaving scarves and pay for plowing fee and buy fertilizers for her rice farming business. She hopes to earn more income to renovate her house much better.

loans.use: to buy silk and cotton thread for weaving scarves and pay for plowing fee and buy fertilizers for her rice farming business.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is a rural smallholder crop farmer from the Kitale area of Kenya. He is married and has four children. Besides crop farming, Gideon also does dairy and poultry farming for extra food and income. The key lesson he has taken away from seven years of being in crop farming is predicting weather patterns.

Gideon is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity. With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Gideon’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.pt:
O senhor Daniel de 33 anos de idade é trabalhador como auxiliar de limpezas, casado pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2  frequentam o ensino primário,  1 ainda sem idade escolar ,vive em casa própria.
Diz que com os empréstimos anteriores  começou a sua obra tipo 2, e com este  pretende comprar cimento, varroes, chapas de zinco, arames ,pregos,  pedra, e areia  para dar continuidade da sua obra .
O seu sonho é terminar a obra, mobilar para oferecer um lar melhor  a sua família, entrar no instituto se formar , ver seus filhos formados e comprar uma viatura para transporte próprio.
Tem como desafios financeiros tem  estado a trabalhar,e pretende tomar mais vezes o emprestimo para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
Daniel is 33 years old and works as a cleaning assistant. He's married and has three children, two of whom are in primary school and one child is still below school age. He lives in a house that he owns.
He states that with the previous loans he began to build his two-bedroom house. With this loan he intends to purchase cement, rods, zinc plates, wire, nails, rocks, and sand so he can continue the construction work.
Daniel's dream is to finish the house and furnish it so he can provide a better home for his family. Other dreams are to join an institution and get a degree, see his children graduate and buy a vehicle for personal transportation.
His challenge is his finances. He's been working hard and plans on getting more loans so that he can overcome the struggles and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, zinc plates, wire, nails, rocks and sand so he can continue the construction work.

loans.name: Kheng's Group

texts.en:
Kheng is a 55-year-old farmer and a married mother of six children, four of whom are dependent on her. This industrious woman lives in Kampong Cham province and she has one school-aged child who needs better support to study.

For a living, she grows paddy rice and makes handicrafts to earn her main sources of income. She has been in these businesses for 37 years. Unfortunately, this year she cannot manage to earn as much income as before because her cash crop was destroyed by pests and there has been drought.

In hopes of saving and improving her business, Kheng is applying for her first loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is the leader of the three-member group, and will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer to enrich her crop with nutrients so that it can produce more output. She hopes to earn more income from her business to make her standard of living much better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to enrich her crop with nutrients so that it can produce more output.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials like gasoline, fishing nets and wood.

Rosalie has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials like gasoline, fishing nets and wood

loans.name: Sengheng

texts.en:
Sengheng, a farmer in the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, is a married mother of five children, two of whom are dependent on her. One of the children is in school and needs better support to study. 

To support her family’s needs, she has been growing tobacco for 37 years to earn her main income. She also weaves mats to sell to earn extra income. These days the crop is in danger as there are pests severely destroying her crop.

She is applying for a loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. This is not the first time as she has been through a cycle already. The previous loan enabled her to earn good income to support her living conditions and keep her child in school. For this second time, she will use her loan to pay for her child's school fees. She hopes that her child can receive a good education and find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Teak's Group

texts.en:
A farmer in the rural area of Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng province, Teak, 43, is a married mother with two dependent children. Growing rice and weaving have been her main businesses for 23 years. The cost of making scarves and growing rice is higher than before while the price of the products is lower.

The next loan that she is applying for is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan was repaid successfully and it has enabled her to improve her living conditions and renovate her house better. As leader of the three-member group, Teak will use her loan to buy thread to weave scarves and to buy organic fertilizers for her rice farming business. She hopes to earn more income to support her living conditions and send her children to school to receive a good eduction.

loans.use: to buy thread to weave scarves and to buy organic fertilizers for her rice farming business.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Asumini

texts.en:
Asumini is 40 years, married with seven children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She operates a stall where she deals in buying and selling of fresh foods and vegetables and gets additional income from cocoa growing. She started the business 14 years ago and has managed to maintain it. She is hard working and plans to expand the business, but faces competition and dishonest customers with high default rates and transport costs which affects her profits.  

Asumini has requested for a loan to buy tomatoes, eggplants and cabbages for selling to her customers.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes,eggplants and cabbages for selling to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, a bathtub, a toilet, faucets, rocks, sand and rods in order to improve his home by enlarging it.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.pt:
A senhora Lìdia de 34 anos de idade é trabalhadora, casada mãe de 2 filhos dos quais 01 frequenta o ensino primário e o outro ainda sem idade escolar, vive em casa própria.
Diz que com este crédito irá comprar cimento, pedra, areia, varões, e pagar a mão-de-obra para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa tipo 2 ampliando-a.
O seu sonho é terminar a obra, mobilar, formar-se em adiministracao pública e futuramente adquirir uma  viatura .
Tem como desafios os financeiros, tem estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes o emprestimo para suprir as mesmas e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
Lidia is 34 years old and in the workforce. She's married and has two children, one of whom is in primary school and the other child is still below school age. She lives in a house that she owns.
She states that with this loan she'll purchase cement, rocks, sand and rods, and she'll pay for labor so she can continue building her two-bedroom house by enlarging it.
Lidia's dream is to finish the construction work, furnish the house, get a degree in public administration and acquire a vehicle later on.
Her challenge is her finances. She's been working hard and intends to get more loans so that she can overcome the challenges and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rocks, sand and rods, and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 9 de Abril se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive el señor José, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre pero aun no tienen  hijos. La mujer  es comerciante. 
Don José es un hombre que le gusta trabajar para así ir forjándose un mejor porvenir, junto a su mujer se dedican a la venta de ropa, el tiene un auto en el cual junto a su mujer se trasladan por toda la ciudad y lugares más apartados donde le compran sus prendas, ellos venden al contado y a crédito pero solo a clientes que ya son conocidos. Lleva más de 4 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas entre otras prendas que venden. Este es su segundo ciclo en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
The “9th of April” communal bank meets every 15 days in the residential community Leonidas Proaño in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are very visited at any time of the year and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

José lives here.  He is 26 years old and is in a relationship but they still don’t have children.  She is a saleswoman.  José is a man who likes to work to carve out for himself a better future.  Together he and his partner work selling clothing.  He has a car in which they travel around the city and to more remote areas where they buy their clothing.  They sell for cash and on credit but only to customers that they already know.  He has more than 4 years in this business which allows him to earn a living.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts and blouses among other articles of clothing that they sell.  This is his second cycle in the communal bank and he likes it because the loans are quickly obtained.

His dreams are to get ahead and improve his life.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses and other garments.

loans.name: Mayra Annabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 9 de Abril se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Mayra, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de  14 años que estudia en colegio. El marido es mecánico automotriz. 
Doña Mayra es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, ella tiene un negocio de cibert en su casa, allí ofrece servicios de internet y trabajos en computadoras, también en su local ella vende hojas, útiles escolares, discos entre otras cosas, helados, sodas, jugos, golosinas, tarjetas y realiza recargas telefónicas de todas las operadoras, ella espera este crédito para mejorar su negocio ofreciendo mas variedad de productos y un mejor servicio a su clientes, lleva 5 años con este negocio y espera seguir muchos años mas.
Este crédito es para pagar el servicio de internet y comprar sodas, jugos y golosinas. Este es su tercer ciclo en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son seguir adelante mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The 9th of April loan group meets every 15 days in the Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño in the city of Manta. This is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many in all seasons of the year. It is also known as a city with unequaled beauty and with many tourist attractions.

In this place, lives Mrs. Mayra. She is 33 years old and is in a relationship, from which she has a 14-year-old daughter, who is studying in high school. Her husband is an auto mechanic.

Mayra is a woman who likes to work. She has a cyber-café business in her house. There, she offers internet and computer services. In her location, she also sells paper, school supplies, disks, ice cream, sodas, juices, sweets, cards, and does telephone charging for all the brands. She hopes for this loan to improve her business, by offering a wider variety of products and better service to her clients. She has spent 5 years with this business and hopes to continue for many more years.

This loan is to pay for internet services and to buy sodas, juice, and sweets. This is her third cycle with the loan group, and she likes it because the loans are very helpful. Her dreams are to continue forward improving her business.

loans.use: to pay for internet service and to buy sodas, juices, and sweets.

loans.name: Amparo De La Cruz

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 9 de Abril se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Amparo, tiene 62 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen 8 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su marido es mecánico aunque ya casi no trabaja por la edad. 
Doña Amparo hace tres años instalo un pequeño quiosco en el cual vende gaseosas, golosinas, aguas y otros bocadillos, trabaja todos los días ya que el negocio lo tiene en su casa, a pesar de que su negocio no es muy grande le da para salir adelante y gracias a los créditos que ha recibido ha podido irlo mejorando. 
Este crédito es para comprar gaseosas, aguas, papas fritas y varias golosinas más que vende. Lleva 5 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque así con un crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The 9th of April loan group meets every 15 days in the Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño in the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited by many in all seasons of the year. It is also known as a city with unequaled beauty and with many tourist attractions.

In this place, lives Mrs. Amparo. She is 62 years old, and is in a relationship, from which she has 8 adult children, who are independent. Her husband is a mechanic, but he no longer works because of his age. 

Three years ago, Amparo installed a small kiosk, in which she sells sodas, sweets, water, and other snacks. She works everyday, since the business is in her house. Even though the business is not very large, it yields enough for her to go forward, and thanks to the loan that she has received, it has been able to improve.

This loan is to buy sodas, water, fried potatoes, and various other sweets that she sells. She has been in the loan group for 5 years, and she likes it because she started her business with a loan. Her dreams are to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy sodas, water, fried potatoes, and various sweets.

loans.name: Leni

texts.en:
Leni is 61 years old and married with two children. One of her children is in school. Leni works very hard to provide for them.

Leni runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

Leni has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Leni would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.pt:
Tem 32 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, mãe de 3 filhos 2 apenas com idade escolar e outro ainda bebé, vive na casa própria à base de negocio de venda de roupas, produtos alimentares e criação de frangos, conta com ajuda do esposo também negociante e motorista , esta a repetir o credito pela 4ªvez, com os outros investiu sempre no negocio e na renovação de alguns bens de casa.
Pretende comprar: pintos, ração, duvés, cortinas, etc, para criação de frangos e revender roupas.
Tem o sonho de desenvolver mais o seu negocio, construir mais capoeiras e maximizar sua criação.
Os altos e baixos do negocio, tem sido o seu maior desafio.
texts.en:
Arlinda is 32 years old and married. She has three children, only two of whom are school-aged. The other child is still a baby. She lives in a house that she owns and she makes a living through her business. She sells clothing and foodstuffs and also raises chickens. She gets help from her husband who's a trader and a driver. This is her fourth loan. The other loans were always for her business and to replace some of the goods in her house.
She intends to purchase chicks and feed for her poultry farm, and to purchase duvet covers and curtains for re-selling.
Arlinda's dream is to further develop her business, build more coops and expand her farm.
The highs and lows of the business have been her biggest challenge.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and feed for her poultry farm, and to purchase duvet covers and curtains for re-selling.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt:
O senhor Pedro de 55 anos de idade é trabalhador como motorista, casado pai de 6 filhos dos quais 2  frequentam o ensino primário,  2 o ensino secundário e 2 já maiores de idade e independentes ,vive em casa própria.
 Com este crédito pretende comprar cimento, varroes, pedra, e areia  para dar continuidade da sua obra tipo 3.
O seu sonho é terminar a obra, mobilar para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família, e futuramente adquirir uma viatura para o seu dia-a-dia.
Tem como desafios financeiros, tem estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes o emprestimo para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
Pedro is 55 years old and works as a driver. He's married and has six children, two of whom are in primary school, two are in secondary school and two are already independent adults. He lives in a house that he owns.
With this loan he intends to purchase cement, rods, sand and rocks so he can continue building his three-bedroom house.
Pedro's dream is to finish the construction work and furnish the house in order to provide a better home for his family. In the future he wishes to acquire a vehicle for his daily activities.
His challenge is his finances. He's been working hard and intends to get other loans so that he can overcome the struggles and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, rocks and sand so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Paola Johanna

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 9 de Abril se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Paola, tiene 32 años está casada y de esta relación ha  procreado tres hijos de 16, 7 y 1 año, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido  es albañil.
Doña Paola se dedica al comercio, vende Cd en un puesto que tiene afuera de su casa,  este crédito lo quiere utilizar para adecuar un local ahí mismo y empezar a vender frutas y legumbres, como tiene espacio necesario solo le falta adecuar el lugar e invertir en frutas y legumbres y empezar a vender a personas que a diario pasan por el lugar,  este negocio le va a dar buenas ganancias ya que no hay otro igual muy cerca de su casa, lleva más de 4 años dedicada al comercio.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar Cd, materiales de construcción y frutas y legumbres para la venta. Este es su primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la rapidez para conseguir el crédito.  Sus sueños son salir adelante en este nuevo proyecto.
texts.en:
The 9th of April loan group meets every 15 days in the Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño in the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited by many in all seasons of the year. It is also known as a city with unequaled beauty and with many tourist attractions.

In this place, lives Mrs. Paola. She is 32 years old and is married. From this relationships, he has three children, who are 16, 7, and 1 years old. The two older children study in high school and school. Her husband works in construction.

Paola is dedicated to commerce. She sells CDs in a stand that she has outside her house. She wants this loan to remodel her location and to begin selling fruits and vegetables. As she has the space needed, she only needs to remodel the location and invest in fruits and vegetables. Then she can begin selling to the people who pass her location daily. This business is going to give her good earnings, since there is no other business like it near her house. She has spent 4 years dedicated to business.

This loan is going to be used to buy CDs, construction materials, and fruits and vegetables to sell. This is her first loan cycle in the loan group, and she likes it because of the speed with which she can get a loan. Her dreams are to go forward in this new project.

loans.use: to buy CDs, construction materials, and fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Lydia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 49 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like can goods, milk, sugar, coffee, shampoo, soap, etc.

Edna has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like can goods, milk, sugar, coffee, shampoo, soap, etc

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Flordeliza has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Flordeliza has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Tem 42 anos de idade, mãe solteira de 5 filhos, 2 sem idade escolar e os outros a estudarem e a mais velha já concluiu o ensino secundário e esta a trabalhar aguardando por uma oportunidade para estudos superiores. Ela vive na casa própria à base de negócio, sua principal fonte de renda. Esta a repetir pela 3ªvez, com os anteriores investiu na criação de frangos  e no aumento da sua casa.
Com presente emprestimo pretende comprar: amendoim, feijão, pedaços, frangos, óleo, farinha, açúcar, etc, para revenda.
Seu maior sonho, é desenvolver mais o seu negocio e construir uma loja. Concluir a construção de sua casa e construir quartos para aluguer de maneiras a garantir o sustento de seus filhos.
O custo de vida que é alto, é seu maior desafio, mesmo tendo agora a filha ,mais velha que ajuda.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 42-year-old single mother of five children. Two of her children are below school age, and the other children are in school. Her eldest daughter has already finished high school and is in the workforce waiting for an opportunity to attend college. Rosa lives in a house that she owns. She earns a living through her business which is her main source of income. This is her third loan. She used the previous loans to invest in her chicken farm and enlarge her house.
With the current loan she intends to purchase peanuts, beans, chickens, cooking oil, flour, sugar, and other items for re-selling.
Rosa's biggest dream is to further develop her business and build a store. She also wishes to finish building her house and to build rooms for renting out as a way to support her children.
Her biggest challenge is the high cost of living, even though she currently gets help from her eldest daughter.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts, beans, chickens, cooking oil, flour, sugar, and other items for re-selling.

loans.name: Chy's Group

texts.en: Chy, who is a 49-year-old farmer, lives in Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng province. She has a child who is dependent on her. To make a living, she grows rice and works for others for a fee as the main sources of income. She has been in her farming business for 25 years and this year, she unfortunately faces financial problems as her crop products can be sold at lower prices. Thus, she leads a group of three to get a new loan, which will be her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loan has enabled her to improve her living standard. As the leader, Chy will use her loan to pay the plowing fees and buy fertilizers to enhance crop productivity. She hopes to earn more income to start a new business such as selling vegetables and food so that she can earn more income to update the standard of living.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fees and buy fertilizers to enhance crop productivity.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 31 years old and married with one child. Maricel works very hard to provide for her family.

Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, condiments, beverages, eggs, homecare products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, condiments, beverages, eggs, homecare products, and other groceries

loans.name: Sandra Magdalena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santísima Trinidad se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Sandra, tiene 40 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de 15 y 12 años que estudian en colegio,  su  esposo es chofer.
Doña Sandra es una mujer muy trabajadora que para obtener sus propios recursos para los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres veces por semana y también vende en su casa si alguno de sus clientes necesita de alguna prenda, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo y se entretiene ya que le encanta el comercio.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas y ropa de niños. Lleva más de 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijas.
texts.en:
The Santísima Trinidad group meets every 15 days in Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño in Manta city, a city known for its beautiful beaches frequently visited during this time of year. It is also known for being a beautiful city with many activities for tourists.

40 year old Sandra lives here. She is married and has two daughters ages 15 and 12 who are in school. Her husband is a driver. Sandra is a very hard-working woman who in order to obtain her own income for the household expenses has a business selling all kinds of clothing. She sells from door to door. She sells three times per work and also from her house if some of her customers need a particular item. She sells on credit and collects every 8 days. She has had this business for 4 years and loves her business.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, and children's clothing. She has been in the group for 3 years and she likes the benefits she receives from the institution. She dreams of giving the best she can to her daughters.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, and clothing for children.

loans.name: Rosalee

texts.en:
Rosalee is 35 years old and she is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosalee requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosalee has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalee would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Maria Chona

texts.en:
Maria Chona is 47 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Chona runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, school supplies, home care products, and other groceries.

Maria Chona has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Maria Chona would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, school supplies, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza works hard to support her family. She is married and has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, ice cubes, etc.

Esperanza has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Esperanza would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, ice cubes, etc

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana is 41 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Joana works very hard to provide for them.

Joana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like bread, canned goods, noodles, candies, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Joana has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, canned goods, noodles, candies, biscuits, etc.

In the future, Joana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like bread, canned goods, noodles, candies, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Dioneth

texts.en:
Dioneth is a married woman with six children, five of whom are currently in school. She is 45 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Dioneth has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall. 

Dioneth has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 58 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nora has a general store business in the Philippines. Nora has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Nora has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Nora would like to save enough money to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Floresmiro

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santísima Trinidad se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Floresmiro, tiene 45 años de edad está casado y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 15 y 11 años,  ambos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposa es ama de casa.
El señor Floresmiro es un hombre muy trabajador el cual realiza una labor que aprendió hace muchos años para darles lo mejor a su familia, el en sociedad con otra persona tiene un taller de ebanistería ellos  elaboran puertas, camas y muebles de toda clase y modelos, trabaja a base de pedidos de clientes particulares que saben del buen trabajo que realizan por lo cual casi nunca les falta trabajo, lleva más de  8 años con su taller y gracias a Dios casi nunca le falta trabajo.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar madera, pinturas y otros materiales para elaborar los muebles. Está en el Grupo de Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor  a su familia.
texts.en:
The Santísima Trinidad (Holy Trinity) Credit Group meets every 15 days in the citadel of Leonidas Proaño in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular throughout the year and for being a city with unparalleled beauty with several attractive tourist destinations. 

Floresmiro lives here. He is 45 years old and married – and from this relationship has two children ages 15 and 11 years old. They both study in high school and middle school. His wife is a homemaker. 

Floresmiro is a hardworking man who runs a business that he learned several years ago in order to provide for his family. In partnership with another person, he has a woodworking shop where they make doors, beds and all types of furniture. He works based on orders from private clients that know of the good work they do – as they are rarely without work. He has more than eight years with his shop – and thanks to God he almost never lacks work. 

The loan will be used to buy wood, paints and other materials to make furniture. He has been in the credit group since the beginning, and he likes it because with the loans he gets ahead in life. His dream is to give his family the best.

loans.use: to buy wood, paints and other materials.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
