Teodora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Teodora has been in this business for 23 years and she also earns extra income from raising pigs.

Teodora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 46 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Celia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, such as sardines, noodles, biscuits, etc.

Celia has been in this business for 11 years. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future Celia would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like sardines, noodles, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Horn, 53, is a farmer in the Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng province and the mother of four children, one of whom is dependent on her. She has been growing rice for 35 years as the main source of income. Moreover, she has been weaving some daily use products to sell as an additional business. Since the cost of fertilizers and fuels has been rising, she cannot make a better net income.

Horn is applying for a loan, which is her second cycle, with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loan has been paid successfully and enabled her to improve her living standards and support her children’s education. She will use this new loan to buy fuel, organic pesticides and organic fertilizers to enrich the farmland. She hopes to earn more income to improve her living standard much better and provide family members with sufficient healthy food.

loans.use: to buy fuel, organic pesticides and organic fertilizers to enrich the farmland.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Liceth Katherine

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santísima Trinidad se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Liceth, tiene 23 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 2 años,  su  esposo trabaja en una fábrica de la localidad.
Doña Liceth es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar y crianza de su pequeño se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, carteras, bolsos entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también en su casa si así sus clientes lo prefieren, trabaja tres o cuatro días por semana, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 4  años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite ganar lo suyo.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, carteras, zapatos  y todo de lo que ella vende. Está en el Grupo de Crédito desde hace 3 años  y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños es tener un buen local.
texts.en:
The Santísima Trinidad credit group  meets every 15 days at Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño in the city of Manta. Is is a city that is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year-round, and for its unsurpassed beauty and many tourist attractions. 

This is where Liceth lives.  She is 23 years old, married, and has a two-year old child. Her husband works at a nearby factory. Liceth is a very good wife, who in order to help her husband with household expenses and raising the little one, sells all kinds of clothing - shoes, wallets, handbags and other things. She sells door-to-door and also from her house if her customers prefer, and works three or four days per week.  She sells to her customers on credit and collects every week. Liceth buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs more. She has been doing this for four years and it has enabled her to earn her own money. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise such as: pants, blouses, shirts, wallets, shoes, and everything else she sells. 

Liceth has been with the credit group for three years and she likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business.  Her dream is to have a good shop.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, wallets, shoes, etc.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 47 years old,married with 8 children and he supports other 3 adults. He has been in business for 2 years.He has asked for loan to purchase more crates of eggs for sale hoping this will help him get profit.

His dreams and hopes in future is to educate his children and establish his business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of eggs for his business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 61 years old, married with six children. 

Alma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Alma has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Thelma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from restaurant. Thelma is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to  buy items like coffee, chips, bread, noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell  for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like coffee, chips, bread, noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hen's Group

texts.en:
Hen is farmer living in Snoul district of Kratie province. She 45 years old and a mother of four dependent children, one of whom is in school and the other one is too young to attend school. To support her family’s living, Hen grows cassava as the main source of income. Sometimes, she works for others for a fee in order to supplement income. She has been in her business for eight years. 

Unfortunately, she now faces the challenges, which are the declining the price of crop products and the rising of paid workers fees. Therefore, she decides to apply for a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and this is the second cycle of her. She has repaid her past loan successfully. Through the previous loan, she has improved her living condition better. 

For this second loan, she will use her loan of 2,000,000KHR to buy organic herbicide to kill weeds in her farmland so that the crop can produce more outputs. She hopes that she can improve her family’s living standard by selling her crop products at good price.

loans.use: to buy organic herbicide to kill weeds in her farmland so that the crop can produce more outputs.

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Kampong Thom province, Khorn is 46 years old and a mother of four children. She grows rice and cassava as her main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. The problem that she face with her farming, she can get little yield because it no rain to support on her farm. She has involved her business for 20 years and earns her about 6,000KHR per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family can lives better health than before.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for the health and welfare of her family

loans.name: Chhon's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two dependent children living in Kampong Thom province, Chhon is 31 years old. She earns income to improve her family’s living via growing cassava on three hectares area. Moreover, she can get more income via working for others for a fee. She has involved this business for ages and it earns her about 25,000KHR per day. 

This is first time for Chhon with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can update her lifestyle living to be better than before.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for the better health of her family

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 50 years old and married with four children, one of whom in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 24 years.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 40 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Jenny is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

Jenny has been pig fattening for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of pig feed

loans.name: Atchera

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 36 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell copra business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF and she also sells charcoal.

Ma. Luz has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell copra for 8 years and also earns an income from buy and sell charcoal.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more brooms, oranges and Irish potatoes for selling.

loans.name: Gulzhan

texts.ru: Гулжан, 56 лет, замужем, многодетная мать-героиня 8 детей. На протяжении 13 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 8,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря неустанному труду и терпению, Гулжан успешно увеличила размеры своего небольшого бизнеса, и ежемесячная прибыль составила 11,800 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 28 овец. На 2,60 Га земли она выращивает картофель и ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития бизнеса и приумножения прибыли Гулжан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. На доходы от кредита Гулжан хочет и дальше развивать свой бизнес и построить дом.
texts.en: Gulzhan is 56, married, and a heroic mother of eight. She has over thirteen years of experience raising livestock and planting crops, having started her business with 8,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work and patience, Gulzhan successfully expanded her small business and earns 11,800 som (KGS) per month. She has four cows and 28 sheep and grows potatoes and barley on a 2.6 hectare plot of land. In order to develop her business and increase her profits, she applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to purchase a few more head of livestock. Gulzhan wants to use the earnings from the loan to continue expanding her business and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Khiun

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Khiun is 61 years old and a widow with three children, two of whom are dependent on her. To make a living, she has been growing rice for ages to earn the main income. Additionally, she works as a paid worker to earn supplement income. The rice farming business now is under great danger as lots of pests are destroying her cash crop. 

This will be her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her loan to prepare the land to grow crop, buy organic fertilizers and to pay for labor fees. She hopes to increase the crop productivity better to earn more income so that she can improve her living standard better.

loans.use: to prepare the land to grow crop, buy organic fertilizers and to pay for labor fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Michelle Mariana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santísima Trinidad se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señorita Michelle, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, ella estudia en una universidad de la localidad. 
Doña Michelle es una joven que le gusta trabajar para así ganarse lo propio y con sus recursos poder salir adelante con los gastos de sus estudios universitarios esperando algún día terminar su carrera y forjarse un mejor porvenir, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a vender por la localidad en sus ratos libres o en la universidad en la cual estudia,  deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada 8 días, lleva 1 año con su negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas y ropa interior. Lleva más 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le dan la oportunidad de ganar sus recurso y así salir adelante. Sus sueños son ser una gran profesional de la salud.
texts.en:
The Santísima Trinidad (Holy Trinity) Credit Group meets every 15 days in the citadel of Leonidas Proaño in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular throughout the year and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with several tourist attractions. 

Ms. Michelle lives here. She is 21 years old, single and lives in her parents’ house. She studies at a local university.  

Michelle is a young woman that likes to work to earn her own living and with her resources be able to pay for the expenses of her university studies – hoping one day to finish her degree and build a better life. 

She makes a living selling all types of clothing. Her method of selling is door to door, and she goes out to sell throughout the city in her free time and at the university where she studies. She allows her customers to pay by credit, and she charges every eight days. She has more than one year with her business, which has allowed her to get ahead.

This loan is to buy pants, blouses and underwear. She been with the credit group for more than three loan cycles, and she likes it because it gives her the opportunity to earn resources and move forward. Her dream is to be a health professional.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses and underwear.

loans.name: Sreypov's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Kampong Cham province, Sreypov is a 34-year-old and married mother of five children, four of whom are dependent on her. Two out of children are in school and the other two are under the school age. 

She has been selling crickets in her community for ages already. This three-year-old business is important to earn good income to support family. She sometimes works as a paid worker to earn additional income. 

This is the first time to her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); she will use her loan to buy more crickets to resell so that she can earn more income. She hopes to earn more income to improve the living standard and support her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy more crickets to resell so that she can earn more income.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santísima Trinidad se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive el señor José, tiene 29 años de edad, está divorciado y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 7 años el cual estudia en escuela y vive con él.
Don José es  un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y así sacar adelante a su hijo, el trabaja en una empresa que ofrece el servicio de instalaciones y mantenimientos  en sistemas de seguridad, el trabaja de lunes a viernes en este lugar por lo cual recibe un sueldo mensual, pero el necesita de sus propias herramientas que le ayudan a realizar su trabajo de una mejor forma para lo cual requiere del crédito ya que teniendo sus propias herramientas puede hacer trabajos de forma independiente y generar mejores ganancias para él.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar herramientas para su trabajo. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener su propia empresa de seguridad.
texts.en:
The Santísima Trinidad loan group meets twice a month in the Leonidas Proaño fort in the town of Manta. The town is well known for its popular beautiful beaches which are visited throughout the year, its beauty, and its many tourist attractions.

29-year old Sr. José lives here. He is divorced and has a 7-year old son who lives with him and attends school. José is a hardworking man who enjoys his work so he can help his son get on in life. He works for a company that installs and maintains security systems. He works five days a week and gets paid monthly.

José needs tools of his own so he can work independently and earn more money. For this reason he is seeking a loan. He has been with his loan group for two years and likes being a member as the loans are received quickly and are a great help. José's dream is to own his own security company.

loans.use: buy his own set of tools

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov the farmer lives in Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province is 35 years and a married mother of four children, three of whom are dependent on her. There is one child who is in school and needs better support for the study. Growing paddy rice is the main business which earns her good income to support family’s living. Sometimes, Pov works for others for a fee to supplement income and she raise pig for sale as an additional source of income to complement her family's needs. The main challenge she faces these days is that the crop products cannot be sold at good price in market. 

With hope, Pov is applying for a loan to save her family’s business. This is not the first time to her as she has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three times already. With the previous loan she got, she has improved the living condition better than before. The loan will be used to build a new pig cage and pig feed for her pig-raising business and to buy rice seeds to grow. She hopes that she can earn more income to update standard of living.

loans.use: to build a pig cage and pig feed for pig-raising business and to buy rice seeds to grow.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es: Don Buenaventura de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, el se dedica a la apicultura y al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa y ya tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mesas, cajas y tapaderas para las colmenas y así poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Buenaventura is 34 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and their three children.  

He is a beekeeper and also grows rice and beans which he has been doing for several years. He sells his products in the various markets that are near his house and he now has many customers. The money he earns from selling his products allows him to pay some of his household expenses.

He is asking for a loan so he can buy tables, boxes and lids for the hives, thereby being able to continue with his work which is his source of income.

loans.use: to buy tables, boxes and lids for his beehives.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a farming rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to pay for laborers salaries in farm preparation for her farming rice business.

Lydia has been in this business for 4 years. Lydia earns more income from buy and sell rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to pay for laborers salaries in farm preparation

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell and further build her business.

Eva successfully repaid her previous loan.  NWTF is presenting Eva's business profile again to support her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is a 42-year-old married woman with eight children.

She has raised pigs for 15 years and earns additional income operating a general store. Encarnacion is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 51 years old and widow with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, noodles, etc.

Francisca has been in this business for 9 years.

In the future Francisca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, noodles, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and steel laminate to build another room on his home.

loans.name: Jovel

texts.es: Jovel de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijas, el se dedica al cultivo de arroz bajo riego desde hace 30 años comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa el esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y poder continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Jovel is 65 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and four daughters. He has been growing rice in irrigated fields for 30 years, and selling his products in different markets near his home. He seeks a new loan to buy more fertilizers, manure, pesticide, etc. and thus be able to continue his work and have better income.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers, manure, pesticide, etc.

loans.name: 18 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “18 DE MAYO” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de CD, venta de blusas, venta de chamarras, venta de artefactos para el hogar, servicio de construcción, servicio de llantería. 
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de llantería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia ya que vio que por la zona donde ella vive no hay este servicio y con los pocos ahorros decidió emprender este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de herramientas nuevas de la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto, esta compra le ayudara a renovar sus herramientas  ya que están desgastadas, esta inversión le ayudará a ofrecer sus servicios de manera eficiente y rápida. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The 18 de Mayo Community Bank is beginning its seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación group. There are eight members and a board of directors led by Sra. Julia. The members have a variety of businesses such as selling food, selling CDs, selling blouses, selling jackets, selling housewares, construction services, and tire repair.

The loan they are seeking will benefit small businesswomen such as Julia. She has been a member of the group for three years and joined at the invitation of a friend who was already a client of the institution.

Currently Julia has a business repairing tires. She began the business on her own initiative and using her own small savings as she saw that no such service existed in the area.

The loan will be used to buy new tools from the 16 de Julio market in the town of El Alto. The tools she owns now are worn out. The purchase will enable her to offer a more efficient and quicker service. She will earn more money with which to help her family financially. Julia is married with three children.

Julia enjoys the training and the health classes that Pro Mujer offers.

loans.use: Buy tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard hails from Kararia village, situated in the Kapsowar region of Kenya. His home is on a small parcel of land where he practices livestock and crop farming. Richard is blessed with a lovely family. Richard ventured into farming 10 years ago. He relies on the help of his wife to run the farm, where they keep dairy cows and grow different varieties of crops. They also have trees on the farm that must be looked after from time to time. 

Richard is seeking a loan to buy seeds to venture into horticultural farming. Striking a balance between livestock farming and crop farming works out very well for farmers. The crop he plans to grow will provide him with an additional source of income besides the day job he holds to meet his family's needs. Crop produce will provide food for his family and fodder for his animals. He will also sell produce at the local market to make additional income to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy seeds to venture into horticulture farming

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en: Sauda is 35 years old, married, and has seven children. Two of her children go to school. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She operates a market stall where she sells fish and tomatoes. She started the business two years ago to earn a living; so far, the profits are remarkable. She is hard working and plans to expand the business, but she faces competition, which affects her profits. Sauda has requested a loan to buy fish and tomatoes for selling.

loans.use: To buy fish and tomatoes for selling.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a 52-year-old widowed woman living with her four children in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells fresh foods as a vendor in the markets. She also earns additional income from growing and selling cocoa. She is very hardworking, but is challenged by inadequate capital. She hopes to build a permanent house and also educate her children up to university level. Monica has requested a loan to buy more food like tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more food like tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is the youngest of seven children. He completed his secondary education in 2010 at Pumwani Boys High. However he did not manage to raise tuition fees to go to university. 

During his secondary schooling he was a member of Junior Achievement Kenya Company Program in 2009 where he was the procurement manager. Being involved in the company program nurtured his entrepreneurial skills. In 2013 he joined a savings group were they started as seven members contributing 1,000.00 KES every week. These savings helped him to finance his first business and sell second-hand dresses in Satellite Estate Riruta. 

He makes a profit of 5 000.00 KES per month. Currently they are 16 members in the savings group contributing 2,000.00 KES per week. This loan will enable Samuel to increase the stock.  He has opened another shop which is more accessible to customers.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand dresses.

loans.name: Esther Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTHER” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gumercinda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de carne, venta de ropa, venta de artefactos para el hogar, venta de frazadas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gumercinda es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que con el ahorro para un pequeño capital, inicio este  negocio hace varios años por iniciativa propia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de blusas y pantalones por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es viuda  y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de 
Salud y la capacitación que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Esther' will start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal Los Andes. It is made up of nine members and is lead by a governing board where Gumercinda is the chairwoman. The businesses that the members run are varied, among them there are selling food, selling meat, selling clothes, selling household goods and selling blankets.

The loan they will receive will benefit the small businesses where Gumercinda is a member. She says that four years ago she joined Pro Mujer after being invited by a friend who is a customer of the institution. She currently has a business selling clothes. After saving up a little capital she started this business several years ago with her own initiative. 

The loan that she will receive now is for increasing her capital (buying blouses and trousers in bulk) which she will get from the saleswomen of the city of El Alto and then she will sell it in her place of business. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially as she is a widow and has three children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health area and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy blouses and trousers in bulk.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Doña santos de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y ventas de chocolate y tamales, también vende pan francés, cuenta con mas de 15 años de dedicarse a esas actividades de la cuales ha podido salir adelante junto con su esposo, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda encementando el piso y colocando el techo pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de cemento, laminas, polines, arena y pago de mano de obra para que pueda tener una vivienda digna junto con su esposo.
texts.en:
55-year old Sra. Santos lives in her own house with her husband. She makes and sells chocolate and tamales, as well as French bread. She's had her business for over fifteen years and it has enabled her and her husband to get ahead.  

Now Santos wishes to make improvements to her house by putting in a concrete floor and a new roof. However, with what she earns she cannot afford this work. For this reason she is seeking a loan to buy cement, sheeting, beams, sand, and hire labourers. Then she and her husband will have a more comfortable home.

loans.use: Buy cement, sheeting, beams, sand, and hire labourers to put in a new floor and roof

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Doña Ana de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 5 años, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos con la ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She has had a small store located in her home for 5 years. She has many customers, especially her neighbors. With the income she receives she is able to meet her household expenses. She seeks a loan to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soda pop, candy, pastries, etc. and in this way have greater income resulting in a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soda pop, candy, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Edwin Franz

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene una hija de 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de pollo a la broaster.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, comprometido con su trabajo, dedicado, constante, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Pacajes’  caracterizada por encontrarse en la ruta en medio del camino hacia la localidad de Viacha ubicada en el altiplano central, al sudoeste de la ciudad. De clima frio y seco, con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Edwin es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica al mismo negocio y con su hija que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de adobe, ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de pollo a la broaster; él compra pollo a diario para prepararlo y freírlo en aceite, una vez frito lo sirve en un plato con papas fritas, arroz y llájua, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana desde medio día hasta media noche, “inicié mi negocio hace 2 años, poco a poco voy comprando herramientas e utensilios para continuar desarrollando mi emprendimiento…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son 7 días a la semana, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una máquina broastera para reponer la que tiene porque esta averiada. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, él desea realizar la compra de una máquina freidora para reponer la que tiene y continuar en el negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Edwin solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina freidora para reponer la que tiene y continuar en el negocio de pollo a la broaster.
texts.en:
Edwin is 35 years old and lives with his life partner. He has an eight-year-old daughter and his business is selling broaster chickens. He is a good father, enterprising, committed to his work, dedicated, steadfast, responsible and a very hard worker. 

His business is located in the 'Pacajes' zone, which is midway on the route to Viacha on the central altiplano, southwest of the city. The climate is cold and dry and the temperature ranges from 0 - 12 degrees centigrade (32 - 54 F) during the daytime. Edwin has a dark complexion, brown eyes, short black hair, is short in stature and has an average build. His native language is Aymará which he speaks at home, but he uses Spanish in general and with his business.

He shares his life with his life partner who does the same work as he does, and with their daughter who goes to school. They live in a house that is owned by the family and is built of adobe, brick and cement with a metal roof and cement floor. It has potable water, electricity, gas, and plumbing. 

He sells broaster chickens; he buys chicken every day, prepares it, fries it in oil, and serves it on a platter with french fries, rice and salsa. He does this every day of the week. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy a broasting machine to replace the one he has which is broken. His dream is to expand his business. He wants to buy a new frying machine to replace the one he has so he can keep his business running. This is his first loan sequence with the institution in the two years he has had his business. 

These are the reasons why Edwin is asking for a loan - to buy a frying machine to replace the one he has and keep his broaster chicken business running.

loans.use: to buy a new chicken fyer to replace his old one.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Myrna is 52 years old and has one child who is in school.

Myrna has a food vending business in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Myrna has been in this business for three years. In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace works hard to support her family. Mary Grace is married and has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 57 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, can goods, eggs, etc.

Lydia has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Lydia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, can goods, eggs, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to be able to improve the hallway of his home.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace varios años al cultivo de arroz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y así continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
The young person pictured here has his face blurred because he lives in a high-risk area and is 22 years old. He has been growing rice for several years and sells his product in the different markets that are near his house. 

He lives in his own house with his life partner and is asking for another loan so he can buy fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc. to continue with his work which generates a good income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Magaly Guadalupe

texts.es: Magaly de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 4 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de golosinas, aceite, granos básicos, refrescos, azúcar, etc. para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Magaly is 41 years old and lives in her own house with her three children. For the past four years she has run a small store out of her house,  With the money she makes from her sales she manages to get by. 

She is asking for another loan so she can buy snacks, oil, basic grains, soft drinks, sugar, etc. so she can keep selling and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy snacks, oil, basic grains, soft drinks, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Don Marcos de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar el se dedica desde hace 25 años al cultivo de maíz comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, Don Marcos esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Marcos, 51 years old, lives in his own house with his family. He has worked for the past 25 years growing corn; he sells his products in the nearby areas to where he lives. Marcos is asking for another loan to purchase fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, seeds, etc., and to improve the land that is shown in the photo to be able to continue with his work to have more income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, manure, pesticides, herbicides, seeds, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, and bricks to improve her house.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en:
Luciano is a father of 14 children; 10 are married already, and four are still single. At the age of 63, he is still aiming for the best for his family, so he is engaged in fishing. He catches fish and sells it to the market. He wants to give his family a good living; that's why he decided to take a loan to buy more fish to sell and be able to sell more fish in the market that will generate more income. 

Luciano's plan for the future is to save money from his business to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Belinda

texts.en:
Ma. Belinda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living growing rice and requests 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizers for her farm.

She supplements this income raising pigs and operating a general store.

Ma. Belinda wishes to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Crismen

texts.en:
Crismen is a hardworking entrepreneur with three children.

She has a clothing business and requests 23,000 PHP through NWTF  to buy clothes to sell to customers.

She earns additional income operating a general store.

Crismen wishes to save enough money  to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell to customers.

loans.name: Maria Helen

texts.en:
Maria Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a fish vending business for 25 years.  Maria Helen earns additional income raising pigs.

She is borrowing 19,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish.

Maria Helen has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish.

loans.name: Mylyn

texts.en:
Mylyn is a 40-year-old married woman with  seven children, six attend school.

Mylyn has sold veterinary products for 5 years and requests 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase veterinary products.

She has previously borrowed 19 times  from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mylyn would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase veterinary products.

loans.name: Salamat

texts.ru: Саламат, 62 года, вдова, 4 детей. Саламат на пенсии. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, в 2001 году Саламат начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство, на сегодня есть 6 коров, 15 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и сена. Прибыль от кредита позволит Саламат развить ее бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Salamat is 62 years old, a widow, and has four children. She is on a pension. As a source of income for her family, Salamat started working with livestock breeding in 2001. She started a business with an amount of 15,000 som (KGS), and today she has six cows and 15 sheep.

With an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep and hay. The income from the loan will allow Salamat to develop her business and increase the family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and hay for her livestock, in order to increase her income

loans.name: Gazelle Cherry

texts.en:
Gazelle Cherry is 37 years old. She is married with three children, two of whom are in school.

Gazelle Cherry works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Gazelle Cherry has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Gazelle Cherry aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Narcisa is 44 years old and has four children who are in school.

Narcisa has a buying and selling of souvenirs business in the Philippines. Narcisa requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like shirts, necklaces, shades, etc.

Narcisa has been in this business for two years. In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shirts, necklaces, shades, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Kry

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampong Cham province, Kry is 46-year-old. She is a mother of four children, only two whom are in school. For her living, she does rice farm is the main source of her family and her husband works as a carpenter to earn extra income. She has been in this business for twenty-six years. Crops have not grown well, which cause her to sell her crop at a low price. This is the main challenge for her in earning income to support her family. 

For Kry, this is the third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She improved her living standard from her past loans. She will take her entire new loan of 2,000,000KHR to buy raw materials for supporting her carpentry business. She hopes that this loan will be able to help her to have a better house to live in than before.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for supporting her carpentry business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Heme

texts.ru: Хеме, 47 лет, вдова, есть 5 детей. Хеме в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается торговлей продуктами питания. Стартовала Хеме в 2008 году, на сегодняшний день ее бизнес достаточно развит, помещение магазина в аренде.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Хеме обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку продуктов для увеличения товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Хеме планирует вкладывать в ремонт дома и хочет накопить на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Heme is 47 years old, a widow, and has five children. As a main source of income for her family, Heme works with selling food products. She started in 2008, and currently her business is quite developed. She rents the premises for the store. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Heme turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase products in order to increase her turnover of goods. Heme plans to invest the income from the loan in renovating her house and would like to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase food for selling, in order to increase the turnover in her shop

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
A young mother is 22-year-old, living in a remote area of the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district and Mom has two small children. Nowadays, she sells chicken as the main source of her family’s income and does rice farming to earn more income. She has been with both businesses for four years. She has a lot of competitive of sellers are the main challenge for her business. 

She is now applying for her first loan portion of 1,200,000KHR with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the group leader of three members, she will use her loan portion to buy chickens for resale. She hopes that this loan will expand her current business so to get more income to update her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy chicken for resale.

loans.name: Symbat

texts.ru: Сымбат, 26 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Сымбат среднее образование, на протяжении 8 лет занимается животноводством, у нее развитое хозяйство. На данный момент у Сымбат есть 5 коров, 11 овец. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сымбат обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации экологически-чистого молока. Доходы Сымбат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Symbat is 26 years old, married and the mother of two children. Symbat has a high school education. She has worked with livestock breeding for a period of eight years and has a developed farm. Currently she has five cows and 11 sheep. The total monthly income is around 20,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Symbat turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase dairy cows in order to increase the volume of ecological milk for selling. Symbat plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows, in order to increase the volume of ecological milk for selling

loans.name: Ya's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Ya is 39 years old and a mother of three children. To support her family’s living, she grows rice as her main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. 

Her rice was hit by drought because it has not enough water to support her rice farm. She has been involved in her business for 21 years, and she can save her daily income of about 30,000 KHR per day. 

For Ya, this is her third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. With her past loans, she could get a decent income to update her living and send her children to school. In a group of four, she is a group leader. She will use her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support her rice farm to get a good yield. She hopes that she can get more income to update her family's condition and wants to buy a decent motorbike to support her farming.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support her rice farm to get a good yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Soeng's Group

texts.en:
Soeng is a mother of five children, is 53-year-old and she lives in Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district. The sources of her family’s living income are from rice farming, alcohol distilling and pigs raising for fifteen years. Her crops have been destroyed by insect pests is the main challenge for her farming. 

This is the first loan cycle for her with VisionFund. She is now leading a group of six members to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund and she will manage her entire loan portion to spend on buying seed, fertilizer for her farm and pigs for raising to grow her income. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income so to upgrade her family’s living.

loans.use: to spend on buying seed, fertilizer for her farm and pigs for raising to grow her income.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Young Stars S.hg Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Peter. He is aged 25 years old and joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development. 

He practices farming and specializes in growing maize, beans and potatoes which he supplies to the local market. 

He is taking a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs in an effort to increase production. 
With increased income he will be able to meet his family basic needs e.g. food,clothing and education for his children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs to increase crop produce for more income to pay for food, clothing and school fees for his children.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra  is 28 years old, widow and a mother of one child. She lives with her parents, her father is also shown in the photo. She initiated her business of milk sales to help her family in bearing everyday expenditures. She has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

Currently she has availed for a Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es: Reina de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 5 años, vende sus productos de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Reina, 31 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and child. She has worked selling clothing for the past 5 years. She sells her products as a street vendor in the different markets. She is asking for another loan to purchase more clothing in bulk to be able to continue with her sales and in this way have more income.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, el posee un taller de costura ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 15 años inicio con su trabajo a causa del desempleo, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza su trabajo, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Miguel, 49 years old, lives in his own house with his mother. He has had a tailoring shop located in his house for the past 15 years. He began with his work because of unemployment. He has many customers due to the quality with which he does his work. He is asking for a loan to purchase thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastics, etc. and in this way to be able to continue with his work, which generates good earnings for him.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastics, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, wood, nails, etc. to be able to install the roof on her house and have better living conditions for her family.

loans.name: Rolando Arnulfo

texts.es: Rolando de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la reparación y venta de llantas también posee lavado de carros, tiene un año y medio de experiencia en su negocio el cual esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo y enrejandolo pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para hacerlo por eso esta solicitando a INTEGRAL  un crédito para la compra de laminas, polines, rejas y pago de mano de obra así pueda tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en: Rolando is 37 years old and lives in his own home with his family. He works repairing and selling tires, and he also has a car wash. He has had his business for 1.5 years and it is located in his home. He wants to improve his home, replacing the roof and adding security bars but with what he earns from work he doesn't have enough capital. Therefore he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan in order to buy steel laminate, structural beams, steel bars, and pay for labor, resulting in a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy steel laminate, structural beams, steel bars, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru: Аида, 44 года, замужем, есть 7 детей. У нее - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, 24 года занимается полеводством и животноводством. У Аиды в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 5 овец, 2 лошади. На 2,56 Га земли она выращивает картофель, перец, клевер. Благодаря упорному труду Аиды и ее дружной семьи, бизнес приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере до 23,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья и на полеводство. Доходы от кредита Аида планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса и приобретение легкового автомобиля для ее семьи.
texts.en:
Aida is 44 years old, married and has seven children. She has vocational education. As a main source of income for her family, she has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation for 24 years. 

Aida has four cows, five sheep and two horses on her farm. She grows potatoes, peppers and clover on 2.56 hectares of land. Thanks to Aida and her closely knit family's persistent work, the business brings in a monthly income up to 23,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Aida turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 125,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock for increasing her heard and for cultivating her land. Aida plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business and in purchasing a car for her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to increase her herd, and to cultivate her land

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.ru: Уулкан, 54 года, замужем, есть 2 сыновей. У нее высшее образование, по характеру она ответственный, порядочный человек. Работает налоговым инспектором, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода, много лет назад она начала заниматься разведением скота и полеводством. Уулкан приложила все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, на сегодняшний день ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет до 25,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров и овец для откорма и реализации. В будущем, Уулкан планирует и дальше расширять свою деятельность, она хочет накопить на постройку времянки.
texts.en:
Uulkan is 54 years old, married and has two sons. She has higher education. As a person she is responsible and respectable. She works as a tax inspector. 

In search of an additional source of income, Uulkan started working with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation many years ago. She put all her strength into her business. Currently the monthly income is up to 25,000 som (KGS).

To further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase cows and sheep for fattening and reselling. In the future, Uulkan plans to further expand her business. She would like to save money for constructing a makeshift building.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and cows for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen  has successfully built her business of general store with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By the time she has attained good number of customers and makes good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. 

Now she has applied a loan of 50000 PKR to purchase more stock of grocery items such as grains, sugar, oil, flour for catering maximum customers.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of grocery items such as grains, sugar, oil, flour for catering to the maximum number of customers.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman who works hard to support her family.  She has sold fish for 10 years and requests 10,000 PHP to purchase more fish.

In the future, Imelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Petros

texts.en:
Petros has repaired  cars for 20 years in his  small garage. 

Petros lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region with his wife and his retired mother. His son  is in Russian Federation and work abroad. He sends money which helps to meet his family's needs. 

He is a master mechanic and repairs cars. His customers trust him and he does his best to work professionally and quickly so that once they visit his garage they become his regular customers. This loan of 200.000 AMD  will be used  to update his equipment and buy some tools. 

The new tools should help to increase his customer base and his family's income.

loans.use: to purchase tools.

loans.name: Blessed Mothers Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Violet, 37 years old, married and a mother of two children. She joined Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training especially enterprise development.

She practices mixed farming; crop and poultry. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy manure to boost crop produce and poultry feeds to increase poultry production. With increased income, she will be able to pay for her children education and provide better clothing for them.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure and poultry feeds to increase crop and poultry production for more income to pay school fees and provide better clothing for her children.

loans.name: Grupo San Miguelito Nuevo Group

texts.es:
Miguel (el primero del lado derecho de la fotografía de playera color morado) es un hombre de 57 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su linda familia de seis hijos de las edades entre 10 y 19 años, en la comunidad denominada San Miguelito. Miguel por ser  un hombre que le encanta compartir con la naturaleza, desde hace algún tiempo se ha dedicado a la siembra y venta de café, gracias a esta labor ha sacado adelante a su familia. Miguel hace algún tiempo ha sembrado unas cuerdas de café que en estos días ya necesitan de su mantenimiento, pero una de las dificultades que él tiene es no contar con el capital suficiente, es por ello que ahora ha tomado la decisión de organizar a un grupo de personas para juntos solicitar un crédito que lo invertirán el compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra.
El gran sueño de Miguel es poder construir dos casas de block para que su familia tenga mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel (the first on the right of this photograph in the purple t-shirt) is 57 years old. He is single and lives with his beautiful family of six children between the ages of 10 and 19 in a community called San Miguelito. As Miguel is a man who loves to be with nature, a while ago he started to grow and sell coffee. Thanks to this work he has gotten his family ahead in life. A while ago he sewed some rows of coffee which now need to be maintained, but one of the difficulties that he has is that he does not have sufficient capital. This is why he has taken the decision to organise a group of people to apply for a loan which he will use to buy fertilisers and to pay for labour.
The big dream of Miguel is to be able to build two houses with block walls so that his family can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, wood, nails and wire an din this way be able to make the changes to his house and provide his family with more comfort.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 3 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y así poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: The young woman whose face has been pixelated is 25 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has earned a living growing corn and beans for three years. She sells the produce in the different markets close to her home. She lives in her own home with her family. She is asking for another loan to buy more fertilisers, manure, seeds, weed killer, etc. and to improve the land that can be seen in this photograph and in this way earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy more fertilisers, manure, seeds, weed killer, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijas, ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y maicillo desde hace 5 años, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, Marta esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y también mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Marta is 40 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and their two daughters, She works in agriculture, and has grown corn and sorghum for 5 years. She sells her products nearby to where she lives. Marta is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, compost, pest control, herbicide, and to do some improvements on the land in the photograph. This is to continue her work, which generates good profits for her.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost, pest control, herbicide, and also do improvements on the land.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a married woman with 1 child who works hard to support her family by raising pigs.

Nelia requests 10,000 PHP to buy feed and other supplies for her business of 20 years.

She earns additional income from food vending.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Young Stars S.hg Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Faith, aged 20 years old. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training especially enterprise development.  

She practices farming and also operates a grocery shop. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy more fruits and vegetables so as to add stock to her greengrocer store to enable her to increase her income. This will enable her meet her family's basic needs e.g. food and clothing at ease. 

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for resale and earn more income to pay for family's basic needs e.g. food and clothing.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, the jovial lady in the photo is 48 years old, married and a mother of 7 children; four of her children are currently attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the trainings especially enterprise development.

She practices vegetables and poultry farming and recently, opened a kiosk to supplement her income. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy more vegetables and fruits for her kiosk. She believes that this will attract more customers hence more income that she will use to buy school uniforms for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for her Kiosk for increased income to buy school uniforms for her children.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is a 40-year-old man with 2 children who lives in Bundibugyo Uganda.  He grows cocoa and sells it to cocoa companies. He earns additional income raising livestock.  His main challenge is limited capital. 

He hopes to improve  his cocoa business in future, build a permanent house, and educate his  children.  He will use the loan to pay labor costs.

loans.use: to pay for laborers.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell personal collection.  Analyn is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kamunyu-Ini Women Group

texts.en:
Phyllis is a 38-year-old and a mother of 5 children, shown in the photo with her hand raised. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from enterprise development training. 

She grows vegetables and raises dairy cows. She will use the loan to buy cattle feed to boost her income. She will be able to pay for her family's food, clothing, and educate her children. 

Phyllis is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is aged 22 years, married and a mother of one child. In the year 2013, she joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the training especially enterprise development.

She practices dairy farming and also runs a small shop whereby she sells clothes, shoes, basins and other household items.
She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy dairy feeds to increase milk production for increased income to enable her pay for her child’s education needs e.g school fees,school uniform and reading materials.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed to increase milk production for increased income to pay for her child's education needs e.g school fees, uniforms and reading materials.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro vive  en la comunidad de Colon, Honduras y desde la edad de 13 años se dedica a la ganadería y actualmente ha implementado  la fabricación de productos lácteos.
Junto a  su esposa Selma luchan por darles un mejor futuro a  sus tres hijos dos de los cuales están en la escuela , y una de sus mayores aspiraciones  es hacer crecer su negocio a través de la venta de otros productos de consumo alimenticio ya que en la comunidad donde vive no cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica por lo que sus habitantes deben caminar largas distancias y hacer su recorrido en una balsa para poder hacer sus compras, por lo cual esta solicitando financiamiento a Soluz Honduras para la adquisición de un Frezer Solar y de esa manera poder brindar a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos  e incrementar sus ingresos y así mismo dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Teodoro lives in the community of Colon, Honduras and, since the age of 13, he has worked raising animals and currently he has begun to make dairy products.

With his wife, Selma, he struggles to give a better future to their three children, two of whom are in school. One of his greatest aspirations is to grow his business through the sale of other food products since in the community where he lives, there is no electrical service, so the residents have to walk long distances and make their trips on a raft to be able to do their shopping. So, he asks Soluz Honduras for a loan to get a solar freezer and in this way be able to offer his customers a wider variety of products and increase his income and also give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a solar freezer system which will be a great benefit to his business.

loans.name: El Altiplano Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL ALTIPLANO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yuli ella es soltera y tiene 35 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar telares,tejidos y chompas.

 
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de zapatos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de carteras.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the El Altiplano communal bank. This bank is located in Anta district, which is part of Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Yuli, she is single and 35 years old. The member works at her craft business, she sells knit goods, sweaters, blankets and woven goods. She sells different knit and woven goods. She works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm. Through this business, she gets her children ahead. The member has had this business for some years now and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her business selling woven and knit goods. The member asks for the loan to purchase woven goods, knit goods and sweaters.

The other members work at a business selling clothing, a business selling footwear, a grocery store business and a business selling wallets. 

The member is grateful to those who are a part of this dream through this platform and promises to make the payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase knit and woven goods and sweaters.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a married woman with two children who works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business and earns additional income selling dry goods.  Geraldine is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional wood, nails, varnish, and maintain her business.

Geraldine has  sustained her business through 3 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, varnish, and maintain her business.

loans.name: Carmen Delia

texts.es:
Carmen is 51 years old and lives with her husband in Medellín, the capital of Antioquia. Since 2013 she has been running her own store, which she set up by herself, and where she can be found for 10 hours a day, Monday through to Sunday.

She wishes to have a more varied inventory and so would like to use this loan to buy more stock, so that she can offer a range of products to her customers whilst simultaneously increasing her sales.  

Carmen dreams of being able to afford a new home so she can enjoy a greater quality of life and be proud of what she has achieved with her business.
texts.en:
Carmen is 51 years old and lives with her husband in Medellín, the capital of Antioquia. Since 2013 she has been running her own store, which she set up by herself, and where she can be found for 10 hours a day, Monday through Sunday.

She wishes to have a more varied inventory and so would like to use this loan to buy more stock, so that she can offer a range of products to her customers whilst simultaneously increasing her sales.

Carmen dreams of being able to afford a new home so she can enjoy a greater quality of life and be proud of what she has achieved with her business.

loans.use: to stock her corner shop.

loans.name: Grupo Xojola Nuevo Integrante Group

texts.es:
Antonio (el primero del lado izquierdo de la foto)es un hombre de 47 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 16 y 22 años, esta  humilde familia vive en una comunidad de la aldea Xojola. Antonio para poder obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica al cultivo y venta de café, él tiene quince años de ejercer esta labor. Antonio afortunadamente vive en una de las zonas más fértiles, es por ello que durante varios años ha logrado conseguir buena cosecha de café, y durante este tiempo él se ve a la necesidad de brindarle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café por lo que deberá comprar una serie de insumos agrícolas, aunque para poder comprarlos el necesita de una buena cantidad de dinero  por tal motivo junto a su grupo solicita un préstamo para cubrir esta necesidad de su cultivo.
El gran sueño de Antonio es poder aumentar el volumen de su cultivo para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
