Antonio (first from the left in the photo) is a 47 year old man. He is married and has a beautiful family of two children, aged 16 and 22. This humble family lives in a community of the town of Xojola. In order to obtain income and support his family, Antonio grows and sells coffee. He has been doing this work for 15 years. Fortunately, Antonio lives in one of the most fertile areas. That is why for several years he has been able to obtain a good coffee harvest and during that time it has been necessary to do maintenance on his coffee crop, for which he must buy a series of agricultural materials, although to buy them he needs a good quantity of materials. That is why his group is asking for a loan to cover this necessity for his crop.  

Antonio's big dream is to be able to increase the volume of his crop to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials.

loans.name: Sarafeen

texts.en:
Sarafeen is a 47 years old, married woman. She is shown in the photo with her husband.  She is been involved in the business of the cloth trade. She purchases variety of cloth at low prices from city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. 

Sarafeen has requested for a Murabaha loan of 15000 PKR. She wants to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Banteay Meanchey province’s Mongkul Borey district, Thea is 33-year-old and she is a mother of four children. The sources of her family’s living income are from working for others for a fee, raising pigs and cows for eight years. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one loan cycle already and completely paid back the past loan. The previous loan has helped her to have enough household supplies for her family’s uses and she can keep her children in school and improve her family’s living. 

As the group leader of four members, she will ask for new loan of 200,000KHR in order to renovate her old house for more comfortable living. She hopes her family will be able to have a better house to stay in than before.

loans.use: to renovate her old house to make her living more comfortable..

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Lari Pioneer Vegetable Processors (C.b.o) Group

texts.en:
Teresiah is the 32-year- old single woman shown in the photo.  She has two children, both are in primary school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from the enterprise development training.
 
Teresiah operates a beauty salon and grows potatoes. She will use the loan to buy cosmetics to sell in the salon. She hopes that this will help her expand her  business and earn more income to provide food, clothing, and medical care for her family.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy beauty cosmetics.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from enterprise development training. He grows potatoes, cabbage, and raises dairy cows. He is applying for Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and certified seeds. This will enable him to increase production and earn more income to provide food and clothing for his family. 

He is 59 years old, married, and blessed with 3 children. 

Lawrence is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and certified seeds.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity thanks Kiva for the previous loan, through which she bought more assorted fruits and vegetables hence increased the stock to her green grocer store. This increased her income and was able to meet her family's basic needs with ease e.g. food and clothing.  She repaid her loan promptly.

She is now borrowing an additional Kiva loan to further boost her greengrocer business by buying more vegetables and fruits e.g. cabbages, kale, tomatoes, mangoes, pineapples and oranges. This will further increase her income to enable her continue meeting her family basic needs e.g food and clothing with ease.

She is grateful to Kiva for the continued financial support.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for increased income to pay for family's basic needs e.g. food and clothing.

loans.name: Amigas Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS EMPRENDEDORAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eimy es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de donas y empanadas, venta de ropa, venta de muebles, venta de gorras, venta de comida, venta de café.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eimy es integrante, ella indica que hace nueve años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de donas y empanadas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá hace varios seis años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina y azúcar  por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  la capacitación que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The “AMIGAS EMPRENDEDORAS” group will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. The group consists of 8 members and is led by a round talbe whre Eimy is the President.

The members have various businesses such as: selling donuts and turnovers, selling clothing, selling furniture, selling hats, selling food, selling coffee. The loan will benefit each of their businesses. Eimy has been a member of Pro Mujer for 9 years, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution.

Today she has a business selling donuts and turnovers. She learned this work from her mother 6 years ago. The loan she seeks is to increase capital so she can buy flour and sugar at wholesale from vendors in El Alto city, and then she will make and sell her products in the El Alto city market. This work will enable her to generate income to support her family economically, as she is single and has a son. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar at wholesale.

loans.name: Villa Rosario Group

texts.es:
Natividad es una mujer de 43 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 17 años, y se dedica a la costura.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiten, conatantre, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘El torno’ caracterizado por el acopio y comercio de productos agrícolas como, frutas, verduras, carne, etc., donde acuden los distribuidores mayoristas a comprar por camionada las frutas y verduras que después repartirán por toda la ciudad. De clima sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
 Natividad es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (está sentada). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en construcción y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Debido a la necesidad de ampliar su negocio, en esta ocasión lidera la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios son; servicio de moto taxi, comercio de semillas y abono, taller de chapería, venta de ropa de segunda mano, comercio de medicina natural, venta de comida y venta de verduras, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades.  Su negocio es la costura; ella se dedica a arreglar todo tipo de prendas de vestir en cuanto a; largo de bota pie, ancho de cintura, roturas, enmiendas, etc., “aquí donde vivimos la ropa se malogra rápidamente por eso mis clientes son constantes y también confecciono  pantalones  y otras prendas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para abrir un taller de costura y confeccionar pantalones para vender por mayor. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Natividad solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para abrir un taller de costura y confeccionar pantalones para vender por mayor.
texts.en:
Natividad is a 43-year-old woman who lives with her partner, has 2 children, ages 15 and 17, and works in sewing. 

She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, reliable, optimistic, responsible, and very hard-working. Her business is located in the El Torno area, characterized by collecting and selling agricultural products such as fruit, vegetables, meat, etc., where the wholesale distributors come and purchase by the truckload the fruit and vegetables which they later sell through the whole city. It has a sub-tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade.  

Natividad has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair that she keeps tied up in a ponytail, is short, of a medium physique, her native language is Guaraní which she speaks locally and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business that she does (she is seated). She shares her life with her partner who works in construction, and with her children who go to school. They live in a house that the family owns, built of wood with a roof of metal sheeting and a cement floor which has well water drawn by a pump and electricity, but which doesn't have sewer service. Due to the need to expand her business, at this time she is leading a business loan group. The businesses are a motorcycle taxi service, selling seeds and manure, an autobody shop, second-hand clothing sales, selling natural medicines, selling food, and selling vegetables. They joined together to ask for a loan to improve their businesses. Her business is sewing. She works altering all sorts of clothing such as boot-bottom length, the width of the waist, fixing tears, making modifications, etc. "Here, where we live, the clothing gets ruined quickly so my customers are continual and I also make pants and other clothing..." she says. The advantage of her business is that she has regular customers. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy an industrial sewing machine. Her dream is that her children become professionals. She wants to purchase an industrial sewing machine to open a sewing shop and make pants to sell in bulk. This is her third loan cycle with the institution in the 10 years she has been doing this work. 

For these reasons, Natividad asks for a loan to purchase an industrial sewing machine to open a sewing shop and make pants to sell in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine to open a sewing workshop and make pants to sell in bulk.

loans.name: Jessica Viviana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santísima Trinidad se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Jessica, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 13, 11, 4 y 2 años de edad, tres estudian en colegio, escuela y jardín de infantes, el marido trabaja en una empresa de seguridad. 
Doña Jessica es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para sacar adelante su hogar, ella  tiene un pequeño asadero de pollos en su casa, allí trabaja todas las tardes y noches ofreciendo el rico pollo con arroz, menestra, patacones o papas fritas y toda clase de bebidas. Con ella trabajan tres personas a quienes les paga un sueldo mensual. Tiene más de 3 años con su negocio el cual le deja muy buenas satisfacciones ya que además de ganarse algo también está al tanto de las necesidades de sus pequeños.
Este crédito es para comprar pollos, arroz, papas otros víveres necesarios para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque  los créditos le permiten mejorar su negocio cada día más. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The credit group “Santísima Trinidad” meets every 15 days in the neighborhood Leonidas Proaño in the city of Manta. Manta is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are frequently visited year round. It is also known as a city with unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

It is here that Jessica lives. She is 32 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She has four children from this relationship, who are 13, 11, 4 and 2 years old. Three of her children are in school attending high school, elementary school and kindergarten. Her husband works for a security company. 

Jessica is a woman who likes to work in order to help her family get ahead. She has a small chicken spit-roaster in her home. Here she works every afternoon and night offering delicious chicken with rice, lentils, fried plantains or French fries and every type of beverage. Three other people work with her and she pays them monthly wages. 

She has had her business for over 3 years, which makes her very satisfied now that she not only earns money, but also is able to keep on top of her children’s needs. This loan is to purchase chickens, rice, potatoes and other provisions necessary for food production. She has been in the credit group for three years and she likes it because the loans allow them to better their businesses more and more each day. Her dream is to have her own large venue.

loans.use: to buy chickens, rice, potatoes and other provisions.

loans.name: Elkin Dario

texts.es:
Elkin is a 24 year old pig farmer who lives in Concordia, located in the municipality of Itagüí. With the help of his father he began his business last year, as he recognized he would need to provide for his beautiful new-born daughter who is now 6 months old. 

He wishes to improve his business by purchasing extra produce to fatten his pigs, as well as more piglets. He hopes this investment will have a great impact on his farm, allowing him to create more jobs, increase his inventory and sales, and help him to grow his clientele base. 

As a devoted father, Elkin dreams of buying a new home for his family and being able to provide his daughter with a bright future and a great education, and it is for this reason that he works so tirelessly every day. Your help can be instrumental in making this dream come true!
texts.en:
Elkin is a 24-year-old pig farmer who lives in Concordia, located in the municipality of Itagüí. With the help of his father he began his business last year, as he recognized he would need to provide for his beautiful new-born daughter who is now 6 months old. 

He wishes to improve his business by purchasing extra produce to fatten his pigs, as well as more piglets. He hopes this investment will have a great impact on his farm, allowing him to create more jobs, increase his inventory and sales, and help him to grow his clientele base. 

As a devoted father, Elkin dreams of buying a new home for his family and being able to provide his daughter with a bright future and a great education, and it is for this reason that he works so tirelessly every day. Your help can be instrumental in making this dream come true!

loans.use: to purchase pigs and piglets

loans.name: Corazon De Maria Group

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer de 22 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo recién nacido, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madr, emprendedora, dicidida, optimista, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘El torno’ ubicado a 32 kilómetros al suroeste, es una ciudad intermedia, Sus calles son completamente pavimentadas con diversas construcciones habitacionales que se levantan en ambos lados de la moderna carretera doble vía, por donde cruzan los viajeros hacia el interior del país. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Diana es de tez trigueña, ojos marrones, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (está sentada a la derecha, viste calza naranja y polera blanca). Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no cuenta con alcantarillado. La necesidad por pagar los gastos postnatales de su bebe recién nacido la obligó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de cosméticos por catálogo, servicio de moto taxi, taller de cerrajería, venta de leche, venta de empanadas, venta de refrescos y venta de ropa de segunda mano, para solicitar un préstamo y obtener mejores ingresos. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, ella cocina; majadito (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito), locro  (sopa de: carne deshidratada, carne cortada en pedacitos, yuca y huevo), sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso), y otros. Su rutina diaria consiste en preparar una comida por día para salir en su carrito de 2 ruedas  a vender de forma ambulante, “las necesidades de mi bebé me animaron a independizarme, sobretodo porque todo el tiempo tengo que cuidarlo y también trabajar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede trabajar y cuidar a su bebé, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina, como; arroz, papa, yuca, fideo, carnes, aceite, etc. Su sueño es darle una mejora calidad de vida a su bebé, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina para contar con material de trabajo constantemente. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Diana solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para contar con material de trabajo constante y con las ganancias pagar los gastos postnatales de su bebé.
texts.en:
Diana is 22 years old, single, and has a newborn baby boy.  Her occupation is selling meals. Diana is a good mother, enterprising, dedicated, optimistic, patient, responsible and very hard working. 

Her business is located in 'El Torno' which is 32 kilometers to the southwest and is a medium sized city. Its streets are completely paved and several residential buildings rise from both sides of the modern two-lane road which is used by travelers on their way to the interior of the country. It has a warm, sub-tropical climate and temperatures range during the day from 21 to 35 degrees centigrade (70 to 95 F). Diana has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair tied in a pony-tail, and she is short and stocky in stature. Her native language is Guaraní  which she speaks at home, but she uses Spanish in general and for her business. (She is seated on the right, wearing orange shoes and a white shirt.) 

Her parents work and she lives at their house which is owned by the family. It is built of wood and has a metal roof and cement floor. It has pumped well water and electricity, but no plumbing. 

The need to pay for postnatal expenses for her newborn baby inspired her to establish a bank of people with businesses so they could apply for a loan and earn more income.  Their businesses include: catalog cosmetics sales; motorcycle taxi service; locksmith shop; milk sales; empanada sales; soft drink sales; and second-hand clothing sales. Diana sells traditional foods and she makes: majadito (dehydrated meat, rice, fried egg and fried plantain), locro (soup made of dehydrated meat, chopped meat, yucca and egg), peanut soup, rice with cheese, and others. Her daily routine consists of preparing one dish per day to take out on her two-wheeled cart to sell on the street. "My baby's needs inspired me to become independent, especially because I need to take care of him all the time and work too..." she comments. 

The advantage of her job is that she can work and take care of her child; but the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy kitchen supplies such as rice, potatoes, yuca, noodles, meats, oil, etc. Her dream is to give her baby a better quality of life.

She wants to buy kitchen supplies so that she will always have what she needs on hand. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the three years that she has been doing this work. These are the reasons why Diana is asking for a loan - to buy kitchen supplies so she will have her work materials readily available, and pay for the baby's postnatal expenses.

loans.use: to buy kitchen supplies.

loans.name: Maxine Renee

texts.en:
Maxine Rennee, a hardworking woman with two children, earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She supplements this income by selling gasoline.

Having repaid her previous loan, Maxine Rennee has requested a new one for PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs. She dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 35 years old, married, and has one child. Her child currently attends school. Maribel works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, detergent soap, etc. 

Maribel has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future, Maribel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, detergent soap, etc.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie works hard to support her family. She has been selling vegetables in the Philippines for five years now.

Merlie has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Adriana Patricia

texts.es:
Adriana is 43 years old and lives with her husband and their 15 year old daughter in the rural town of Fresno, Rionegro, where she has run a pig farm for the past 10 years.

She is extremely hard working, only taking Sundays off so that she can spend time with her family. She would like to take out a loan of $4,500,000 COP to refurbish the pigsty, purchase more pigs and piglets, and a buy a bulk sum of pig feed.

Adriana hopes that she can use this investment as an opportunity to improve both her business and provide a greater future for her daughter, improving her the home that they live in a paying for her university education.
texts.en:
Adriana is 43 years old and lives with her husband and their 15-year-old daughter in the rural town of Fresno, Rionegro. She has run a pig farm for the past 10 years.

She is extremely hard working, only taking Sundays off so that she can spend time with her family. She would like to take out a loan of 4,500,000 COP to refurbish the pig sty, purchase more pigs and piglets, and buy pig feed in bulk. 

Adriana hopes that she can use this investment as an opportunity to improve her business and to provide a greater future for her daughter. She wants to improve the home that they live in and pay for her daughter's university education.

loans.use: to refurbish the pig sty, purchase more pigs and piglets, and buy pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Gildardo

texts.es:
Gildardo es un hombre con 36 años de edad, dedicado a realizar trabajos de construcción, algo que aprendió empíricamente.
Su tiempo laborando depende de los trabajos que tenga, así es que logra obtener los ingresos mínimos para cubrir las necesidades que su hogar amerita.

Debido a la falta de herramientas e implementos de construcción, Gildardo pide un auxilio económico con el cual comprara martillos, alicates, palustre entre otros.

Su mayor sueño es ver su casa bonita, ya que esta con el tiempo se ha ido deteriorando.

Este hombre espera su ayuda para continuar creciendo como empresario, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Gildardo is 36 years old and works in construction, a skill he learned empirically. The time he spends working depends on the jobs that he has which is how he manages to obtain minimum wages to cover his household needs.

Due to the lack of tools and construction materials, Gildardo asks for a loan with which he will buy hammers, pliers and trowels, among other items. His greatest dream is to see his house look beautiful, as it has now deteriorated over time. 

This man is hoping for your help to continue growing as a businessman; please make a loan.

loans.use: to buy hammers, pliers and trowels, among other items.

loans.name: Santos Cristobal

texts.es:
Santos Cristóbal es originario de Nicaragua, vive en una comunidad rural de Jinotega, con su esposa y 4 hijos con edades entre 10 y 17 años. Desde hace más de 6 años cuenta con su pequeña finca de 1.76 Hectáreas de las cuales 1.4 son de café; rubro que produce bajo los criterios de certificación de comercio justo.

En los últimos 3 años su producción de café pergamino ha sido de 50 quintales en promedio. Su meta este año, es mejorar la nutrición de sus cafetos; y así mismo mejorar los rendimientos de su finca y hacer frente a los precios bajos del mercado con un mayor volumen. Para ello solicita un financiamiento que le permita comprar los insumos agrícolas que requiere su cafetal y asegurar una buena cosecha.

Este pequeño empresario rural siempre ha sido muy cuidadoso de invertir los financiamientos recibidos en las actividades para las cuales lo solicita, logrando hasta ahora buenos resultados. A medida que sus ingresos vayan aumentando, su visión es comprar más terreno para diversificar más su finca con otros rubros como ganado, cacao y granos básicos y disminuir riesgos.
texts.en:
Santos Cristóbal is from Nicaragua and lives in a rural community in Jinotega with his wife and four children with aged between 10 and 17 years old. For more than six years, he has counted on his small farm of 1.76 hectares of which 1.4 are coffee; it's produced under the criteria of the fair trade certification.

In the past three years his production of parchment coffee has been 50 quintals (about 5,000 lbs) on average. His goal this year is to improve the nutrition of his coffee plantation and likewise improve his farm yields and cope with low market prices with higher volumes. For this he asks for financing to enable him to purchase fertilizer which his coffee plantation requires to ensure a good harvest.

This small rural entrepreneur has always been careful to invest the borrowed funds into the activities that he requested them for, achieving good results so far. As his revenue increases, his vision is to buy more land to diversify their farm with other items such as cattle, cocoa and basic grains and therby reduce risks.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer which his coffee plantation requires to ensure a good harvest.

loans.name: Mizel

texts.en:
Mizel works hard to support her family. She has had a seaweed cultivating business in the Philippines for the past three years.

Mizel has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase plastic rope, bottles and seaweed seedlings. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase plastic rope, bottles and seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Xexac 5.2 Group

texts.es:
Maria (la primera del lado derecho de blusa color morado) es una  mujer de 30 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su hijo de nueve años en una comunidad de denominada Xexac. Para poder obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia Maria se dedica al cultivo y venta de café, esta actividad lo realiza ella desde hace ocho años, afortunadamente el lugar donde vive Maria es una zona muy fértil por lo que ha logrado buena cosecha de café, Maria viendo sus necesidades a organizado a un grupo de señoras para juntas poder adquirir un crédito que lo invertirán en la compra de insumos agrícolas para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café.
El gran sueño de Maria es tener la oportunidad de poder adquirir 10 cuerdas de terreno para incrementar su cultivo de café.
texts.en:
Maria (the first on the right-hand side with the purple blouse) is a 30-year-old single woman who lives with her ​​nine year old son in a community called Xexac. To gain their income and raise her family, Maria makes a living with the cultivation and sale of coffee. She's been doing this activity for eight years. Fortunately, Maria lives in a very fertile area, which is why she has achieved good coffee harvests. Maria, seeing the need, has organized a group of women so that together they may acquire a loan that will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer to give maintenance to her coffer crop.

Maria's great dream is to have the opportunity to buy 10 cuerdas (about 2.8 acres) of land to increase her crop of coffee.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to maintain coffee.

loans.name: Kantutas De Tacachira Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTAS DE TACACHIRA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Copacabana, está compuesta por once  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Fortunata es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, servicio de transporte, salón de belleza, venta de ropa, sastrería, venta de repuestos de auto.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Fortunata es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una asesora que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chamarras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de telas e hilos por mayor), para posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializarlo en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada  y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y  el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "KANTUTAS DE TACACHIRA" will begin the first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal Copacabana, is composed of eleven members and is headed by a board where Mrs. Fortunata is the Treasurer. Businesses that members of the communal bank take part in are varied. Among them are: selling milk, shuttle service, beauty salon, clothing sales, tailoring, and auto parts sales.

The loan they will take out will benefit small microentrepreneurs where Mrs. Fortunata is integral. She indicated that she entered into Pro Mujer at the invitation of a consultant who is part of the institution. Today she has a business selling jackets; she also mentioned that she learned this business through hew own initiative several years ago.

The loan will be used to increase capital (used in the purchase of wholesale fabrics and threads), and later for the development, and the sale in her retail space. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is married and has two children.

When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she enjoys the training and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Don Miguel de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace 30 años inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y seguir con sus cultivos para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Miguel is 64 years old and lives in his own home with his family unit. He works as a farmer growing corn and sorghum, which he started doing 30 years ago using his own capital. He sells his products around the area where he lives and with his profits is able to settle some of his household costs.

He is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, manure, pest controllers, etc. and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph. The loan will allow him to continue farming in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, manure, pest controllers, etc. and to improve his land.

loans.name: Jackelyn

texts.en:
Jackelyn, aged 27, is married and has three children, one of whom is at school. She is in the agricultural business which involves pig fattening in the Philippines. Jackelyn has been in this business for the past four years.

She has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Jackelyn has now requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives on a hilltop in Kapsowar, Kenya with her husband. She passionately loves sheep farming and has transferred her immense farming knowledge  to other farmers in her village. However, the biggest challenge she faces is satisfying the demand for wool and sheep meat (mutton) in her village and town. The demand is overwhelming. 

Grace is seeking a loan to buy a good quality breed of sheep. She believes that through the loan she will be able to satisfy the market for wool and mutton in her area. Having gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, she is confident that the skills she has acquired will help her to increase her business and to be able to repay the loan. 

Grace is confident that if you invest in her dream, you will be impacting on the life of her family and children.

loans.use: To buy a good quality breed of sheep

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has 2 children and he describes himself to be loyal. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy charcoal and start selling in wholesale. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy charcoal and start selling in wholesale

loans.name: Chojña Pampita De Villandrani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHOJÑA PAMPITA DE VILLANDRANI” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Susana  es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de gallinas, venta de dulces, venta de leche, venta de muebles, servicio de tapicería, servicio de transporte.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Susana es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio lo aprendió de sus padres hace diez años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será la compra de una vaca lechera  que lo adquirirá de las comunidades cercanas a su población, con esta compra su ganado podrá producir más leche para posteriormente comercializarlo en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que las reuniones y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "CHOJÑA PAMPITA DE VILLANDRANI" will begin the second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Copacabana, is composed of eight members and is headed by a board where Susana is the President. Businesses that members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Among them are: selling chickens, sale of candy, sale of milk, sale of furniture, upholstery service, and shuttle service.

The loan will benefit small microentrepreneurs where Susana is integral; she mentioned that she has been a year since she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Today she has a business selling milk; she also let us know that she started this business with what he learned from her parents ten years ago.
 
The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow which she will acquire from the nearby communities. With this purchase her livestock will produce more milk to sell later at fairs in the city of El Alto. This way of working allows her to generate resources to provide for her family financially, since she is married and has five children.

When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that it is the meetings and the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Chit

texts.en:
Chit is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Chit is 52 years old and has two children are still in school.

Chit has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Chit requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready to wear like blouse, pants, shorts, t-shirt etc to sell.

Chit has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready to wear like blouses, pants, shorts, t-shirt etc to sell

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion works hard to support her family. Asuncion is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Asuncion has been in this business for 9 years now.

In the future, Asuncion would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 32 years old, married and a mother of one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training especially enterprise development. 

She practices farming of potatoes, beans, maize and onions and also does poultry keeping. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to boost crop production. With increased income, she will be able to provide better food, clothing and also pay school fees for her child.

Janet is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to increase crop production hence earn more income to provide better food, clothing and pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Edinson Enrique

texts.es: Edinson de 36 años reside en compañía su cónyuge e hijos en un barrio ubicado al sur de Barranquilla, donde exhibe desde la terraza de su vivienda calzado deportivo, idea de negocio que inició a finales del año 2011 y surgió a raíz de un viaje que realizó a la ciudad de Bogotá para visitar a unos familiares que habitan en el barrio Restrepo de ésta ciudad. Para su sorpresa en esta localidad se consolidan un gran un número de fabricantes de calzado que venden a precios de oportunidad, por lo que realizó su primera compra y trajo la mercancía a Barranquilla, con tal éxito que hoy en día cuenta con cuatro años de comercializar calzado con muy buenos resultados, puesto que  con esta actividad ha logrado sostener económicamente a su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para surtir con nuevos diseños de calzado.  Su meta a futuro es continuar creciendo en su negocio para así poder ofrecerles a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Edinson is 36 years old and lives with his wife in a southern neighborhood of Barranquilla, where he displays athletic shoes from the terrace of his home. He started his business at the end of 2011 and the idea came from a trip he made to Bogota to visit some friends that live in the Restrepo neighborhood of that city. To his surprise there were a large number of athletic shoe manufacturers that sold at discounted prices. So he made his first purchase and brought the merchandise to Barranquilla. Today he has 4 years of successful sales with great results, and has been able to support his family.

Today he seeks a Kiva loan, his first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to stock his business with new designs in shoes. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business and in this way being able to give his children a quality education.

loans.use: stock his business with new designs in shoes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 35 years old, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the trainings especially enterprise development. 

She practices farming of onions, kale, maize and beans and also does poultry keeping. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy poultry feeds and fertilizers to increase crop and poultry production. This will increase her income hence meet basic needs with ease. e.g. food,clothing, medical and school fees.

Esther is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed and fertilizers to increase crop and poultry production and earn more income to pay for family's basic needs e.g food, clothing, medical and school fees.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, aged 41, has five children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. Rosita runs a buy-and-sell gasoline business in the Philippines. She has been running this business for seven years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.
 
Rosita has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Rosita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Remedios works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. 

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Remedios hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: 1Ro De Septiembre Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “1RO DE SEPTIEMBRE II” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nicasia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de flores, venta de leche, venta de papa, venta de queso, venta de chuño y tunta, venta de verduras.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nicasia es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de su cuñada que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia  hace seis años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de conos de lana e hilo por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en las feria de la 16 de julio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada  y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “1RO DE SEPTIEMBRE II” will start the second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Copacabana, is composed of nine members and is headed by a board where Mrs. Nicasia is the President. Businesses that members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Among them are: selling blankets, selling flowers, selling milk, selling potatoes, selling cheese, selling chuño and tunta, and selling vegetables.

The loan will benefit small microentrepreneurs where Mrs. Nicasia is integral. She mentioned that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of her sister who is a client of the institution. Today she runs a business making and selling blankets. She also added that she learned this business on her own initiative six years ago.
 
The  loan will bring an increase in capital (used in the wholesale purchase of wool and thread cones)  which will be acquired from the wholesale sellers in the city of El Alto and then to the development. She will market it in the fair on July 16. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the training area offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale of wool and thread cones.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose aged 30 years old and supports 4 children.  She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 6 years earning an income of KES 10,000 per month.

She has applied his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya  to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and herbicides in order to improve his small scale farming for more gain.

Rose plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and buy a dairy cow for milk production for family use and the surplus to sell to clients.

She hopes to eradicate poverty and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and herbicides in order to improve his small scale farming for more gain.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a single mother of three children and two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members . She operates a restaurant at the market on retail basis and has been for 2 years she has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas,beef,beans,flour . She gets additional income from farming. She works seven days a week . Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

She would like to get more capital to expand her restaurant business.  She resides in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes rent,school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, beef, beans, flour and cooking oil for her restaurant business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of charcoal due to an increase of demand of the same product

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a 35 years old, married and has three children to provide. To earn a living she is engaged in rice production business for 7 years and it's really helped them in terms of their daily needs. She aims for a better income because her children are growing and the increasing needs of her children. 

So she decided to borrowed a loan to buy fertilizer for the rice farm so that she can produce good quality of rice and can deliver more rice to the market.

Riza plan for the future to save money to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

location.town: Panduma Sr. Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad. a 59-year-old married mother of 10, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for two years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Having repaid her previous loan, Felicidad is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
Ronelyn is 35 years old and married with two children, two of whom in school, Ronelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, personal care products, etc..

Ronelyn has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future Ronelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Joymae

texts.en:
Joymae is 24 years old, married and has one child.   She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Joymae requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Joymae has been pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Zenda

texts.en:
Zenda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Zenda is 45 years old and has two children who are in school.

Zenda has a flower shop business in the Philippines. Zenda requested a PHP 21000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more flower to sell.

Zenda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Zenda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more flowers to sell

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
A very hardworking entrepreneur, Lucita is a 50-year-old married mother of two. She has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines for 15 years.

Lucita has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in the market. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 15 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, herramientas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
This young woman, whose face is pixelated because she is 28 years old and lives in a high-risk area, has made a living farming corn and beans since she was 15. She markets her goods in the area surrounding where she lives. The young woman lives in her own home with her family. 

She is asking for another loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc. and to improve the land shown in the photograph in order to be able to continue her work and have more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo de 34 años de edad vive con su esposa y su hija de 2 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que desde hace catorce años se dedica a trabajar como albañil, lo que le permite dar un buen soporte económico a su familia y suplir las necesidades básicas del hogar. Wilfredo con el deseo de  construir un servicio sanitario en su vivienda anteriormente obtuvo un crédito el cual le sirvió para realizar dicha obra y gracias  la experiencia obtenida Wilfredo con el propósito de seguir mejorando su vivienda solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para comprar: arena, grava, ladrillo para la construcción de unas gradas en la entrada de su vivienda y brindar así a su familia un hogar más digno..
texts.en:
Wilfredo, age 34, lives with his wife and their two year old daughter.  He is a hard-working man.  He has been working as a bricklayer ever since he was 14 years old.  This allows him to give his family good financial support and to supply the basic household necessities.  

Out of the desire to build a bathroom at his house, Wilfredo previously got a loan.  That served to complete said work.  Thanks to the experience he had, and with the proposal of continuing to improve his house, he is requesting a new loan from FUSAI.  He will use the loan to buy sand, gravel, and bricks in order to build some steps at the entrance to his house.  This way he will provide his family with a more decent home.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, and bricks in order to build some steps at the entrance to his house.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza De Corcona Group

texts.es: Hilda tiene 77 años de edad es casada con hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida hace varios años en su vivienda. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios nuevo ollas vajillas y cubierto. El grupo “CORCONA HACIA EL PROGRESO” agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Hilda es la segunda del lado derecho viste chaleco negro.
texts.en:
Hilda, age 77, is married and has independent children.  She has been selling food at her house for several years.

She will use the loan to buy new utensils, pots, dishes, and cutlery.

The CORCONA HACIA EL PROGRESO group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan provided.

Hilda is the second one on the right wearing a black vest.

loans.use: to buy new utensils.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda and is married with four children and three go to school. She takes care of additional family members . She sells charcoal at the market on retail basis. She has been in business for the last 5 years. She also gets additional income from selling piped water and works seven days a week. 

She has requested for a loan of Uganda shillings 1,200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are high transportation costs due to poor roads. Her goals and aspiration is to buy a van to easy transportation and a plot of land. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family .

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 53 years old, married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Wilma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafoods to sell.

Wilma has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her farming rice.

Mary Ann dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 51 years old, married with three children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase items of groceries to sell like milk, drinks, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods, eggs, bread, cooking oil and etc.

Ethel has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and buy and sell personal collection.

Ethel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items of groceries to sell like milk, drinks, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods, eggs, bread, cooking oil etc

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 45 years old and has seven children. Roselyn is married and has two children who are in school.

Roselyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Roselyn has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Doña Raquel, es una mujer muy valiente que se ha enfrentado a la vida, para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ella siempre ha trabajado para sostener su hogar, en la actualidad cuenta con una pulpería, que mantiene lo más abastecido posible, siempre ha logrado ofrecer a sus clientes, nuevos productos, como por ejemplo detergente, jabones líquidos, entre otros productos de limpieza.
Esta esforzada mujer, ha recurrido a un préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, para poder comprar una dotación de granos básicos, como arroz, frijoles, azúcar y maíz, dado que sus clientes demandan mucho de estos. En sus planes a futuro está siempre seguir trabajando con financiamientos hasta llegar a tener lo que siempre ha soñado, que es una gran distribuidora.
texts.en:
Raquel is a very brave woman who has confronted life head on in order to help her children get ahead. She has always worked hard to support her home, and today she has a small convenience store that she keeps as well-stocked as possible. She has always been able to serve her customers, and offers new products such as detergent, liquid soup, and other cleaning products.

This strong woman is seeking a loan from Kiva and MiCredito in order to buy a supply of basic grains such as rice, beans, sugar and corn, given that her customers request these items a lot. Her future plans include to continue working with financing until she achieves her dreams of become a large distributor.

loans.use: to buy a supply of basic grains such as rice, beans, sugar and corn.

loans.name: Oem's Group

texts.en:
A widow, 50 years old, living in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province.  Oem has seven children and two of them are in school. Nowadays, she does rice farm and works for others for a fee for thirty-two years. Her daily income earns about 38,000KHR per day and she is able to save around 13,000KHR each day after offsetting her family expenses. Her rice has problem of drought, which caused her to sell at a low price, this is the main challenge for her farming. 

Oem, the group leader of six members, is applying for her entire first loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland via VisionFund. She hopes that this loan will help her rice fields grow better than before so as to gain more yields.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is aged 30 years old, married and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training especially enterprise development. 

She practices mixed farming; dairy, poultry and crop farming e.g maize, beans, potatoes and kale. She has applied for Kiva loan to buy animal feeds to enable her increase milk production hence more income to meet her family needs e.g. food and clothing.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds to increase milk production for more income to pay for her family's food and clothing.

loans.name: Grupo Las Hermanas Sector Adoquin Group

texts.es:
Catarina (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) es una mujer de 30 años de edad, es soltera vive  en una comunidad denominada  Xojola, ella tiene dos hijos de las edades entre 8 y 10 años. Catarina para poder obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, ella tiene dos años de realizar esta labor. Catarina es una mujer muy entusiasta que todos los días se propone a mejorar su negocio, gracias a la amabilidad con la que atiende su negocio mucha gente la visita muy constantemente, es por ello que ahora ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de más mercaderías como cortes, fajas, blusas y delantales y satisfacer  mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
El gran sueño de Catarina es poder comprar un terreno para luego construir su casa de block.
texts.en:
Catarina (the first one on the left in the photo), is single and lives in a community called Xojola.  She has two children between the ages of eight and ten.  In order to get income and support her family, she buys and sells typical clothes.  She has been engaged in this work for two years.

Catarina is a very enthusiastic woman.  Every day she sets out to improve her business.  Thanks to the kind way that she tends to her business, a lot of people continually visit her.

That is why she has now made the decision to request a loan to buy more merchandise like skirts, sashes, blouses, and aprons in order to better satisfy her customers’ need.

Catarina’s big dream is to be able to buy land to then build a cement block house.

loans.use: to buy and sell typical clothes

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is so grateful was encouraged that she was continually granted loans to help maintain and grow her small general store. Being a widow is a big challenge for her but with her perseverance and faith in God she was able to raise her children well and support her family. 

She trust that she will be able to access again a 15000 loan to add more grocery items and school/office supplies at her store. She wants to make sure that she has the most in demand food items such as coffee, powdered juice, milk, powdered chocolate, eggs, oil, candies to attract more customers. There are days that her sales is low but she is thankful that they have enough for their basic needs.

Merlina's simple dream just like any loving mother is to see her children become financially stable. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies . 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and school/office supplies to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy brick, sand, and cement in order to be able to build a bathroom at his house.

loans.name: Evelyn Fernanda

texts.es: A su corta edad que son 20 años  Evelyn se dedica a la crianza de chanchos hace 2 años, ella vive con sus abuelitos y comenta que se encuentra estudiando en un instituto donde asiste a clases los fines de semana, con el dinero que se le otorgue Evelyn va a comprar chanchos para de ahí obtener los ingresos suficientes para seguir costeándose sus estudios por medio los que aspira llegar a ser toda una profesional y servir a la sociedad mediante su educación.
texts.en:
At the young age of 20, Evelyn has been raising pigs for two years.  She lives with her grandparents.  She says that she is going to an institution where she attends classes on the week-end.  

Evelyn will use the loan to buy pigs.  That way she will get enough earnings to continue paying for her studies.  With her studies she aspires to become a professional and to serve society with her education.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es: A sus 34 años de edad Maria es casada y tiene en total 7 hijos; niñas de 8 y 11 años y los niños de 4, 10, 14, 15 y 18 años mismos de los cuales 6 están estudiando y también le ayudan a trabajar a su madre en lo que puedan, María vive en el campo y comenta que se dedica al jornal y a la crianza de animales menores, su esposo trabaja de albañil pero tiene una enfermedad en los huesos por lo que en su trabajo rinde solo lo que le es posible y así mismo le pagan poco, Maria va a invertir el credito comprando cuyes y pollos para criarlos y comercializarlos para tener algo de dinero para alimentación y educación a sus hijos, lo que María aspira es mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria, age 34, is married and has seven children.  Her daughters are 8 and 11 years old.  Her sons are 4, 10, 14, 15, and 18 years old.  Six of the children go to school.  They also help their mother work when they can.

Maria lives in the country, and she says that she works as a day worker and raises small animals.  Her husband works as a bricklayer.  However, he has a bone disease, so he only works as much as he is able to, which pays little.

Maria will use the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens to raise and sell.  She will do this in order to have some money for food and her children’s education.  Maria hopes to improve her children’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 49 years old and has five children. Felicidad is married and has one child in school.

Felicidad is in the agricultural business poultry in the Philippines. Felicidad requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to use for her business.

Felicidad has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Felicidad would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to use for her business

loans.name: Estrellas Unidas Group

texts.es:
Don Tomas, tiene 66 años de edad, vive en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá, junto con su esposa, dos hijos y dos nietos. Don Tomas, es una persona dedicada desde pequeño a la agricultura y es su única fuente de ingresos. El cultiva papas, frijol, maíz, tomate y otros, y le dedica todo el tiempo necesario. El préstamo que solicita es en forma grupal y es el quinto ciclo con la institución. Este actual lo invertirá en  semilla de papa, abono, gallinaza y fungicidas para el cultivo de papas. Su propósito es dar mejor asistencia para mejorar la producción. Su plan es incrementar el área de producción para incrementar los ingresos. 
El grupo se llama Estrellas unidas, que está formado por 8 integrantes que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura, de los cuales solo 6 están solicitando otro préstamo. El monto total es por 32,500 Lempiras para seguir brindando asistencia al sus cultivos. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta Martin, Juliana, Santos, Tomas, Ruperta y Pascuala a la derecha.
texts.en:
Tomas, age 66, lives with his wife, two children, and two grandchildren in a village in the Intibucá municipality.  Tomas has worked in agriculture ever since he was little, and it is his only source of income.  He grows potatoes, beans, corn, tomatoes, and others.  He devotes all of the time needed to it.

He is requesting the loan as part of a group.  It is his fifth cycle with the institution.  He will use the loan to buy potato seeds, fertilizer, hen droppings, and fungicides for his potato crops.  His plan is to provide better care in order to improve the production.  He plans to increase the production area in order to increase the earnings.

The group is called Estrellas Unidas.  It is comprised of eight members who live in the same community and work in agriculture.  Only six of the members are requesting another loan.  The total amount is 32,500 lempiras in order to provide care to their crops.

Starting at the left in the photo the members are Martin, Juliana, Santos, Tomas, Ruperta, and Pascuala on the right.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, fertilizer, hen droppings, and fungicides for his potato crops.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 29 year old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and her three children who are still attending school. Her husband represents the main income source to help her family to meet the needs of life and to be able to enhance their way of living. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the last installment of her girls’ educational fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help her continue a suitable education.

loans.use: to pay the last installment of her 3 childrens' educational fees

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 43 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Glenda is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Glenda has been in pig fattening for 2 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 62 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. .

Estrella has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Estrella would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a married health worker with six children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He operates a drugshop business that he started to supplement his salary and grows cocoa to get enough profit to run his home affairs. He sells drugs to patients around the area and dreams of expanding his business to a big medical center. However, some patients come for treatment ont credit and do not make payments as agreed. He is also challenged by double taxation that reduces his profits. 

Ezekiel used the previous loan to pay school fees for his child and now requests a loan to buy more medicines  to sell.

loans.use: to buy an increased numbers of medications and drugs to sell at his pharmacy

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Ernesto nació en una comunidad llamada Maysama en el año de 1967, él no estudio ya que para esos tiempos no habían escuelas y por eso se dedico a aprender labores del campo con su padre y a criar ganado, empezó a trabajar en eso y le gusto mucho. El señor Ernesto es el hijo mayor de todos los hermanos y de igual forma todos sus hermanos trabajan en el campo, al morir el padre del señor Ernesto, él se hizo cargo de la propiedad  y a trabajar con sus hermanos y su madre. El señor Ernesto es casado y tiene 4 hijos. Comenta el señor Ernesto que a sus 23 años de estar casado han sido muy buenos ya que su esposa lo ha apoyado mucho y han salido adelante. Actualmente el señor Ernesto tiene parte de la propiedad que dejó su padre, ya que se repartieron con todos los hermanos y el señor Ernesto ha comprado un poco mas de tierra. Los hijos del señor Ernesto estudían y a la vez se dedican también a las labores de agricultura y ganadería . En la comunidad de Maysama no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar y así poder tener luz eléctrica en su casa y sus hijos puedan hacer las tareas por las noches ya que están estudiando. El señor Ernesto se sentiría muy agradecido si le brindan este préstamo para la compra del sistema solar.
texts.en:
Ernesto was born in 1967 in a community called Maysama.  He did not go to school because there were no schools at that time.  Therefore, he learned to work in the field with his father, and he learned to raise livestock.  He started to work at this, and he liked it a lot.

Ernesto is the oldest son of all of the siblings.  All of his siblings work in the fields.  When Ernest’s father died, he took charge of the property and working with his siblings and his mother.

Ernesto is married and has four children.  Ernesto says that his 23 years of marriage have been very good because his wife has supported him a lot, and they have gotten ahead.

Ernesto currently has part of the property that his father left because it was divided between all of the siblings.  Ernesto has purchased a little more land.  Ernesto’s children go to school and also do agricultural work and work with livestock.

There is no electricity in the Maysama community.  That is why he is requesting a loan to buy a solar system.  This way he will be able to have electricity in his house, and his children will be able to do their homework in the evening because they are going to school

Ernesto will be very grateful if provided with this loan to buy a solar system.

loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Yomaira Paola

texts.es: Paola en madre soltera, vive con su hija de 5 años que se encuentra estudiando, Paola tiene 24 años, trabaja vendiendo juguetes y zapatos en las ferias de las ciudades más cercanas, Paola vive con su hija y su madre en una casa por la que pagan arriendo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería en zapatos y juguetes para tener más variedad en los productos que ofrece, lo que Paola aspira es seguir trabajando y si en algún momento reúne algo de dinero le gustaría hacerse tratar la enfermedad qu es la de tener su mejilla derecha mas grande que la izquierda.
texts.en:
Paola is a single mother.  She lives with her five year old daughter, who goes to school.  Paola, age 24, works selling toys and shoes at the fairs in the closest cities.

Paola lives with her daughter and her mother in a rented house.

She will use the loan to buy shoes and toy merchandise in order to have a greater variety of products that she sells.  Paola strives to continue working.  If at some time she gets together some money, she would like to treat the illness she has, which is having her right cheek bigger than the left one.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: Lucio Otilio

texts.es:
Lucio es un joven de 29 años de edad que vive en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. En su pequeña finca produce café y otros rubros para su autoconsumo como frijol y maíz. 

A pesar de que solo logró cursar hasta tercer grado de primaria, esto no ha sido impedimento para que este emprendedor pueda sacar adelante a su esposa y 2 hijos, asegurando que ellos lo motivan cada día a trabajar para darles mejores condiciones.

Para este ciclo, Lucio está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas que le permitan mejorar los rendimientos y calidad de su café, lo cual es parte del plan de mejora nutricional de su cafetal. El sueño de este productor es incrementar la productividad de su finca, y con ello los ingresos que percibe para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucio is 29 years old and lives in a rural community in northern Nicaragua. On his small farm he produces coffee and other items for his personal consumption including beans and corn.

Despite the fact that he has only completed the 3rd grade, this has not been an impediment for this borrower in supporting his wife and two children. He says that they motivate him each day to work in order to provide them with better conditions.

For this cycle, Lucio is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies that will allow him to improve the yields and quality of his coffee, which is part of the nutritional improvement plan of his coffee farm. His dream is to increase the productivity of his farm and with that, increase the profits that he earns, for the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies which he will use for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther wishes to thank Kiva and their lenders for the previous loan that enabled her buy manure and fertilizer. She was able to boost farming production and hence increase her income that she used to pay part of her children's school fees.

She is borrowing second Kiva loan to buy more manure hence boost her vegetables farming. This will enable her increase stock in her greengrocer and earn more income thus continue paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El señor Pedro nació en un lugar llamado Apantillo El Sabalar en el año de 1985. El señor Pedro desde muy joven se dedico a aprender a trabajar en la agricultura con su padre en la siembra de granos básicos y aprender labores de ganadería. El señor Pedro es casado y ha procreado dos hijos, un niño de 5 años de edad y una niña de 3 años de edad, el niño mayor esta en clases empezando sus estudios primarios, comenta el señor Pedro que a sus hijos los apoyara bastante para que estudien ya que él no tuvo esa oportunidad.
