El padre del señor  Pedro a la edad de 22 años le dió de herencia unas tierras para que trabajara y recuerda mucho lo que le dijo su padre sobre estas tierras, le dijo que es para que siembre y las haga producir y sirvan de apoyo a su familia y eso es lo que ha venido haciendo el señor Pedro, las ha trabajado sembrando granos básicos y criando ganado, también piensa sembrar pasto de corte para agrandar sus números de animales ya que ha sentido que el ganado le ha dado buenas ganancias y ha podido mantener a su familia y con mucho esfuerzo pudo hacer su humilde casa en la que  piensa poner una pulperia para ayudarse un poco mas. El señor Pedro dice que ha sido bendecido ya que tiene a una familia muy unida. En esta comunidad donde vive el señor Pedro no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar el cual será instalado en la casa de habitación y será de gran beneficio para su fanilia y sus labores. El señor Pedro estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.
texts.en:
Pedro was born in a place called Apantillo El Sabalar in the year 1985.  When he was very young he learned to work in agriculture growing basic grains and how to work with livestock with his father.

Pedro is married and has two children, a five year old son and a three year old daughter.  His oldest child is starting elementary school.   Pedro says that he will support his children a lot so that they go to school because he did not have this opportunity.

When Pedro was 22 he father gave him an inheritance of some land for him to work.  He frequently remembers what his father said about this land.  He told him that is is for planting, and to make the land produce and support his family.  And this is what Pedro has been doing.  He has been growing basic grains and raising livestock.

He is also planning to plant pasture in order to increase the number of animals he has.  He feels that the livestock have given him good earnings.  He has been able to support his family, and with a lot of effort he was able to build his humble house.  He is planning on setting up a grocery store in his house in order to help a little more.

Pedro says that he has been blessed because he has a close knit family.

There is no electricity in the community where Pedro lives.  That is why he is requesting a loan to buy a solar system, which will be installed at his house.  It will be a great help to his family and his work.  Pedro would be very grateful if he is given the opportunity of this loan to buy a solar system.

loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Hadiyat’S Group

texts.en:
Hadiyat and his group members are farmers by occupation. They are permanent residents of Harpoke, a far flung town in district Gujranwala in Pakistan.

He and his group members cultivate rice and wheat crops in a seasonal manner. The soil of the region is very fertile and suitable for rice crop provided a right mix of agricultural inputs is utilized during and after cultivation. Unfortunately, the group members have a very small land holding size and do not have finance available to purchase the required quantity of fertilizers, fuel and pesticides. 

Therefore, they are looking for loan to finance their required agricultural inputs.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel etc.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 37 years old, from General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Richard, a factory supervisor. Life in a third world country is not easy but Filipinos do their best to make a living. Luisa finds ways and means to augment their income to fully provide for their daily needs and send her three children to school.  

Luisa is thankful that God allowed her to operate an eatery by their house. She prepares and cooks meals for breakfast such as fried rice, cured pork, marinated beef, pancakes, omelet. Her regular customers are her neighbors within her community who at her eatery before they report for work or even after work to bring home. Her earnings is good except during rainy season where she experience only a break even on her sales.

To help her sustain her business she is requesting a Php 19000 loan to buy ingredients to cook her meals. Part of the loan she will use to buy additional cooking utensils. She is thanking God and you in advance for your good heart and the financial aid that will be given her for it will surely cover their daily sustenance and send her one High School child and her two Elementary children to school. 

Luisa dreams to have her own place for her eatery business. She also prays that she could give all her children a College Education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients to cook meals to serve at her eatery.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 62 years old and widow with seven children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, etc.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Luzviminda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, etc

loans.name: Gegie

texts.en:
Gegie works hard to support her family. Gegie is married and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Gegie has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Gegie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy spare parts, gasoline, etc. for her motorcycle transport business.

Mercedes has been in this business for 10 years. Mercedes earns more income from food vending.

Mercedes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel etc.

loans.name: Nora Luz

texts.es:
Luz una señora con 48 años, casada, dedicada a la preparación y venta de comida, especialmente pollo, de allí obtiene los ingresos suficientes para cubrir las necesidades que su hogar amerita.

Su deseo es ampliar el lugar de venta y llegar a generar empleo a las personas que más lo necesiten, solicita un préstamo con  el cual comprara surtido para su negocio y pollos al por mayor.

Quiere seguir trabajando para cumplir el sueño de tener una vivienda propia, pues con esto sus gastos no serán muchos y su estabilidad económica mejorara.

Como Luz, miles de empresarios esperan su ayuda, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Luz, age 48, prepares and sells food, especially chicken.  That is where she gets enough income to cover the the expenses that her household requires.

She wishes to expand her place of sales and to generate employment for those people who need it the most.

She is requesting a loan to buy stock for her business and chickens wholesale.

She wants to continue working in order to fulfill her dream of having her own house.  With this she will not have a lot of expenses, and her financial stability will improve.

Like Luz, thousands of entrepreneurs are hoping for your help; make a loan.

loans.use: to buy stock for her business and chickens wholesale.

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca una señora que se gana la vida diariamente vendiendo salpicones y mangos en un pequeño carro que adecuo para esto, un medio por el que ha logrado salir adelante como familia y empresaria.

Con el fin de mejorar sus ventas y de tal forma aumentar sus ganancias, solicita un préstamo en la Corporación Interactuar con el cual surtirá su negocio de frutas y demás productos que sean de su utilidad.

Su meta es seguir trabajando para obtener las ganancias suficientes y de este modo mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, pues su estado no es el mejor.

Con tu apoyo Blanca podrá seguir su sueño, Anímate, presta hoy.
texts.en:
Blanca earns a living selling fruit drinks and mangoes every day.  She sells from a small cart that she adapted for this.  It is a means through which she has managed to get ahead as a family and as a businesswoman.

In order to improve her sales, and to increase her earnings by doing so, she is requesting a loan from the Interactuar Corporation.  She will use the loan to stock her business with fruits and other products that will be to her benefit.

Her goal is to continue working in order to get enough earnings to improve the condition of her house.  It is not in the best condition.

With your support Blanca will be able to continue with her dream.  Go for it; lend today.

loans.use: to stock her business with fruits and other products that will be to her benefit.

loans.name: Stefania

texts.es:
Estefanía una mujer con 22 años edad, dedicada a vender una variabilidad de productos para todo tipo de personas, un medio por el cual ha logrado salir adelante con su hijo y sus padres.
Trabaja todo el tiempo posible, pues su disposición para hacerlo es mucha.

Actualmente tiene una cantidad de pedidos pero debido a que no cuenta con un buen capital de trabajo, solicita un crédito con el cual comprara productos como cremas de manos, perfumes, desodorantes, talcos, esmaltes entre otros.

Su mayor sueño es tener una vivienda propia y pagarle la educación a su hijo, pues su bienestar es prioridad.
texts.en:
Estefanía, age 22, sells a variety of products for all types of people.  By doing so she has managed to get ahead with her son and her parents.

She works all of the time possible.  She has a great aptitude for doing so.  She currently has a lot of orders, but she does not have a good amount of working capital.  She is requesting a loan to buy products like hand creams, perfumes, deodorants, powders, and nail polish, among others.

Her biggest dream is to have her own house and to pay for her son’s education.  His well-being is her priority.

loans.use: to buy products like hand creams, perfumes, deodorants, powders, and nail polish, among others.

loans.name: Herminigilda

texts.en:
Herminigilda is 51 years old, married and has one child to provide for. Her husband is a farmer. 

To earn a living and be able to help her husband in providing for her child's needs, she is engaged in a food stall business. She cooks food and sells it. She aims to increase her income, and so she borrowed a loan to buy additional ingredients for the new menu so that she can sell more food that will generate more income.

Herminigilda's plan for the future is to save money to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for the new menu.

loans.name: Suzeth

texts.en:
Suzeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Suzeth has been in this business for six years, and earns more income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her business.

Suzeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Glyn

texts.en:
Glyn is 32 years old, married with two children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, etc.

Glyn has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn is 31 years old and is married with three children who are in school. Manilyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Manilyn has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Manilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Dinalyn

texts.en:
Dinalyn is a 36-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Dinalyn has a food vending business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for five years. Dinalyn has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Dinalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty es una emprendedora mujer que inició su negocio hace siete años, ella realizaba constantes viajes al vecino país de Venezuela y un día decidió comprar algunos productos para comercializar en Cartagena de Indias. Al tener buena acogida decidió continuar comprando prendas de vestir, calzado o cualquier otro artículo que le solicitaran sus clientes, así mismo, alterno a esta actividad Betty  desde la comodidad de su casa, ofrece bebidas y pasteles de arroz que son un plato típico de la gastronomía Colombiana a vecinos, amigos y familiares.  Gracias a su compromiso y dedicación esta mujer ha logrado mantenerse todos los días dispuesta a atender sus deberes en el negocio, brindando la mejor comida y excelente servicio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar nuevas colecciones de ropa y calzado. Esta inversión es muy favorable para sus ventas y representativa para las ganancias.  A futuro Betty desea continuar prosperando en su negocio y así poder adquirir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Betty is an enterprising woman who opened her business seven years ago. She constantly took trips to Venezuela and one day decided to buy some products to sell in Cartagena de Indias. Being well received she decided to continue to buy clothing, footwear and any other items that her clients request.

Betty does this from the comfort of her home and at the same time also offers drinks and rice cakes that are a typical Colombian gastronomic dish, to her neighbors, friends and family members. Thanks to her commitment and dedication this woman has managed to be ready each day to look after her duties in her business, offering the best food and excellent service.

She is presently applying for a loan from KIva, her first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy a new array of clothing and footwear. This investment will be very favorable for her sales and her profits. In the future Betty wants to continue to prosper with her business and be able to acquire her own house.

loans.use: to buy a new array of clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Mary Fe

texts.en:
Mary Fe is 32 years old, married and has five children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, growing vegetables in the Philippines. She has been growing vegetables for two years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her activities. Mary Fe has now requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers for her farm.

In the future, Mary Fe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man who has five children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

John has operated a farming business for the past 15 years, planting and selling vegetables from his home. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase fertilizer and some seedlings to use in his farming business. He decided to join Yehu to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and some seedlings to use in his farming business.

loans.name: Christmas

texts.en:
Christmas is a repeat client to the institution.  He is married with 6 children who attend school. He is appreciative the Kva support and partnership which has helped him to expand his business increasing his sales and profit. His major activity is coffee trade and coffee processing. He has done this business for over 20 years, and his major challenge was limited capital, to overcome that challenge.

He decided to join Ugafode for financial assistance and since he joined ugafode, Christmas says he has been able to expand his business and has been able to buy himself a residential house and he has bought a processing machine for coffee and this has enabled him to multiply his income.

He has applied for a loan of ugx5,000,000 to buy more coffee since it season. And he hopes to expand his business and earn more income since he has sure market.

loans.use: to purchase coffee beans for sale

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is a leader standing in the middle with raising his hand in group picture. He and his group members is progressive farmer.  They are permanent residents of Chadyala, a far-flung village in district Gujranwala in Pakistan.

He and his other fellows cultivate rice and wheat crops for their livelihood. At the moment, the group members are in the process of cultivating rice crop that requires agricultural inputs. Since the group members are poor and do not have enough savings to finance the input, they are asking for a loan that can help them to purchase required agricultural inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, pesticides. This loan will help them to increase their revenue.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel etc.

loans.name: Palmeras Verdes Group

texts.es:
Maria es una muje de 43 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 10, 12 y 21 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, decidida, constante, activa, paciente, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por la multiculturalidad de sus pobladores; Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes, se encuentra al sur de la ciudad, migrantes se apropiaron del lugar y formaron un comercio en constante crecimiento, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Maria es de tez trigueña, ojos marrones, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada a la izquierda, viste camisa verde y calza rosa). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como transportista y con sus hijos; el mayor trabaja y los menores estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de madera, ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento y tierra que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de zapatos de segunda mano, venta de medicina natural, artesanía en cuero, confección de tejidos, venta de huevo y venta de galletas, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; majadito (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito), locro (sopa de: carne deshidratada, carne cortada en pedacitos, yuca y huevo), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa y plátano),  sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), y otros, “recientemente nos mudamos a este lugar, inicié vendiendo unos pocos platos de comida, ahora no tengo donde servirles porque no tengo muebles…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la cartera de clientes crece diariamente, la desventaja es la falta de muebles de comedor para atender a sus clientes. Su sueño es vender comida dentro del mercado, ella desea realizar la compra de mesas y sillas para amoblar su puesto de venta y servir comida a muchos clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de muebles de comedor para atender a sus clientes y vender mucha comida tradicional.
texts.en:
Maria, age 43, lives with her life partner.  She has three children; ages 10, 12, and 21.  Her business is selling traditional food.  She is a good mother.  She is determined, steady, active, patient, optimistic, responsible, and very hard-working.  She conducts her business in the ‘plan 3000’ area.  The area is known for its multicultural inhabitants; Aymarás, Quechuas, and Guaraníes.  It is south of the city, and migrants adapted to the place and developed commerce that is in constant growth.  It has a hot, tropical climate with a daytime temperature that varies between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius.

Maria has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long brown hair that she wears in a ponytail.  She is short and has a medium build.  Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks at her place.  She speaks Spanish with the general public and for the business she conducts.  (She is seated to the left, and she is wearing a green shirt and pink pants.)

She shares her life with her life partner, who works as a driver, and with her children.  The oldest works, and the younger ones go to school.  She lives in the family home, which is built from wood, brick, and cement.  It has a corrugated tin roof and a cement and dirt floor.  They have running water, electricity, and indoor plumbing.

Her desire to improve led her to establish a bank of people with businesses like selling second-hand clothes, selling second-hand shoes, selling natural medicine, leather handicrafts, making woven goods, selling eggs, and selling cookies.  They established the bank in order to request a loan and to improve their businesses.

Her business is selling traditional food like ‘majadito’ (dehydrated meat, rice, fried egg, and fried banana), ‘locro’ (soup with dehydrated meat, meat cut in small pieces, cassava, and egg), ‘cogote relleno’ (chicken neck filled with potato and banana) ‘sopa de maní’ (soup with a peanut base), and others.

“We recently moved to this place.  I started selling a few dishes, and now I don’t have anywhere to serve them because I don’t have furniture,” she says.  The advantage of her business is that her customer base is growing daily.  The disadvantage is the lack of dining furniture to take care of her customers.

Her dream is to sell food in the market.

She wishes to buy tables and chairs to furnish her place of sales and to serve food to a lot of customers.  This is the first loan sequence with the institution in the year that she has been engaged in this business activity.

It is for these reasons that Maria is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs in order  to tend to her customers and to sell a lot of traditional food.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Tiberius

texts.en:
Tiberius is 24 years old and supports one child. 

He has been offering motorcycle transport services for the last three years and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month. Tiberius has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase spare parts such as engines, tyres and motorcycle seats for repair and maintenance, to enable him to offer better services to clients. 

He plans to use profits gained to repay the loan and educate his children. His hope is to be financially stable and expand his business sector.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts such as engines, tyres and motorcycle seats for repair and maintenance, to enable him to offer better services to clients.

loans.name: Jose Arnoldo

texts.es: José de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vid y sus tres hijos, el se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado de repasto y también al cultivo de papaya desde hace 6 años, vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y con las ganancias que obtiene es como puede salir adelante con su familia, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de  un toro, 2 novillas y 2 toretes y así poder seguir con la crianza y poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
José, age 46, lives in his own house with his life partner and their three children.  He raises and sells cattle.  He has also been growing papaya for six years.  He sells his products in surrounding towns.  With the earnings that he gets he is able to get ahead with his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy a bull, two bull calves, and two young bulls.  This way he will be able to continue raising animals, and he will be able to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy a bull, two bull calves, and two young bulls.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 36-year-old father of two children, and lives in Hoima, Uganda. 

He operates a supermarket where he sells a variety of items, namely books, foods and plastics, among other items. This is supplemented by selling agro inputs. He hopes to grow and expand his business more. However, he is limited by insufficient capital, and will use the loan to buy more stock items like plastics and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock items like plastics and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives with her mother in the village of Akunq in the Ararat region. A cook by profession, Mariam helps her mother with farming work. They keep livestock (cows, pigs, calves and hens) and also cultivate wheat in the family's own yard. Mariam works in a small catering business as a cook, and her time after work is totally devoted to the development of the farm. 

She has requested this loan to purchase three oxen, two piglets, and barley and grass as forage for the livestock. This is Mariam's second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions previously, was very difficult to pay back, and Mariam faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, she and her mother were able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, Mariam has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

Please support Mariam with her loan and help her to sustain her farm.

loans.use: pay for three oxen, two piglets, and barley and grass as forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin is a single man and has no children. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Kelvin has operated a poultry selling business for over five years. He mentioned disease outbreaks causing losses as a challenge in the business. Kelvin dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future

With the loan of KES 30,000 he wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. He joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Marta Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita una señora con 57 años de edad, que desde hace poco  monto su primer negocio, un sala de belleza. De allí logra sacra los ingresos mínimos para el cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.

Solicita un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de una plancha para el cabello. Secador, tinturas  y tratamientos, con esto espera aumentar sus clientes y dejarlos satisfechos para que vuelvan a su negocio.

Sus sueños son muchos, pero el principal es ver su casa bonita, ya que esta con el tiempo se ha ido deteriorando.
Aporte al sueño de margarita y haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Margarita, age 57, set up her first business, a beauty salon, a little while ago.  From here she manages to get the minimum earnings to cover her household necessities.

She is requesting a loan to buy a hair iron, a dryer, tints, and treatments.  By doing so she hopes to increase her customers and to leave them satisfied so that they return to her business.

She has many dreams.  However, the main one is to see her house look nice.  In time it has been deteriorating.

Contribute to Margarita’s dream and make a loan.

loans.use: to buy a hair iron, a dryer, tints, and treatments.

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
Estefanía es un joven con 20 años de edad, trabajadora y humilde que desde hace poco inicio con un negocio en la sala de su casa, una miscelánea, un medio por el cual ha logrado salir adelante y tener un buen avance.

Este mujer solicita un crédito con el cual comprara un computador, fotocopiadora, vitrina y la otra parte la invertirá en surtido como cuadernos, libros, lapice y otros.

Su mayor sueño es comprar una vivienda propia para brindarle una excelente calidad de vida a su pequeño que viene en camino.
Aporto al sueño de esa mujer, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Estefania, age 20, is hard-working and humble.  A little while ago she started a business in a room in her house.  It is a variety store with which she has been able to get ahead and make good progress.

This woman is requesting a loan to buy a computer, a photocopier, and a display case.  She will use the other part to buy stock like notebooks, books, pencils, and other things.

Her biggest dream is to buy her own house in order to provide the little on that is on the way with an excellent quality of life.

Contribute to the dream of this woman; make a loan.

loans.use: to buy a computer, a photocopier, and a display case and to buy stock like notebooks, books, pencils, and other things.

loans.name: Tiberio De Jesus

texts.es:
Tiberio es un hombre campesino, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño se dedica a realizar trabajos de campo, una experiencia que adquirió gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres.

Con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, ya tiene variedad de cultivos, pero debido a las sequia sus cosechas se están viendo afectadas, por esto solicita un préstamo con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas como insecticidas, fertilizantes y abonos.

Su mayor sueño es tener su casa en buen estado y poder pagarle la educación a sus hijos.
Sabe que de la mano de los colaboradores del portal Kiva lo lograra.
texts.en:
Tiberio is a countryman, hard-working, and humble.  He has worked in the fields since he was a boy.  He acquired experience, thanks to the teachings of his parents.  

He has made great progress with this.  He has a variety of crops.  However, his harvests are affected by the drought.  That is why he is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies like insecticides, fertilizers, and compost.

His biggest dream is to have a house in good condition and to be able to pay for his children’s education.  He knows that with a hand from the Kiva lenders, he will achieve it.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like insecticides, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of charcoal for sale to clients.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar works hard to support four children. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Pilar requested a PHP 6,750 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Pilar is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 35 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

Analyn is in the agricultural business, raising pig in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her activities.  She has now requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es un hombre con 34 años de edad, que con su esfuerzo y dedicación logro montar su propio negocio, un Café Bar, un medio por el cual ha logrado salir adelante como persona y empresario.

Solicita un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de licores como aguardiente, ron y cervezas. Con esto espera aumentar sus clientes y de tal manera sus ganancias.

Sus sueños son muchos, pero el principal es pagarles la educación a sus hijos, pues su bienestar le preocupa. 

Con su apoyo este hombre podrá seguir su sueño, anímese y haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Fernando, age 34, managed to set up his own business, a CaféBar, through his effort and dedication.  Through this business he has managed to get ahead as a person and a businessman.

He is requesting a loan to buy liquor like brandy, rum, and beer.  With this he hopes to increase his customers and his earnings.

He has many dreams.  However, the main one is to pay for his children’s education.  Their well-being worries him. 

With your support this man will be able to continue his dream.  Go for it; make a loan.

loans.use: to buy liquor like brandy, rum, and beer to stock his bar.

loans.name: Thelma Maria

texts.es:
Thelma es una mujer de mirada tierna, personalidad amable y con espíritu trabajador. Posee una panadería desde hace cuatro años, negocio que nació como una forma de asegurar sus años de retiro.  Con mucho esfuerzo, con su hijo como principal apoyo ha logrado abastecerse de harina, cazuelejas, manteca, entre otras cosas que ocupa como su materia prima. 
El negocio de esta mujer ha crecido notablemente, sus clientes se han encantado con sus productos, dada su buena calidad y sabor, es por esta razon que ella ha solicitado un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, que esta vez ocupara para mejorar la infraestructura de su local, lo que le ayudara a garantizar higiene y presentación ante sus compradores. En un futuro planea abrir una tienda especializada en pasteles, además de poner otras panaderías en su ciudad.
texts.en:
Thelma is a woman with a tender look, a friendly personality, and a hard-working spirit. She has had a bakery for four years, a business that was born as a way to secure income for her retirement. With a lot of effort, and help mainly provided by her son, she has managed to stock up on flour, bread pans and butter, among other things she uses as raw materials. 

This woman’s business has grown considerably. Her clients love her products, given their good quality and taste, and this is why she has asked for a loan from Kiva along with MiCrédito. This time the loan will be spent on improving her store’s infrastructure, which will help to guarantee cleanliness and presentation for her clients. In the future she plans to open a store specializing in cakes, as well as opening other bakeries in her city.

loans.use: to improve her store's infrastructure.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a 43-year-old, married woman living with her five children in Bundibugyo-Uganda. 

She deals in selling fresh foods as a vendor in the markets and gets additional income from growing and selling cocoa. She is very hardworking but is challenged by inadequate capital; she hopes of expanding her business and also educating her children up to university. Annet has requested a loan to continue increasing her stock to meet the demand for her foodstuffs like tomatoes, cabbages, rice, and ground nuts, especially if it is season time.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur with four children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by growing corn in the Philippines, and supplements this income with earnings from selling rice. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and seeds.

Susan dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta works hard to support her family. She is widow and has a business buying and selling dry goods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 28 years now.  

Vicenta has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy clothes, bags, shoes and other supplies to sell.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save money to expand her business and to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes, bags, shoes and other supplies to sell.

loans.name: Narciza Del Rocio

texts.es: Narciza es una señora separada de su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos,  juguetes, bisutería  y de zapatos desde hace 13 años, Narciza vive con una hija y una nieta en una casita por la que paga arriendo, ella comenta que le va bien en su negocio ya que ella es muy amable con sus clientes, ella saca su mercadería a las ferias de las ciudades más cercanas de donde ella vive, comenta que trae su mercadería desde partes muy lejanas donde puede comprar más barato y que así le quede algo de ganancia, Narciza va a invertir el crédito en la compra de cosméticos y zapatos para mejorar su negocio e incrementarlo, de este negocio aspira obtener una buena rentabilidad y de ser posible algún momento comprar una casita y mejorar la calidad de vida junto a su hija y su nieta.
texts.en:
Narciza is separated from his husband.  She has been selling cosmetics, toys, costume jewelry, and shoes for 13 years.  Nariciza lives with her daughter and a granddaughter in a rented house.

She says that her business is going well for her because she is very kind to her customers.  She takes her merchandise to the fairs in the cities that are closest to where she lives.  She says that she gets her merchandise from places very far away where she is able to buy more cheaply.  This way she is left with some earnings.

Narciza will use the loan to buy cosmetics and shoes to improve and expand her business.  With this business she strives to get good profitability.  She strives to make it possible to buy a house sometime and to improve her quality of life and that of her daughter and her granddaughter.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy larger quantities of footwear in more sizes and styles to be able to meet the products' demand in his business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 33-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cecilia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. Cecilia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Cristuta

texts.en:
Cristuta is a 36-year-old married woman with two children who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cristuta has a business selling candy in the Philippines, and has been in this business for three years. Cristuta requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more candy to sell.

In the future, Cristuta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more candy to sell.

loans.name: Fancisca

texts.en:
Fancisca works hard to support three children. She is married and has a frozen food business in the Philippines.

Fancisca requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Fancisca is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer trabajadora, muy dedicada a su familia, ella tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera cuenta con una familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 8 y 10 años. Antonia para poder obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica al cultivo y venta de café, ella tiene cinco años de realizar esta labor, Antonia con el afán de incrementar su cultivo ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de un pedazo de terreno, porque solo así ella podrá hacer que su cultivo crezca y con ello sus ingresos.
Antonia tiene el anhelo de que sus hijos sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en: Antonia is a hard-working woman dedicated to her family. She is 27 years old, single, and has two children ages 8 and 10. Antonia grows and sells coffee to support her family. She has had this business for 5 years. Antonia has the goal to increase her crops so she made the decision to seek a loan to be used to purchase a plot of land, because only in this way will she be able to make her crops expand and with it her income. Antonia has the goal that her children become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy land to farm.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support one child. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Mary Ann requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Mary Ann is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is a 60-year-old married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Eleuteria has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 35 years. Eleuteria requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

In the future, Eleuteria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, desde hace 5 años, comercializa sus productos en los los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde desea realizar la siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía y así poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
This young man, whose face is pixelated because he is 24 years old and lives in a high-risk area, has made a living farming corn and sorghum for the last 5 years. He markets his goods in the different markets located near his home. The young man lives in his own home with his companion. 

He is asking for another loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, pest control, etc. and to improve the land shown in the photograph, where he hopes to carry out sowing. This will allow him to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, pest control, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 48 years old, married, and has five children.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell like canned goods, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling animal feed.

Rosemarie aspires to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell like canned goods, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business cultivating seaweed in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.  

Araceli has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase seaweed seedlings.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 41 years old, married, and has two children. Evelyn's two children are in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business farming seaweed in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy plastic bags and other supplies needed.

Evelyn has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags and other supplies needed

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita, 50, is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. For the past twenty years she has earned a living by weaving beautiful mats in the Philippines.

Angelita has applied for a 5,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy weaving materials such as strips of bamboo and other supplies. She is always working hard on growing her business.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials such as strips of bamboo and other supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 33 years old, married, and has five children. Three of her five children are in school.  Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, home care products, and other grocery items.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, home care products, and other grocery items

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en: Calixta, 45, has two children and for the past six years has earned a living preparing and selling delicious food in the Philippines. She has applied for a 8,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more ingredients to make the food she sells. She works hard to save money to build her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make the food she sells.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for twelve years and earns more income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional items and ingredients for her business.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 40 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has been in this business for eight years. 

Ma. Fe has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, bread, etc.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, bread, etc.

loans.name: Grupo Las Partidarias Group

texts.es:
Maria (la primera del lado izquierdo de blusa rosada) es una mujer de 38 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 13 y 22 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de San Pablo Jocopilas.
Maria para poder obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, trabaja como sastre, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace seis años. Maria es una madre de familia que se preocupa mucho por la seguridad de su familia y para brindarles lo mejor trabaja con mucho entusiasmo, gracias al esmero que le pone a su trabajo cuenta con muchos clientes es por ello que solicita un crédito para poder comprar más telas para elaborar pantalones y satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
El gran sueño de Maria es poder comprar más terrenos para que sus hijos cuenten con un patrimonio grande.
texts.en:
Maria (the first on the left wearing a pink blouse) is a 38-year-old woman who is married.  She has a lovely family of three children between the ages of 13 and 22.  This humble family lives in a community of San Pablo Jocopilas.

Maria, to be able to obtain income and help her husband with the household expenses, works as a tailor.  She has done this work for six years.  Maria is a mother that worries a lot about the security of her family and providing the best for them.  She works with a lot of enthusiasm.  Thanks to the great care that she takes with her work she has many customers.  She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more fabric to make pants and better satisfy the needs of her customers.

Maria’s great dream is to be able to buy more land so that her children will have a large inheritance.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make pants.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 50 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn has been fattening pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets to raise and feed.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and feed.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. Lolita is married and has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years now.  

Lolita has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sheet metal roofing and lumber for replacing the roof of her home.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 35 years old, married, and has five children. Four of her children are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mary Ann has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies. Mary Ann has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad, 45, is married and has nine children, six of whom are in school. For the past ten years she has farmed seaweed to earn an income in the Philippines.

Caridad has taken out and successfully repaid two previous loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF to bolster her business. She has now applied for a 8,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy plastic bags and other materials for her seaweed business.

Caridad is constantly working to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags and other materials for her seaweed business.

loans.name: Loyola

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Loyola works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Loyola is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Loyola has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Leonidisa

texts.en:
Leonidisa is 50 years old, married, and has five children. Two of her children are in school. 

She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leonidisa has a buy and sell seashells business in the Philippines. Leonidisa requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more seashells to sell.

Leonidisa has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Leonidisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sea shells to sell

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia is 52 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom are in school. Mauricia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

Mauricia has been in this business for five years.

In the future Mauricia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, etc

loans.name: Ann Margareth

texts.en:
Ann Margareth is 33 years old, married, and has one child.  

She is in the agricultural business, farming banana in the Philippines. Ann Margareth requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment.

Ann Margareth has been farming banana for four years now. She has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ann Margareth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 29 years old, married, and has four children.

Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Fe has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from abaca weaving.

Fe aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing supplies for her business

loans.name: Celedisa

texts.en:
Celedisa works hard to support her family. Celedisa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, chips, soap, candies, etc.

Celedisa has been in this business for nine years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, chips, soap, candies, etc

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores, es un señor muy trabajador y honesto, que siempre ha dado lo mejor de sí en su trabajo como agricultor y comerciante, para brindarle a su esposa e hijos una buena calidad de vida. El maneja dos negocios, uno que se basa en sembrar maíz y frijoles, el otro en vender especias, como canela, achote, pimienta, entre otros condimentos que se usan para preparar distintas comidas. Él ya había sido beneficiado con un primer préstamo de Kiva junto MiCrédito, por el cual está muy agradecido, porque creció como pequeño empresario. 
Ha vuelto a recurrir a un financiamiento de Kiva y MiCrédito, porque esta vez desea invertir en insumos para sus siembras de grano basico de esta manera comprar pesticidas, abono, mano de obra, entre otros, que le garantizan el cuido de las plantas de frijol. Él tiene mucha confianza en los financiamientos que se le han brindado y planea seguir trabajando con estos, hasta cumplir su sueño que es verse como un gran empresario. Gracias a las ganancias obtenidas, las cuales ahorra, ha logrado ir comprando ganado para producir carne y productos lácteos.
texts.en:
Dolores is a very hardworking, honest gentleman, who has always given his best in his work as a farmer and a businessman, in order to give his wife and children a good quality of life. He runs two businesses; one is based on planting corn and beans, and the other on selling spices such as cinnamon, achiote, and pepper, among other condiments that are used for preparing different foods. 

He has already benefited from a first Kiva loan with MiCrédito, for which he is very grateful, because he grew as a small businessman. He has returned to seek a loan with Kiva and MiCrédito, because this time, he wants to invest in supplies for his basic grain crops. He will purchase pesticide and compost and pay for labor, along with other things that will guarantee the care of his bean plants. 

He has a lot of faith in the loans that he has been granted, and he plans to continue working with them until he achieves his dream of becoming a great businessman. Thanks to his earnings, which he is saving, he has been able to purchase cattle for producing meat and dairy products.

loans.use: to purchase pesticide and compost, and to pay for labor, among other things.

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
Leona is 57 years old and has two children. Leona is married, and one of her children is in school.

Leona is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Leona requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Leona has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Elvessa

texts.en:
Elvessa is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elvessa is 61 years old now.

Elvessa has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Elvessa requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Elvessa has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Elvessa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 47 years old and has one child.

Florentina is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Florentina requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Florentina has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Florentina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
A sus 51 años de edad el señor Julio, un hombre trabajador y humilde,  logro montar su primer negocio, un taller de mecánica, de allí logra obtener los ingresos suficientes para su sostenimiento.
Trabaja 6 días a la semana durante 8 horas.

Solicita un  crédito con el cual comprara un compresor y una pistola neumática.
Con esto espera aumentar sus clientes, dejarlos satisfechos y de tal forma sus ganancias mejoraran.

Quiere seguir trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de comprase un vivienda propia, pues con esto su estabilidad económica mejoraría.

Usted puede hacer parte del sueño de Julio, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Julio, age 51, is a hard-working and humble man.  He managed to set up his first business, a mechanics shop.  From this he gets enough income to support himself.  He works six days a week for eight hours.

He is requesting a loan to buy a compressor and a pneumatic spray gun.  With this he hopes to increase his customers and to leave them satisfied.  This way his earnings will improve.

He wants to continue working until he fulfills his dream of buying his own house.  With this his financial stability will improve.

You can be part of Julio’s dream; make a loan.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and a pneumatic spray gun for his shop.

loans.name: San Miguel Panan 1 Group

texts.es:
(Es la primera del lado izquierdo de la foto) Trabajadora, honrada, y buena madre es Mariselva de 23 años de edad es casada, que vive junto a su linda familia en una comunidad de San Miguel. Mariselva para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la elaboración de deliciosos chocolates, con esta labor lleva cuatro años de ejercerla. Pero para mejorar sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de cacao para chocolate. Mariselva gracias a que prepara deliciosos chocolates, tiene muchos clientes es por ello que se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en la elaboración de chocolates,compra de  cacao, azúcar y leche, para seguir elaborando chocolates.
El gran sueño de Mariselva es que su negocio prospere para que sus ingresos incrementen y la calidad de vida de su familia mejore.
texts.en:
Hard-working, honest, and a good mother, Mariselva is 23, married, and lives with her beautiful family in the community of  San Miguel. She is first on the left in the photo.

To help her husband with the household expenses, Mariselva makes and sells delicious chocolates. She has been doing this work for four years. However, to improve her income, she buys and sells cacao for making chocolate. Thanks to the fact that Mariselva makes delicious chocolates, she has many customers. This is why she sees the need to apply for a loan to invest in the making of chocolate; purchasing cacao, sugar and milk, so that she can continue making chocolates.

Mariselva's great dream is for her business to prosper, so that her income increases and her family's quality of life improves.

loans.use: To buy cacao, sugar and milk for making chocolates.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos desde hace varios años, vende sus productos agrícolas en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo de 2 años, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: The young man’s face has been blurred because he is 24 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. He has been growing basic grains for several years. He sells his produce in the areas around the zone where he lives, and with what he earns from his sales, he manages to get ahead. He lives in his own house with his wife and his two-year-old son. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of seed, fertilizer, compost, pest control, etc., and for improving the land that is shown in the photograph, in order to have better earnings

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, compost, pest control, etc., and improve the land.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 44 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre 12 y 20 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de  Sololá. Juana para poder obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de almacigo y elotes, esta labor lo tiene ella desde  hace ocho años. A Juana le preocupa mucho la comodidad de su familia es por ello que se ve a la necesidad de comprar una cama para que sus hijos duerman mejor, pues hasta ahora ellos no cuentan con  una cama cómoda, pero una de las dificultades que Juana tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente por tal razón solicita un crédito.
El gran sueño de Juana es poder contar con una casa para vivir mejor y que sus hijos sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Juana, age 44, is married and has a lovely family with five children between the ages of 12 and 20.  This family lives in a community in Sololá.  

In order to get income and to get her family ahead, Juana sells seedlings and corn.  She has been doing this for eight years.

Juana worries a lot about her family’s comfort.  That is why she sees the need to buy a bed so that her children sleep better.  So far they do not have a comfortable bed.  However, one of the difficulties that Juana has is that she does not have enough money.  That is the reason she is requesting a loan.

Juana’s big dream it to be able to have a house in order to live better and for her children to become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy a bed for her house.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and she earns additional income from food vending. Vilma is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie, 44 years old, is married and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 9 years, Connie has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from food vending.

Connie has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell. Connie has previously borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. Helen is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health risks and hazards to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 50 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Evelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Jennilyn

texts.en:
Jennilyn is 30 years old and has three children. Jennilyn is married and has one child in school.

Jennilyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jennilyn has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jennilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe, 37 years old, is married and has three children, two of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 5 years, Fe has operated a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines. Fe has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell. In the future, Fe would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Hershey

texts.en:
Hershey, 28 years old, has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past year, Hershey has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from food vending. Hershey has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

Hershey has previously borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Dominga Del Socorro

texts.es:
Dominga, es una mujer trabajadora, que tiene un gran amor por sus hijos y el trabajo. Tener un hogar con dos hijos adolescentes la llevo a buscar una forma de generar un ingreso, fue así como puso su negocio de venta de tortillas, frituras y refrescos enlatados. Poco a poco logro adquirir una cocina industrial que le facilita el trabajo. 
Su clientela ha aumentado, es por eso solicita un préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, para abastecer con la demanda, utilizara este financiamiento para comprar leña, maíz, harina para hacer pan, gaseosas en diferentes presentaciones, frituras, golosinas, entre otras cosas. Ella no piensa dejar de trabajar duro hasta ver cumplida su meta, que es poder su propia casa. Con la ayuda incondicional de su esposo, esta mujer ha logrado hacer de una idea, un negocio rentable.
texts.en:
Dominga is a hardworking woman who has a great love for her children and her work. Having a home with two adolescent children led her to seek a means of earning an income; this was how she started her business selling tortillas, fried food and canned drinks. Little by little she was able to acquire an industrial kitchen that facilitates her work. 

Her customer base has increased; this is why she is asking for a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito to keep up with the demand, using this financing to buy firewood, corn, flour to make bread, soft drinks in different presentations, fried food, and candy, among other things. She does not intend to stop working hard until she has met her goal, which is to be able to have her own house. With her husband's unconditional help, this woman has been able to turn an idea into a profitable business.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, flour to make bread, soft drinks in different presentations, fried food, and candy, among other things.

loans.name: Edwin Jose

texts.es: Edwin de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la actividad agrícola, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con su familia, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y así continuar con sus cultivos para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Edwin is 31 years old and lives in a house he owns with his wife and their son. He makes a living by growing corn and sorghum; he has been farming for 10 years. With what he sells, he is able to get ahead with his family. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, manure, insecticide, herbicide, etc. and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph, thus continuing with his crops in order to have greater earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, insecticide, herbicide, etc. and to improve the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in flour, sugar, butter, etc., in order to be able to expand her bakery's production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth, nails, glue, plastic, wood, etc., to improve his business

loans.name: Jose Patricio

texts.es: Jose de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, maicillo y yuca, se dedica a esa actividad desde hace 20 años e inicio con capital propio, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos de los gastos que se presentan en su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, pesticidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía y así poder seguir con sus cultivos ya que es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose is 48 and lives in his own home with his wife and daughter. He grows corn, sorghum and yuca, and has been engaged in this business for 20 years. He started with his own working capital, and with the profits he gets manages to meet some of the expenses that arise in his household. 

He is requesting a loan in order to buy seed, fertilizers, manures, pesticides, etc., and to improve the land shown in the photograph. In this way he hopes to continue growing his crops, as this is his only source of income.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, pesticides, etc., and improve the land.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Josephine is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like linen, zippers, etc. for her tailoring business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like linen and zippers

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth, 46 years old, is married and has five children. With three children currently in school, Lilibeth works very hard to provide for them. For the past 6 years, Lilibeth has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as coffee, eggs, noodles, cereals, milk, soft drinks, etc. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store. In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josefina is 56 years old now.

Josefina has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Josefina requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Josefina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Josefina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer, que ama las cosas dulce, desde muy pequeña su madre le enseño ha hornear pasteles y elaborar postres, tiempo después ella vio esta cualidad que aprendió como una forma de generar dinero, fue así  como emprendió un negocio de elaboración y venta de pasteles, postres y dulces. Ella ha logrado salir adelante a pesar de las enfermedades que se le han presentado.  
El negocio de María se ha fortalecido, sus clientes cada vez demandan más, es por eso que ella ha solicitado un préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, que le permita abastecerse de las cosas que utiliza como materia prima, es decir, comprar harina, huevos, aceite, mantequilla, colorante, crema de dulce, entre otras cosas. En un futuro ella se ve abriendo su propia escuela de pastelería.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman who loves sweet things. Since she was young, her mother taught her how to bake cakes and make desserts. Later on, she saw this skill that she had learned as a way to earn money. This was how she started her business of making and selling cakes, desserts and sweets. She has been able to get ahead despite the illnesses she has had.

Maria’s business has grown to be more stable. More and more, her clients are ordering more and it is because of this that she is asking for a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito. This loan will allow her to stock up on the raw materials that she uses; meaning, she will buy flour, eggs, oil, butter, food coloring, and sweet cream among other items. In the future she sees herself opening her own baking school.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, oil, butter, food coloring, sweet cream and other items.

loans.name: Silvia Margoth

texts.es: Silvia de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace 10 años vende de manera ambulante en las diferentes colonias donde ella reside y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Silvia is 44 years of age and lives in her own house with her four children. She has worked selling personal products for 10 years. She sells her products by travelling through the different communities where she lives. With the income that she earns she is able to cover some of the expenses of her home. 
She is requesting the loan to buy wholesale perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, etc. and in this way continue with her work in order to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 47-years-old, married and has seven children. To earn a living she engages in fish vending with the help of her husband, who is a fisherman. Both husband and wife wants to give their children a good life so they need to increase their income. She decided to borrow a loan to buy more fish to sell in order to generate more income.

In future, Concepcion plans to save money to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora, 45 years old, is single and has one child. For the past 6 years, she has operated an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.
