Nora also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs. Nora works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Hilda Carolina

texts.es:
Hilda es una joven de veinticinco años de edad, ella decidió formar una familia, el hecho de ser mamá por primera vez, la maravillo tanto, que emprendió un negocio de elaboración de todo tipo de ropa para bebes y niños en edades menores a cinco años. Es muy creativa, ha logrado vender colecciones completas de ropa de niña para las distintas temporadas del año. Su negocio se ha fortalecido notablemente.
En estos momentos, ha decidido apostar a más, creando ropa con más elaboración, con telas y aplicaciones más costosas, es por eso que ha solicitado un préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, ya que este financiamiento le daría la oportunidad de cumplir esta idea y comprar telas, aplicaciones, hilos entre otros. Junto con su hermano, Hilda, ha sacado adelante lo que comenzó como un pequeño negocio, su meta es poder elaborar ropa para todas las edades y tener su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Hilda is a twenty-five-year-old young woman. She decided to start a family, and the fact of being a mother for the first time was such a marvel to her that she started a business making all kinds of clothing for babies and children under the age of five. She is very creative and has been able to sell full collections of girls' clothing for the different seasons of the year. Her business has gotten noticeably stronger.

At this time, she has decided to invest more, creating clothing that requires more preparation, with more expensive fabric and applications. For this reason she is asking for a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito, as this financing will give her the opportunity to fulfill this idea and to buy fabric, applications and thread, among other items. Along with her brother, Hilda has gotten what began as a small business off the ground. Her goal is to be able to make clothing for children of all ages and to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy fabric, applications and thread, among other items.

loans.name: Jose Rene

texts.es: Jose de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol), cuenta con mas de 20 años de experiencia y vende en épocas de verano, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Jose esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para seguir con sus cultivos y así tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Jose is 38 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife. He works growing basic grains (corn and beans). He has more than 20 years experience and he sells in the summer. With the earnings that he obtains he pays for some of the household expenses.

Jose is asking for a loan in order to buy fertilizer, compost, pest control, herbicides, etc.,  improving the land shown in the photograph, in order to continue growing his crops and thus have better financial earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost, pest control, and herbicides, etc., improving his land

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco, es un hombre fuerte y decidido, desde los dieciocho años, emprendió su propio negocio de un taller de mecánica, con el objetivo de ser su propio jefe, para no depender de nadie. Poco a poco ha ido fortaleciendo su taller, en la actualidad se encuentra con clientes fieles a su trabajo y calidad. El apoyo incondicional de su esposa e hijos, son su principal impulso para cada día ser mejor.
En estos momentos, Francisco, ha recurrido a un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, para poder comprar nuevas herramientas que van a mejorar la calidad de su trabajo, el mundo de la mecánica automotriz se ha actualizado, y este hombre trabajador no puede quedarse atrás. En un futuro planea tener un taller más grande y con lo último en la tecnología para reparar automóviles.
texts.en:
Francisco is a strong and determined man, at the age of eighteen he started his own auto mechanics business, with the aim of being his own boss, in order not to depend on anyone. Little by little he has strengthened his workshop, currently he has clients loyal to his workmanship and quality. The unconditional support of his wife and children is his main impulse impulse to be better each day. 

At this time, Francisco is asking for a loan from Kiva together with MiCrédito, in order to be able to buy new tools that are going to improve the quality of his work. The world of auto mechanics has updated, and this hardworking man cannot lag behind. In the future he plans to have a bigger workshop with the latest in auto repair technology.

loans.use: buy new tools.

loans.name: Lizette  Carolina

texts.es: Lizette tiene 21 años de edad, esta soltera y se dedicada exclusivamente a sus estudios donde ya va por el VII ciclo de la carrera de contabilidad en una universidad privada. El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar una computadora ya que esta herramienta le será muy útil para realizar sus trabajos de la universidad y así culminar satisfactoriamente sus estudios y poder trabajar en empresas muy importantes para obtener la experiencia suficiente como para implementar su propio estudio contable y generar empleo para muchos chicos que como ella desean superarse profesionalmente. Lizette se siente muy contenta y agradecida con el apoyo que está recibiendo por parte de los inversionistas de KIVA.
texts.en:
Lizette is 21 years old, is single, and dedicates her time exclusively to her studies. She is now in seventh cycle of an accounting degree in a private university. 

The loan will be used to buy a computer, because this tool will be very useful for completing her university work. That way, she can successfully finish her studies, and be able to work in major companies to obtain sufficient experience to start her own accounting firm. She can then generate work for many kids who, like her, wish to excel professionally.

Lizette feels very pleased and grateful with the support that she is receiving from the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es:
Doña Luisa, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, ella fue madre soltera de tres hijos, los cuales en la actualidad son su principal apoyo, posee un negocio de venta de repostería, refrescos naturales, fruta y golosinas, todas las tardes, ella se pone afuera de su casa a ofrecer sus ricos productos a quien pase por ahí, gracias a su calidad, cuenta con fieles clientes que se deleitan probando su especialidad, el fresco de cacao. 
En estos momentos, esta mujer emprendedora, desea producir más, es por eso que ha recurrido a un préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, que le permitirá abastecerse de lo fundamental en la elaboración de sus productos, y comprar, azúcar, frutas, colorante, harina, dulces, bolsas, servilletas, entre otros. En un futuro desea poner un café, donde también pueda servir platos fuertes como desayuno y almuerzo.
texts.en:
Luisa is a happy and hardworking woman. She was a single mother to three children who are now her main support system. She has a business of selling baked goods, natural refreshments, fruit and sweets. Every afternoon she sets up outside of her house to offer her delicious products to those who pass by. Thanks to the quality of her products, she has faithful clients who are delighted to try her specialty cacao drink.

Presently, this entrepreneurial woman wishes to produce more and it is because of this that she has returned to ask for a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito. This loan will allow her to stock up on the basics she needs for the creation of her products and buy sugar, fruit, food coloring, flour, sweets, plastic bags, and napkins among other items. In the future, she hopes to open a café where she would also be able to serve full meals such as breakfast and lunch.

loans.use: to buy sugar, fruit, food coloring, flour, sweets, plastic bags and napkins among other items.

loans.name: Gigina

texts.en: Gigina is a hardworking entrepreneur with four children. She has a general store in the Philippines and industriously earns additional income through other business ventures such as a fishing business. Gigina has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. She dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila, 56 years old, has two children. She has an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Cirila has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cirila has been in this business for 12 years and has previously borrowed 14 times from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Cirila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores, 35 years old, is married and has six children, all in school. Dolores has an agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Dolores has been in this business for 9 years and has previously borrowed 10 times from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a Kiva borrower, with 3 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy and she operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her primary customers are all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a large scale boutique within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa, 52 years old, is married and has five children. Elsa works very hard to provide for them. For the past 5 years, Elsa has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as bread, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries to sell. In the future, Elsa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as bread, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres La Independencia Group

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 42 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 5 y 19 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de la aldea Guiniales.
Isabel para poder obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, ella lleva seis años de realizar este negocio, Isabel gracias a la amabilidad con la que atiende su negocio, cuenta con suficientes clientes y con la mercadería que tiene ya no se da abasto, por tal motivo solicita un crédito para poder comprar más mercaderías como: güipiles, cortes y fajas y así satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
El gran sueño de Isabel es poder construir una casa de block, para que su familia viva mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 42 year old woman. She is married and she has a beautiful family of four children between the ages of 5 and 19 years old. This humble family lives in a community of the village of Guiniales.

In order to obtain income and get her family ahead Isabel works buying and selling traditional clothing. She has been in this business for six years. Thanks to her friendly manner carrying out her business Isabel has enough clients and the merchandise that she now has is not enough. For this reason she is requesting a loan to be able to buy more merchandise like güipiles (traditional blouses), skirts and belts to better satisfy the needs of her clients.

Isabel's great dream is to construct a house of cinder blocks so that her family lives better.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Mushtaq’S Group

texts.en:
Mushtaq is a poor farmer from Khan Musalman, a remote town in District Gujranwala in Pakistan. He is a progressive farmer and strives to increase the yield of his crops by employing an optimum mix of agricultural inputs. One of the biggest challenges being faced by him and his group members is the ability to finance the purchase of agricultural inputs. 

Since they have no other option, they have to rely on middle men who pledge the farmers' upcoming crop against the inputs provided and pay lesser prices compared to prevailing market rates. 

He and his group members are requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs which will release them from the manipulation of these middle men and allow them to sell their produce at prevailing market rates and increase their rate of return.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be honest and she operates a farm where she keeps cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large scale business. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks, snacks, bananas and basic grains, among other products, in order to increase her sales and generate greater income.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 59 y/0 and comes from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Nicholas who is  her business partner and now blessed with grandchildren. Life has not been easy for the couple but they strive hard to support their family. She has a number of businesses in which she and her husband invest their time and energy to cover their daily needs. 

Ellen has been operating her small store for five years already. Aside from her store she also has a place in "talipapa" (wet public market) plus her chairs and tables for rent on special occasion. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 1000 a day. 

She is humbly asking for your help to maintain and grow her businesses. She hopes she can avail of a 30000 Php loan to buy grocery items like canned goods, coffee, eggs, instant noodles, beverages, charcoal, etc. Part of the loan she will also use to buy fresh chicken, pork and veggies to sell at their town's public market. She will be grateful for your support on her businesses since her earnings will surely cover their daily sustenance and will enable her to assist her grandchildren in their school requirements.

Ellen's simple dream is to expand her businesses and be able to send her grandchildren to good schools. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional grocery items, beverages , charcoal, meat and vegetables as well to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an awning, chairs and tables.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is 42 years old, married with five children, four of whom in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

Vivencia has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buy and sell rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc

loans.name: John Seiver

texts.es: John es un joven con muchas aspiraciones que decidió iniciar su propio negocio puesto que su madre es comerciante de productos por catálogos; ella le ayudó con el capital inicial con mucha expectativa y buenos deseos hacia su hijo quien sueña con continuar estudiando para ser profesional.  Él se dedica todos los días a ofrecer a sus amigos, conocidos y referidos los productos de la oferta del catálogo, quienes compran a crédito prendas de vestir, perfumes, lociones corporales, desodorantes y demás productos para el cuidado personal.  Como su capital le es insuficiente para responder a la demanda de pedidos de sus clientes, está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar cremas, prendas de vestir y perfumes.  Gracias a esta inversión podrá responder oportunamente a los requerimientos de mercancías de sus clientes y con garantizar buenas utilidades.
texts.en: John is a young man with a lot of aspirations who decided to start his own business. Since his mother sells things from catalogs, she helped him with the initial capital with a lot of expectations and good wishes towards her son who dreams of continuing to study in order to be a professional. He makes a living each day by offering the products sold in the catalog to his friends, acquaintances and people they refer, who buy clothing, perfumes, body lotions, deodorants and other personal care products on credit. Since the capital he has is insufficient to respond to the demands of what his customers request, he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing he has received from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy creams, clothing and perfumes. Thanks to this investment he will be able to respond to his customers' needs for merchandise in a timely manner and ensure good utility.

loans.use: to buy creams, clothing and perfumes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 37 years old, married with no child living in Kasese Uganda. Rose is a poultry farmer who has been in that business since 2010. She also does tailoring services for as an additional source of income. 

She has hopes of being the biggest supplier of eggs and chicken in her area despite the challenge of chicken diseases and high prices of feed. Rose will use the loan to buy chicken feed to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed to expand her poultry business.

loans.name: Rozzette

texts.en:
Rozzette is a married woman with one child who operates a retail shop in Hoima-Uganda. For extra income she carries out farming of cassava. On realizing the need of complementing her husband’s earnings, she ventured into business in 2013 to generate more income. 

Her business is exposed to high rental fees, yet she desires to have a well stocked business in town that will satisfy the demands of her customers. Rozzette is requesting a loan to buy stock items like salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock items like salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Maria Aurora

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 50 años de edad, casada y madre de 4 hijos. 
Actualmente se gana la vida con la venta de mercancía por como ropa, calzado y accesorios; esta actividad la inició gracias al apoyo de un familiar, con este negocio ha logrado obtener ingresos para apoyar el sustento de su familia. 

Es una persona emprendedora y luchadora, con ganas de salir adelante para seguir con su negocio. 

Este crédito que solicita con la Corporación Interactuar desea invertirlo en la compra de surtido de mercancía como ropa para caballeros, busos, camisetas, entre otros, con el fin de tener la oportunidad de incrementar sus ventas ofreciendo mayor variedad de productos que satisfagan los diversos gustos y requerimientos de sus clientes que principalmente son amigos y vecinos. 

Su principal sueño es tener gran cantidad de surtido y ampliar la cartera con los clientes buenos y aumentar sus ventas, así podrá tener un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Maria, age 50, is married and has four children.  She currently earns a living selling merchandise like clothes, shoes, and accessories.  She started this business activity thanks to a relative’s support.  With this business she has managed to get income for her family’s sustenance.

She is an enterprising and tenacious person with the desire to get ahead in order to continue with her business.

With this loan that she is requesting from the Interactuar Coporation she wishes to buy a stock of merchandise like men’s clothes, sweatshirts, and t-shirts, among others.  She will do this in order to have the chance to increase her sales.  She will do this by offering a greater variety of products that will satisfy the diverse tastes and needs of her customers.  They are mostly her friends and neighbors.

Her main dream is to have a great quantity of stock, to expand her customer base with good customers, and to increase her sales.  This way she will have a better sense of well-being.

loans.use: to buy a stock of merchandise like men’s clothes, sweatshirts, and t-shirts, among others.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a male aged 25 married with one child who attends school living in Kasese Uganda. He owns a general merchandise retail shop and gets additional income from fish selling and has been in business since 2011. He began the business in order to meet family expenses. 

He is in need of a loan to buy house construction materials such as cement and sand to meet his desire of building a residential house. He has a dream of also constructing a commercial house and start earning rent incomes. His challenge is price fluctuations of his products and high transport costs.

loans.use: to buy house construction materials like cement and iron bars.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma es una joven de 29 años de edad, es soltera y cuenta que se encuentra muy satisfecha por el crédito al que pudo tener la oportunidad de acceder, porque gracias a este apoyo ella logro construir su casa, Vilma es una de las pocas jóvenes que se esmera por salir adelante  y es por ello que se ha ganado la admiración de sus vecinos porque todos los días sale a trabajar para poder cubrir los gastos de su casa y seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia, Vilma con el afán de terminar la construcción este año solicita un nuevo crédito para poder comprar piedrín, arena, cementos, piso cerámico y poder instalarse en este mismo año en su nueva casa.El gran sueño de Vilma es poder incrementar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Vilma is 29 years old. She is single and is very satisfied with the loan that she was able to obtain as thanks to the support she could build her house.

Vilma is one of a few young people who endeavor to get ahead. That is why she has obtained the admiration of her neighbors because every day she goes to work in order to cover the household expenses and continue improving the quality of life for the family.

With an eagerness to finish the house this year Vilma is asking for a new loan in order to buy gravel, sand, cement, and ceramic flooring in order to install it this same year in her new house.

Vilma’s dream is to be able to expand her business in order to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as gravel, sand, cement, and ceramic flooring

loans.name: Sajjad’S Group

texts.en:
Sajjad is a resident of Khan Musalman, a village located in District Gujranwala. He is the sole bread earner of his family and cultivates rice and wheat to feed them.

He and his group members are poor farmers and always struggle to finance their agricultural inputs in timely manner. With the proposed credit facility the group members are hopeful to finance their agricultural inputs for rice crop in a timely manner and ensure a better yield. 

Group members are committed to be responsible borrowers.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel etc.

loans.name: Ada Isabel

texts.es: Ada tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hija de 16 años de edad quien estudia en una escuela cercana a su vivienda gracias al apoyo que recibe de sus padres con el fin de que ella llegue a ser algo importante en la vida. Ada desde hace ocho año junto con su esposo  se dedican a prestar los servicios de  transportar materiales de construcción como son: piedra, piedra, grava, tierra entre otros, lo cual hacen  por medio de una carreta de madera la cual es jalada por un par de bueyes. Ada desea realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda pero debido a que no cuenta con la capacidad económica ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para poder comprar: lámina, cemento y arena con el propósito de cambiar el techo el cual se encuentra deteriorado y al mismo tiempo repellar las paredes de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Ada, age 55, lives with her husband and her 16 year old daughter.  Her daughter goes to a school close to her house.  Thanks to the support that she gets from her parents, she will become someone important in life.

For eight years Ada and her husband have been providing services of transporting construction materials like rocks, gravel, and soil, among others.  They do this with a wood cart that is pulled by a pair of oxen.

Ada wishes to make some improvements to her house.  However, because she does not have the financial ability to do.   Therefore, she has made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI.  She will use the loan to buy laminated metal sheeting, cement, and sand.  She will do so in order to change the roof, which is damaged.  She will also plaster the walls of her house.

loans.use: to buy laminated metal sheeting, cement, and sand to change the damaged roof and to plaster the walls.

loans.name: Gabriela Guadalupe

texts.es: Gabriela de 19 años vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos ella siempre se ha esforzado por ayudar para llevar el sustento diario a su casa para sus hijos ella siempre ha sido muy responsable y trabajadora hace cinco años ella comenzó el negocio de vender ropa americana usada ya que la demanda de esta es muy grande ella compra dos veces al mes por mayoreo   dicha actividad la realiza en las calles del municipio y en ocasiones viaja a otros departamentos del país a ofrecer sus productos. Ella está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: zapatos, pantalones cortos, cinchos, utensilios, etc. ella espera recibir la ayuda de este crédito para invertir de inmediato en su negocio y así obtener más ganancias y mejorar aún más la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Gabriela, age 19, lives with her life partner and their two children.  She has always put forth great effort to help bring home the daily sustenance.  For her children she has always been very responsible and hard-working.

Five years ago she started the business of selling used American clothes.  There is a great demand.  She buys wholesale two times a month.  She sells on the streets in her municipality, and she sometimes goes to other departments in the country to offer her products.

She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy shoes, short pants, belts, and utensils, etc.  She hopes to receive the help of this loan in order to immediately invest in her business.  This way she will get more earnings and improve her family’s quality of life even more.

loans.use: to buy shoes, short pants, belts, and utensils, etc. for her clothing sales.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: María es una señora de 45 años, Maria es madre soltera y sus  hijos tiene 8, 9, 14, 18, 21, 24 y 26 años de edad, María vive en el campo junto a sus 4 hijos menores ya que los demás ya tienen sus propios hogares. Para sacar adelante a sus hijos María siempre se ha dedicado a la crianza de animales y al jornal en la agricultura. María comenta que tiene una enfermedad en uno de sus  ojos, que no puede ver claramente, pero esto no le impide seguir en su trabajo diario. María solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra  de chanchos. María  espera  seguir adelante en su negocio, este se haga mas rentable y asi cubrir los gastos en su hogar y mas que todo los estudios de sus hijos por lo menos para que lleguen a ser bachilleres.
texts.en:
María, age 45, is a single mother.  Her children are 8, 9, 14, 18, 21, 24, and 26 years old.  María lives in the country with her four minor children.  The rest of the children have their own households.

In order to get her children ahead, María has always raised animals and worked as an agricultural day worker.  María says that she has a disease in one of her eyes, and she is not able to see clearly.  However, this does not keep her from continuing with her daily work.

María is requesting the loan to buy pigs.  María hopes to get ahead in her business.  This makes it more profitable.  This way she will cover the household expenses, and above all, her children’s education at least through high school.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 35 years old and married with four children who are in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nicolas Florentino

texts.es: Nicolás, tiene 33 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos, y reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura con el cultivo de maíz y frijol, actualmente lleva 8 años de cultivar café, el cual lo vende  en oro en el mercado local y de allí obtiene sus propios ingresos. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y aplicarle a su finca de café. Tiene pensado seguir invirtiendo en su finca para poder mejorar su casa con las ganancias.
texts.en: Nicolás is 33 years old, married, and has 4 children. He lives in a village in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. He has always made a living in agriculture, cultivating corn and beans. Currently, he has 8 years cultivating coffee, which he sells as parchment coffee in the local market and there is able to obtain his own income. He has decided to request a loan in the amount of 10,000 Lempiras to buy fertilizers and apply them on his coffee farm. He plans to continue investing in his farm in order to improve his house with his earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to apply on his coffee farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two young bulls and a bull calf.

loans.name: Zulma De Los Angeles

texts.es: Zulma de 41 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores  de 7 y 5 años de edad ella es muy responsable con su familia y dedicada a sus qué hacerse del hogar en el tiempo que ella está ahí porque su trabajo es casi de tiempo completo. Ella se dedica al a la venta de ropa usada dicha actividad la realiza en los cantones aledaños a su municipio ella recorre las calles de los mismos ofreciendo sus productos sus clientes la prefieren por el buen estado y calidad de sus productos. Ella está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en: zapatos, pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa de cama, carteras, y ropa de niños y niñas y así dejar mercadería también en su casa porque en lo que ella sale a vender en ocasiones los clientes llegan a buscarla y comprar, y a la vez mejorar las ganancias de su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos espera contar con el apoyo de este crédito para invertir de inmediato en su negocio.
texts.en:
Zulma, age 41, lives with her husband and her two minor children, ages seven and five.  She is very responsible with her family, and she devotes herself to the household chores when she is there because her work is almost full time.

She sells used clothes in the cantons around her municipality.  She travels on its streets selling her products.  Her customers prefer her because of the good condition and quality of her products.

She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy shoes, pants, shirts, blouses, bed clothes,  wallets, and children’s clothes.  This way she can also have merchandise at her house because sometimes the customers comes and look for her to make their purchases.  This will improve the earnings in her business, and it will improve her children’s quality of life.  She hopes to get the support of this loan in order to immediately invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes, pants, shirts, blouses, bed clothes,  wallets, and children’s clothes in order to offer a greater variety.

loans.name: San Pedro El Naranjo Group

texts.es: Gabino, tiene 39 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 5 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá. Gabino se dedicaba  a realizar trabajos de jornal para obtener  ingresos para su familia y hace dos años que vende café de su propia finca. Esta producción la vende en la zona de Intibucá. El solicita un prestamo en forma grupal para comprar abono, foliar y pago de limpieza de la finca de café para esperar una mejor cosecha de calidad. Su meta es incrementar siembra de café para obtener más ganancias. El grupo se llama San Pedro el Naranjo, formado por 5 personas que se dedican al cultivo de café y residen en la misma comunidad. El prestamo total del grupo es por 36,000 lempiras y lo invertirán en darle asistencia a sus fincas. En la foto esta Salomé a la izquierda, Gabino y Juan, sentados esta Olman a la izquierda y Amilcar a la derecha.
texts.en:
Gabino, age 39, is married and has five children.  He lives in a village in the Inibucá municipality.  He has been selling coffee from his own farm for two years.  He sells this production in the Intibucá area.

He is requesting a loan as part of a group in order to buy compost and foliar application and to pay for clearing the coffee farm.  He will do this in the hope of getting a better quality harvest.

His goal is to increase his coffee crops in order to get more earnings.

The group is called San Pedro el Naranjo, and it is comprised of five members who grow coffee and reside in the same community.  The total loan amount for the group is 36,000 lempiras.  They will use it to care for their farms.

In the photo Salomé is on the left, Gabino and Juan are seated, Olman is to the left, and Amilcar is on the right.

loans.use: to buy compost and foliar application and to pay for clearing the coffee farm.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis tiene 20 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad y día a día lucha para poder salir adelante. Luis es un joven dedicado a su labor que desempeña como transportista de diferentes productos como: comidas, electrodomésticos entre otros, es un trabajo que realiza  desde hace dos años  en su municipio  por medio de una motocicleta la cual alquila para de esta forma poder cumplir con sus servicios que a diario solicitan sus clientes, es así como el se gana la vida y logra suplir sus necesidades personales y las del hogar. Luis con el propósito de evitar los gastos de alquiler y así mejorar sus ganancias por el servicio que presta ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para poder comprar una motocicleta y de esta forma poder seguir desempeñando  su labor como transportista y poder así ayudar a las personas mediante su trabajo.
texts.en: Luis is 20 years old, lives in his own house, and every day fights to get ahead. Luis is a young man dedicated to his work as a driver transporting different products, such as food, electrical appliances, among other things. This is a job he has been doing for two years in his municipality by motorcycle, which he rents in order to complete his services which his customers request daily. This is how he makes a living and is able to fulfill his personal and household needs. Luis, with the purpose of avoiding the expenses in renting and to improve his earnings through the services he offers, has taken the decision to request a loan to FUSAI to buy a motorcycle and thus be able to continue his job as a driver, and this way, help people through his work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle and thus be able to continue his job as a driver.

loans.name: Juntos Triunfaremos En Cocachacra Group

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer trabajadora y responsable de la educación y alimentación de sus 02 hijos con el apoyo de su esposo. Ella tiene una bodega bien surtida con los productos de primera necesidad productos de limpieza. Ella tiene como objetivo implementar su negocio con la venta de útiles de escolares. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de útiles de escritorio lápices lapiceros cuadernos y colores. El grupo “JUNTOS TRIUNFAREMOS EN COCACHACRA” agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Rosa es la que se encuentra parada en el medio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a hard-working woman.  With her husband’s help she is responsible for the education and food for her two children.  She has a store that is well-stocked with basic needs cleaning products.

Her objective is to set up her business selling school supplies.

She will use the loan to buy desk supplies, pencils, pens, notebooks, and crayons.  

The group is called “Juntos Triunfaremos En Cocachacra”.  

She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan that was provided.  

Rosa is the one standing in the middle.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 49 years old. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from trainings, especially on enterprise development. 

Eunice operates a small kiosk selling items like sugar, cooking oil and flour. She also operates a a small greengrocer where she sells assorted vegetables and fruits. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more foodstuffs such as sugar and cooking fat, which will add stock to her kiosk, thus increasing her income. She intends to use the increased income to provide better shelter and clothing to her family.

Eunice is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as sugar and cooking fat, which will add stock to her kiosk, thus increasing her income so that she can provide better clothing and shelter for her family.

loans.name: Anafe

texts.en:
Anafe is 51 years old and married with six children, four of whom are currently in school. Anafe works very hard to provide for them.

Anafe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase grocery items to sell like milk, drinks, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods, eggs, bread, and cooking oil.

Anafe has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell like milk, drinks, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods, eggs, bread, and cooking oil

loans.name: Melany

texts.en:
Melany is a married woman with 10 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Melany is 43 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Melany has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. Melany requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her business.

Melany has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 46 years old, married, and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Elma has been pig fattening for two years, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza works hard to support her family. Liza is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Liza requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Liza has been in this business for six years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Jane is 39 years old and has five children who are in school.

Mary Jane has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the previous loan. She used the amount borrowed to buy a water tank that she is currently using to harvest water for domestic use and for irrigation on her farm. This enabled her to maintain the milk supply and therefore maintain her customers.

She is now borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy feeds so that she can increase milk production and thus earn more income. She intends to use the increased income to pay for her family's basic needs such as food, clothing, and medical expenses.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds

loans.name: Sandra Grisela

texts.es: Sandra, tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos y reside en un sector del municipio de Quimistán, Santa Barbara. Se dedica a la venta de mercadería como ropa nueva y usada, lociones, productos de belleza y también tiene salón de belleza. Este negocio lo tiene hace 8 años en su casa. El prestamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo en ODEF y es por 21,000 Lempiras para comprar fardos de ropa usada, nueva al por mayor, con el fin de poder ampliar su negocio y aumentar las ventas. Su sueño es que su negocio sea el  mas grande de la zona.
texts.en: 40-year-old Sandra is married and has 3 children. She lives in the municipality of Quimistan, Santa Barbara. She works selling merchandise such as new and second-hand clothing, perfumes, and beauty products. She also has had a beauty salon at her home for 8 years. She is requesting her second loan through ODEF. It is for 21,000 Honduran lempiras to buy new and second-hand wholesale clothing bundles. This would help her expand her business and increase her sales. Her dream is for her business to be the largest in the region.

loans.use: to buy new and second-hand wholesale clothing bundles.

loans.name: Cresencia Reyna

texts.es: Cresencia 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar su terreno que muestra la fotografía para continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Cresencia is 36 years old and lives in her own house with her four children. She has worked in agriculture for 10 years, selling her products in the neighboring towns, and with what she earns from her sales she succeeds in forging ahead. Cresencia is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, etc., and to improve her land (depicted in the photograph) so that she can continue with her work, and thus have better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, etc., and to improve her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Las Doncellas Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo Las Doncellas viven en un lugar muy pintoresco y típico de la provincia mexiquense. Las casas, las calles, el palacio municipal y los ferrocarriles ofrecen un cuadro muy atractivo visualmente. Las integrantes se sienten muy orgullosas de vivir en este lugar que inclusive ha sido nombrado por el gobierno del país como uno de los pueblos mágicos debido a su historia, cultura y tradiciones que alberga. Entre las integrantes del grupo existe un lazo de amistad muy fuerte, siempre se apoyan en situaciones difíciles, pero también disfrutan juntas de las festividades de su pueblo como el próximo carnaval que se llevará a cabo en marzo. 
   Doña Bertha es muy amable ante todo muestra una actitud positiva y sobresale porque contagia su alegría. Desde hace 10 años se ha dedicado a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo. El ayudar a sus dos hijos a estudiar una carrera profesional motivó considerablemente a que negocio prosperara, en un inicio sus clientes principales eran amistades y familiares.
    Actualmente trabaja en una farmacia todas las mañanas ya que su espíritu emprendedor no puede descansar, ella comenta “realmente nunca me ha gustado estar en casa sin hacer nada, además necesito dinero para seguir solventando los gastos de mi hogar". Por otro lado cuenta con el apoyo de su hija su llegado el momento ella no pueda atender el negocio de cosméticos. Esta vez solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, labiales, maquillajes, etc. 
   Doña Bertha se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida con los préstamos anteriores de VisionFund pues gracias al apoyo ella incrementó su negocio y pudo pagar los estudios de sus hijos quienes se recibieron como maestra y abogado. 
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Zujey quien invertirá en borregos y conejos; Felipa, abarrotes; Ma. Luisa, en postres; Lilia, en ropa interior; Magdalena, en productos de belleza y Juana, en joyería.
*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de Lilia, doña Bertha es quien tiene cabello corto y viste una blusa color rosa. Hay una persona extra en la foto que también pertenecía al grupo, pero al final no recibió crédito.*
texts.en:
The members of the group “Las Doncellas” live in a very picturesque place, typical of the State of Mexico.  The houses, streets, municipal palace, and railways offer a very visually attractive scene.  The members feel very proud of living in this place, which has even been named by the country’s government as one of the “magical towns,” due to the history, culture, and traditions it is home to.  There is a very strong bond of friendship between the members of the group.  They always support each other in difficult situations, but they also enjoy their town’s festivities together, such as the next carnival, which will take place in March.

Bertha is very friendly.  Above all, she demonstrates a positive attitude, and she stands out because her happiness is contagious.  For ten years, she has worked selling beauty products through a catalog.  Helping her two children go to school for a professional degree considerably motivated her business’s success.  At the start, her primary customers were her friends and family members.

Currently, she works in a pharmacy each morning, since her entrepreneur spirit cannot rest.  She comments, “I’ve never really liked being at home doing nothing.  Besides, I need money to keep meeting my household expenses.”  She also has support from her daughter if a time should come when she is unable to attend to the cosmetics business.  This time, she is requesting a loan to buy beauty products such as creams, perfumes, lipstick, make-up, etc.

Bertha is very happy and grateful for the previous loans from VisionFund, since thanks to that support, she grew her business and was able to pay for her children’s studies, who graduate as a teacher and a lawyer.

The other members of the group are Zuhey, who will buy in lambs and rabbits; Felipa, who will buy groceries; Maria Luisa, who will buy desserts; Lilia, who will buy underwear; Magdalena, who will buy beauty products; and Juana, who will buy jewelry.

The photo was taken in Lilia’s house.  Bertha is the one with short hair, wearing a pink blouse.  There is an extra person in the photo that also belonged to the group, but who did not receive a loan in the end.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as creams, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 40 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Maricar works very hard to provide for them.

Maricar runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Maricar has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries.

In the future, Maricar would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Siona

texts.en:
Siona is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Siona is 45 years old and has one child still in school.

Siona has a nipa-roofing business in the Philippines. Siona requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials like nipa leaves, rope, bamboo sticks and other material for her business.

Siona has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like nipa leaves, rope, bamboo sticks and other material for her business

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en:
Joylyn is 25 years old and single with one child. Joylyn works very hard to provide for them.

Joylyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF grocery items to purchase grocery items to sell like milk, drinks, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods, eggs, bread, and cooking oil.

Joylyn has been in this business for three years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell like milk, drinks, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods, eggs, bread, and cooking oil

loans.name: Giezela

texts.en:
Giezela is 30 years old and has three children. Giezela is single and has three children who are presently in school.

Giezela is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Giezela requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Giezela has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jimy Mizael

texts.es: Jimy, tiene 21 años de edad, esta soltero, vive junto a sus padres en el municipio de Trinidad, Santa Bárbara. Jimy le ayudaba a su padre con el cultivo de granos básicos, ahora tiene 3 años de haber cultivado su propia finca de café, y en temporadas realiza trabajos de jornal. El necesita darle mantenimiento a su finca para obtener buena cosecha este año y ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos, fertilizantes y pago de limpieza de la finca de café. Su meta a corto plazo es sembrar mas plantas de café para ampliar la producción.
texts.en:
Jimy is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the township of Trinidad, Santa Barbara. Jimy helps his father with the cultivation of basic grains. Now he has three years of having cultivated his own coffee farm, and he does seasonal day work. He needs to do maintenance on his farm in order to obtain a good harvest this year, and he has decided to apply for a loan of 20,000 lempiras to buy compost and fertilizers and pay to clean the coffee farm.

His short-term goal is to plant more coffee plants to increase production.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers and pay to clean the coffee farm

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Loida works hard to support her family.

She has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and a general store. Loida is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her stall.

Loida has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her stall

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. Imelda is married and has a business buying and selling personal collection items in the Philippines.

Imelda requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional personal collection items like perfume, body lotion, powder, and beauty soap.

Imelda has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional personal collection items like perfume, body lotion, powder, and beauty soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: repair a machine and purchase fabrics to have available in her inventory.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is from Agarak town of Meghri region. She is married with her husband, two children, mother-in-law and sister-in-law. Meri helps her family in farming work.
 
They currently keep two cows  and also have a beautiful fruit orchard. They grow apricots, peachs, figs, plums, walnuts and pears. 

Willing to enlarge her family's farm, Meri asks this loan to purchase three cows for their farm. As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Meri get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Meri hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for three cows, to develop a new business on her existing farm.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel, tiene 40 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 5 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Manuel lleva 16 años de dedicarse al cultivo de granos básicos como maíz, frijol y café. El café es su producción mas grande actualmente y lo vende en oro en el mercado de la zona.  Está solicitando un segundo préstamo en la institución por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos, fertilizantes y limpieza de su finca de café, para darle mantenimiento y poder sacar mejor cosecha. Su meta es mejorar su vivienda con las ganancias obtenidas.
texts.en:
Manuel, 40 years old, is married and has five children. He resides in a village in the municipality of Gracias in Lempira province.

For the last 16 years Manuel has dedicated himself to the cultivation of basic grains such as corn and beans, plus coffee. At present, his largest production is coffee, which he sells in the markets of the region.

Manuel is requesting from this institution a second loan, of 20,000 Lempiras for the purchase of manure and fertilizers plus the clearing of land for his coffee farm, so that he can maintain it and achieve a better harvest.

His goal is to use the earnings to improve his home.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizers, and to clear land for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es un padre de familia que se esmera mucho  para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, él tiene ahora 52 años de edad, es casado y vive muy feliz con su querida familia. Para Diego la superación es la mayor satisfacción pues con el crédito anterior el logro comprar su lote de terreno y ahora su cultivo ha mejorado, y con ello la calidad de vida de su familia, con las ganancias que genera ha logrado comprarle repuesto a su camión. Diego nuevamente solicita un crédito porque  tiene la necesidad de cambiar el techo de su casa compra de laminas y clavos, que ya se encuentra en muy mal estado.
El gran sueño de Diego es comprar más terreno para que sus hijos cuenten con más lugares donde poder cultivar.
texts.en:
Diego is a father that works very hard to provide a better quality of life to his family. He is 52 years old, married and lives happily with his dear family. Diego's biggest satisfaction is getting ahead in life. With his previous loan, he was able to buy a plot of land, which helped improve his crops and his family's qualify of life. With his profits, he was able to buy replacement parts for his truck. Diego is requesting a new loan as he needs to buy sheets and nails to replace his house's roof, which is in a very bad shape. 

Diego's big dream is to buy more land so that his children will have more space to grow their crops.

loans.use: to buy sheets and nails.

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad and his group members are farmers by occupation. They live in a village named Chadyala, located in district Gujranwala in, Pakistan.

He and his fellow cultivate rice and wheat to feed his family. The soil of the region is very fertile for rice crop provided a right mix of agricultural inputs is utilized during and after cultivation. Unfortunately, the group members are very poor and do not have finance available to purchase the required quantity of fertilizers, fuel and pesticides. 

They are requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticides, improved quality of seeds and fuel for their rice crop. This loan will enable to improve their yield and living standard.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel etc.

loans.name: Qoriccocha De Patabamba Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORICCOCHA DE PATABAMBA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antonia ella es soltera y tiene 47 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de ganadería , la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar ganado.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Qoriccocha de Patabamba." This bank is located in the district of Coya, which belongs to the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.

One of the members is Señora Antonia. She is single. She is 47 years old and she has two children. She works in her business of cattle-raising. She fattens them and raises them, and then she sells them at the various fairs. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She wants to get ahead through this work. Her dream is to expand her business of selling cattle. She is applying for the loan in order to buy cattle.

The other members work in businesses of selling animals, livestock raising, a grocery store, and selling food.

This member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda is 54 years old, separated, and has one child. As a mother and a single parent, she wants to earn income to provide for their needs. She engaged in a sari-sari store business to earn a living but she is still dreaming of a good life for her child. To achieve this, she must increase her income. So she decided to borrowed a loan to buy more good items to sell and increase her inventory in order to get a better income.

Daylinda's plan for the future is to expand her business from her business income.

loans.use: To buy more good items to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Virginia is 57 years old and has two children who are in school.

Virginia has an Avon dealership business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of Avon products to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Lery

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lery works hard to support her family.

She has a business making native products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Lery is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials and maintenance for her business.

Lery has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teodora is 45 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Teodora has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines. Teodora requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of firewood to sell to her customers.

Teodora has been in this business for four years. In the future, Teodora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 40 years old with one child in school. Alona works very hard to provide for them.

Alona runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like home product care, canned goods, and other groceries.

Alona has been in this business for nine years. 

In the future, Alona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like home product care, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 61 years old and has two children. Zenaida is a widowed woman.

Zenaida is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Zenaida has been in this business for 13 years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi works hard to support her family. Noemi is married with three children and has a weaving business in the Philippines.

Noemi requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials and maintenance for her business.

Noemi has been in this business for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a frozen-foods vending business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Teresita has been in this business for four years now.

Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. Susan is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Susan has been in this business for one year.

Susan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more cattle for trade.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is grateful to Kiva for the previous loan through which she bought quality fodder for her dairy. This increased milk production and doubled her income. That enabled her to provide better food and clothing to her family.

She is applying for a second Kiva loan to buy manure and fertilizers to expand her crop farming. This will supplement her income and enable her to pay for her children's tuition fees and continue providing better food and clothing to her family.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the continued financial support.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer to expand her crop farming, and hence earn more income to pay tuition fees and provide better food and clothing to her family.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret thanks Kiva for the previous loan that enabled her to add stock of vegetables. This increased her sales and income. She used that money to support her child's education by buying school uniforms, writing materials and to pay part of the school fees.

She is borrowing an additional Kiva loan to buy dairy feeds for her dairy farming to increase milk production and thus supplement her income. She intends to use the increased profits to add more stock to her vegetable-selling business to further expand it. She will also be able to continue paying school fees for her children.

Margaret is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the continued financial support.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds to increase milk production. She will use the increased profits to expand her vegetable-selling business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente es un hombre de 56 años, casado, con hijos independientes, y su negocio es el comercio de ganado.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, constante, fuerte, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad de la milenaria ‘isla Suriqui’  conocida por su astillero de balsas de totora, un junco acuático local con el que se construyen, a mano y con técnicas heredadas de la época preincaica, embarcaciones capaces de cruzar el Atlántico. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados. 
Vicente es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la agricultura, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante una bomba eléctrica. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado, él se dedica a la compra de teneros para engordarlos y venderlos, actividad que realiza visitando ferias en comunidades vecinas, “crío ganado desde que tengo memoria, y lo cuido con mucho cariño porque son parte de mi vida…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que su ganado es demandado porque son bien cuidados, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de ganado para ampliar su establo. Su sueño es ampliar su establo mejorando su ganado y maquinaria, él desea realizar la compra de ganado mejorado para la cruza con ganado criollo para ampliar su establo y continuar en el negocio. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 37 años que realiza esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Vicente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado mejorado para la cruza con ganado criollo para ampliar su establo y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Vicente, 56, is married and has adult children.  He's enterprising, independent, persevering, strong, responsible, and very hardworking.  His business is selling livestock.  He works in the thousand-year-old community of Suriqui Island, known for its shipyard of rafts made of totora reed, a local aquatic rush used to make the boats by hand with techniques inherited from the pre-Inca period--boats that are capable of crossing the Atlantic.  The climate is cold and dry, and the temperature ranges from zero to 12 degrees centigrade during the day.

Vicente is short and thin and has dark skin, brown eyes, and short black hair.  His native language is Aymara, which is spoken locally, and he speaks Spanish for everyday use and business.  His shares his life with his wife, who works in agriculture.  They live in their own home, made of adobe with a corrugated metal roof and electricity and well water extracted with an electric pump.

He earns a living selling calves to fatten and sell.  He goes to fairs in neighboring communities.  "I have raised livestock for as long as I can remember, and I take care of them with a lot of affection because they're part of my life," he said.  The advantage of his business is that his livestock is in demand because it's well cared for.  The disadvantage is the lack of capital for buying livestock to expand his stable.  His dream is to expand his stable and improve his livestock and his machinery.

Vicente's requesting a loan to buy improved livestock to breed with native livestock to expand and continue with his business.  This is his second loan sequence with the institution in the 37 years he has been working on his own in this business.

loans.use: to buy improved livestock to breed with native livestock to expand and improve his business

loans.name: Sr. De Huanca De Coya Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR DE HUANCA DE COYA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cristina ella es casada y tiene 56 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de tejidos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Señor de Huanca de Coya." This bank is located in the district of Coya, which belongs to the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.

One of the members is Señora Cristina. She is married and is 56 years old. She has three children. She works in her grocery store and restaurant business. She sells products of basic necessity such as rice, sugar, milk, and crackers. She wants to get ahead through this business. She is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman. Her dream is to expand the grocery store business. She is applying for the loan in order to buy rice, sugar, milk, and crackers.

The other members work in the businesses of agriculture, selling weavings, grocery store, and selling animals.

This member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and crackers

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia is 46 years old and married with six dependents. Her youngest child is 15. Two of her children are still attending school. Sergia operates a bamboo furniture business. She makes and sells chairs and other house decor from bamboo. In addition, she also operates a habal-habal (motorcycle) transportation service as a supplementary income source for the family. 

Sergia needs additional funds to finance both her livelihoods. She is asking for a loan to buy materials such as bamboo, and to purchase motorcycle parts. With the presence of these materials, Sergia could produce more furniture to be sold. She will also be able to provide quality services to her respective passengers as well. Thus, this will enable Sergia to provide her children with good food.

Sergia is doing her best to improve both her sources of income successfully, and also to continue support.

loans.use: to buy materials such as bamboo, and to purchase motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 42 years old and married with one child.
 
Angelita has a load-retailer business in the Philippines. Angelita requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more electronic load to sell.

Angelita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Angelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more electronic load to sell

loans.name: Rovi

texts.en:
Rovi is 31 years old and married with one child. Rovi works very hard to provide for them.

Rovi runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase grocery items to sell like milk, drinks, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods, eggs, bread, and cooking oil.

Rovi has been in this business for one year. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell like milk, drinks, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods, eggs, bread, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 47 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Violeta works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Violeta has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, coffee, candies, soft drinks, beer, etc. 

Violeta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Carla

texts.en:
Carla works hard to support her family. Carla is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market.

Carla has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Carla would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 50 years old and has one child in school.

Elizabeth has a business buying and selling personal product care in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, lotion, etc.

Elizabeth has been in this business for four years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell personal product care

loans.name: Graciana

texts.en:
Graciana is 62 years old and widowed with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Graciana is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Graciana has been raising pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Lerry

texts.en:
Lerry is 53 years old and married with six children. Lerry works very hard to provide for her family.

Lerry runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase grocery items to sell like milk, drinks, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods, eggs, bread, and cooking oil.

Lerry has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell like milk, drinks, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods, eggs, bread, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Chheng's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Kampong Thom province, Chheng is 32 years old and a mother of two dependent children. She can earn an income to improve her family’s living conditions via cassava growing and working for others for a fee to get extra income. Cassava prices are going down as she gets yields from her cassava farm. She has been involved in cassava farming for eight years and it earns her about 27,000KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (a Kiva partner). 

Chheng leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will manage her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family living in healthy than before.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Fredelina

texts.en:
Fredelina is 52 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are presently in school. Fredelina works very hard to provide for them.

Fredelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase grocery items to sell like milk, drinks, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods, eggs, bread, and cooking oil.

Fredelina has been in this business for 15 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell like milk, drinks, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods, eggs, bread, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 64 years of age and a widowed woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Juanita has a nipa-roofing business in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy bamboo sticks and other supplies needed.

Juanita has been in this business for nine years.  In the future, Juanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bamboo sticks and other supplies needed

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
