Micheal is a 40-year-old married man with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. He is a hardworking man who loves his retail business of selling sugar, soap, cooking oil and other general merchandise. 

Michael dreams of educating his children and expanding his business in order to sell at both retail and wholesale levels. Micheal is requesting a loan to buy sugar, soap and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and other items to sell.

loans.name: Panaderas De Cote Group

texts.es:
En el Estado de México se ubica una comunidad llena de vegetación lo que la hace un sitio apacible y agradable a la vista. Gran parte de su población se dedica a la cría de animales y al cultivo del maíz; sin embargo si algo caracteriza a la región son sus panaderos quienes tienen fama de ser los mejores. El grupo “Panaderas de Cote” fue nombrado así debido a que las integrantes se dedican a dicha actividad elaborando piezas tradicionales como el “pan de piojo” y el “pan de monte”.
        Doña Hilaria es miembro del grupo y todos la conocen por su amabilidad y buen humor. Formó una familia con Reynaldo desde hace 25 años y han tenido cuatro hijos de los cuales el menor aún depende de la pareja. Ellos forman un verdadero equipo pues comenta “mi esposo aprendió a elaborar pan desde muy pequeño por parte de sus padres, posteriormente él me enseñó a mi” por tal motivo cuando decidieron compartir su vida también decidieron compartir su labor. Trabajan los días  viernes, sábados y domingos mientras que los días restantes hacen entregas en distintos municipios y comunidades; las tiendas de abarrotes y los negocios en el centro del municipio son sus mejores clientes.
   Ella se muestra muy agradecida con los préstamos de VisionFund ya que anteriormente no contaba con un horno y tenía que utilizar el de un familiar, pero ahora gracias al crédito pudo adquirir el suyo propio además de construir su casa y comprar un automóvil donde transportan su producto. Ahora está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar harina, leña y bolsas con el objetivo de aumentar su producción y ganancias. Por ahora el sueño más grande que tiene es apoyar a su hijo pequeño con sus estudios y mejorar su vivienda.
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son Carolina  quien invertirá en borregos; Odilia, en elotes; Leticia y Victoria, en pan y Marcela, en ropa.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleritas del kiosco del municipio, doña Hilaría es quien tiene el traje típico en rosa*
texts.en:
In the State of Mexico, there is a community full of vegetation, which makes it a calm and pleasant site to look at.  A large portion of its population works raising animals and growing corn.  However, if anything characterizes the region, it is its bakers, who are reputed to be the best.  The group “Panaderas de Cote” (or “The Bakers of Cote”) was named as such due to the fact that the members work in that trade, making traditional items like “pan de piojo” (or “louse bread”) and “pan de monte” (or “mountain bread”).

Hilaria is a member of the group, and everyone knows her for her friendliness and good disposition.  She started a family with Reynaldo 25 years ago, and they have had four children, out of whom the youngest still depends on the couple.  They form a true team.  She comments, “My husband learned to make bread from his parents when he was very young.  Later, he taught me.”  For this reason, when they decided to share their lives, they also decided to share their work.  They work on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday, and during the remaining days, they make deliveries in various municipalities and communities.  Grocery stories and businesses in the center of the municipality are their best customers.

She is very grateful for the loans from VisionFund, since previously, she didn’t have an oven, and she had to use one belonging to a family member.  But now, thanks to the loan, she was able to get her own, as well as build her house and buy a vehicle, which they use to transport their products.  Now, she is requesting a new loan to buy flour, firewood, and bags, with the goal of increasing her production and profits.  Right now, her biggest dream is to support her young son in his studies and improve his life.

The other member of the group are Carolina, who will buy lambs; Odilia, who will buy corn; Leticia and Victoria, who will buy bread; and Marcela, who will buy clothes.

The photo was taken on the steps of the municipality’s pavilion.  Hilaria is the one wearing pink traditional garb.

loans.use: to buy firewood and flour.

location.town: Guadalupe Cote, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Pedro Alfonso

texts.es: Pedro  de 28 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos. El es un joven trabajador que se dedica a realizar la labor como cobrador en el transporte colectivo durante la mañana y por la tarde se desempeña como vendedor de calzado para dama en un puesto ambulante dentro del mercado más cercano a su comunidad y  con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Pedro  quiere mejorar sus ventas debido a que las personas cada vez mas solicitan una mayor variedad de calzado, pero debido a que  con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito a FUSAI  para poder comprar zapatos en diferentes tamaños y estilos  para su negocio de venta de calzado.
texts.en:
Pedro, 28, lives in his own home with his life partner and his two children.

He's a hardworking young man who works in public transportation as a conductor in the morning and sells women's footwear in the afternoon in a mobile stall in the market closest to his community.  He manages to pay some of his household expenses with what he earns from his sales.

Pedro wants to improve his sales because people request a wider variety of footwear all the time.  He can't do this with what he earns, however, so he's asking FUSAI for a loan to buy different sizes and styles of footwear for his business.

loans.use: to buy different sizes and styles of footwear for his business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is single with four children, two of whom attend school. She also has additional family members. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.

Grace sells charcoal at the market and has been in this business for nine years. She gets additional income from selling green bananas. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on both a retail and wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Grace has applied for a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. In the future, she would like to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela works hard to support her family. Carmela is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market.

Carmela has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future, Carmela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Era

texts.en:
Era is 49 years old and married with five children, one of whom is still in school. Era works very hard to provide for them.

Era runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase grocery items to sell like milk, drinks, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods, eggs, bread, and cooking oil.

Era has been in this business for two years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell like milk, drinks, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods, eggs, bread, and cooking oil

loans.name: Letania

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Letania works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Letania is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Letania has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram is a married father of 16 children who sells fish. He works hard to sustain his big family. Joram used his previous loan to expand his business and is very grateful for that. 

He has now requested a new loan to buy more fish to sell. He hopes to educate his children, create for them a better future, and to continue expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
Bernarda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Bernarda is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

Bernarda has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Bernarda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food-production business.

Bernarda has been in this business for two years. In the future, Bernarda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Luzviminda is 54 years old.

Luzviminda has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina, her three children and husband live in Ayntap village, Ararat region. Her little son (in the photo), is six years old and her eldest son is 17 years old. 

Alina and her husband currently have one pig only. They purchased construction materials for constructing a barn and expanding the number of animals in the household. The barn construction is currently in process, and Alina asks lenders to help her family with purchasing livestock. They plan to purchase one mother pig and a calf and start enlarging the farm. 

As this is Alina's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Alina will get a chance to have their first loan and develop their business.

Alina, her husband and their three children hope to receive lenders' support and build the farm of their dreams.

loans.use: to pay for one mother pig and a calf, both required for her farm.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia Maribel se sigue dedicando al trabajo en una entidad financiera,la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa. 


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is Maribel.  She continues to make a living at a financial institution.  She is an enterprising woman who through means of her job has gotten her family ahead in life.  

Maribel is seeking the loan in order to buy sound equipment for her house.  She is happy for the loan and promises to complete the repayments.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment for her house.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
La socia Monica se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza  y tambien la socia sigue siendo profesora del nivel primario, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
[Communal bank] member Monica continues working in the business of selling beauty products, and she also continues working as a teacher at the primary level. She is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman who wants to raise her family through this business. She is applying for the loan to buy creams, lipsticks, and perfumes.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make the payments on her account.

loans.use: to buy creams, lipsticks, and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: El Arbolito Group

texts.es:
El lugar donde viven las integrantes del grupo “El Arbolito” es muy reconocido por las fiestas patronales en las cuales los habitantes preparan y comparten platillos en honor a algún santo de la religión católica; estas celebraciones pueden durar hasta tres días. 
 A los integrantes del grupo "El Arbolito" los une un gran lazo de amistad y comunicación que les permite apoyarse en cualquier situación. Doña Loenarda es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, tiene 49 años y está casada con Antonio; juntos han formado una familia muy grande aunque actualmente ya sólo tres hijas dependen de ellos y se encuentran estudiando la secundaria.
 La actividad de Leonarda es la cría de borregos, actividad que inició con la intención de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de educación. Y así, desde hace años la pareja iniciaba a trabajar muy temprano por su familia, él en la construcción y ella atendiendo los quehaceres del hogar y cuidando a los animales que tenían en casa.
 Ya son 8 años de experiencia en el negocio, "Fue justo cuando VisionFund me hizo mi primer préstamo para comprar borreguitos y pastura y el negocio fue creciendo" comenta Leonarda. Doña Leo, como mejor la conocen en la comunidad, aún tiene un sueño que cumplir y es continuar con su negocio, tener más ganancias y apoyar a sus hijas para que estudien una carrera profesional. 
 Las demás integrantes del grupo son Beatriz, Juana, Maria de la Luz R., Maria de la Luz M., Silvia y Julia quines invertirpan en borregos; Ofelia, en su dulcería y Silvia, en su cooperativa escolar.

 *La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del kiosco, en el centro del municipio donde habitan los miembros del grupo.
texts.en:
The place where the members of the “Little Tree” Group live is well known for its saints festivals during which the residents prepare and share dishes in honor of a Catholic saint. These celebrations may last as long as three days.
 
All the members of the “Little Tree” Group are united in friendship and communication which permits them to help each other in whatever situation. Leonarda is a very hard-working and responsible woman, 49 years of age, who is married to Antonio. Together they formed a very large family though, at present, only three daughters depend on them and each one is studying in secondary school.

Leonarda's economic activity is raising young lambs, an activity she initiated with the intention of helping her husband with home and education expenses. Thus, some years ago, the pair began working very early for their family, he in construction while she attended to household matters and cared for their farm animals.

They now have eight years of experience in the business. “It was just when VisionFund gave me my first loan to buy young lambs and pasture them that the business began to grow,” commented Leonarda. “Mrs. Leo,” as she is best known around the community, still has her dream to fulfill, which is to continue with her business, earn more, and help her daughters pursue their studies towards a professional career.

The remaining members of the group are Beatriz, Juana, Maria de la Luz R., Maria de la Luz M., Silvia and Julia, who also invest in lambs, plus Ofelia in her sweets shop, and Silvia in her student coop.

The photo was taken on the stairs of the small pavilion in the center of the municipality where the group members live.

loans.use: to purchase young lambs to raise and sell.

location.town: Tres Estrellas, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is aged 27 years and married to Alice, and he supports two children. 

He has been a dairy farmer for the last two years and the business earns him KES 4,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to enable him increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily. 

He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan, expand his agricultural sector, and educate his children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to enable him increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily.

loans.name: Luis Gilberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 59 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos y de los cuales son todos mayores de edad y cuentan con sus propias familias, ellos viven en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.  Luis para poder obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado mojarras, con este negocio lleva tres años. Para Luis este negocio es muy importante por ser su única fuente de ingresos, es por ello que para él es muy importante realizar un préstamo para poder invertirlo en la producción de pescado mojarras para contar con más mercaderías y satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
El gran sueño de Luis es que su negocio crezca para que sus ingresos mejoren para el bien de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a 59 year old man. He is married and has a nice family with four children, all of which are adults and have their own families. They live in a community of Suchitepéquez. 

To obtain income and keep his family ahead, Luis works buying and selling tilapia fish. He has been working in this business for three years. For Luis, this business is very important because it is his only source of income. This is why it is very important for him to take out a loan to invest in tilapia fish production. This will let him count on more merchandise and better satisfy his customers' needs.

Luis' great dream is for his business to grow so that his income improves for the good of his family.

loans.use: have capital for fish production

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
As a  parent of ten children, Juliet works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Juliet is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pig fattening business.

Juliet has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. 

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through the past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 58 years old, with two children who are in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Leonora  has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia Roxana se sigue dedicando al trabajo en una empresa privada,la socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la scia saca adelante a su familia.La socia solicita le credito para comprar una cocina para su casa. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
[Communal bank] member Roxana continues working for a private business. She is a responsible and hard-working person who is raising her family through this business.

She is applying for the loan to buy a stove for her house.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make the payments on her account.

loans.use: to buy a stove for her house.

loans.name: División La Mesa Centro Group

texts.es:
El grupo División La Mesa Centro está conformado sólo por mujeres trabajadoras y responsables además de alegres y sencillas. Todas tienen un gran espíritu emprendedor, entre ellas existe un lazo de amistad muy fuerte que les permite superar cualquier reto. Están orgullosas de vivir en una comunidad como la suya ya que es una zona rodeada por vegetación abundante y la población dedica su tiempo al cultivo de maíz y la cría de animales.
   Lorena se caracteriza por su carácter amable y su buen sentido del humor, aunque es muy joven tiene muy claros sus objetivos y pretende lograrlos gradualmente. Desde hace un año comenzó con la venta de dulces en el exterior de su casa, su motivación principal fue que justo frente a su hogar se localiza una escuela y los pequeños siempre buscan algún caramelo al terminar las clases. "En un inicio sólo colocaba una pequeña mesa cubierta por un mantel frente a la puerta de mi casa y sobre ella algunos dulces" comentó, actualmente y gracias al éxito obtenido ocupa dos mesas y las llena de una gran variedad de dulces y botanas. La actividad le ha resultado muy conveniente puesto que además de generar ingresos, tiene el tiempo de cuidar y atender a su familia.
   Con la ayuda del préstamo por parte de VisionFund comprara arena, grava, cemento, cal y varillas para construir un local ya que uno de sus sueños es abrir una tienda de abarrotes junto con un molino. No obstante su sueño más grande es el de poder ayudar a sus hijos para que terminen sus estudios y de esta manera obtengan una mejor calidad de vida. 
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Cecilia y Martha quienes invertirán en la compra de borregos y Doña Rosa María, en becerros. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el quiosco del municipio, Lorena es quien viste la chamarra de color blanco.
texts.en:
The group “División La Mesa Centro” is made up of only women, who are hard-working and responsible, as well as happy and unassuming.  They all have a great enterprising spirit.  There exists between them a strong bond of friendship, which allows them to overcome any challenge.  They are proud of living in a community like theirs, since it is a zone surrounded by abundant vegetation.  The population dedicates its time to growing corn and raising animals.

Lorena is characterized by her friendly personality and her good sense of humor.  Although she is very young, she is clear about her goals, and she intends to achieve them gradually.  One year ago, she started out selling sweets outside her house.  Her primary motivation was that just in front of her house there is a school, and the children are always looking for some kind of sweet when their classes end.  She commented, “At the beginning, I would only put out a small table covered with a table cloth in front of the door to my house, with some sweets on top.”  Now, thanks to the success she has had, she uses two tables, and she fills them with a great variety of sweets and snacks.  This business has been very beneficial, since in addition to generating income, she has the time to care for and attend to her family.

With the help of the loan from VisionFund, she will buy sand, gravel, cement, lime, and rods to build a shop, since one of her dreams is to open a grocery store along with a mill.  However, her greatest dream is to be able to help her children to finish their studies, so that way they can have a better quality of life.

The other members of the group are Cecilia and Martha, who will buy lambs, and Rosa María, who will buy calves.

The photo was taken at the municipality’s pavilion.  Lorena is the one wearing the white jacket.

loans.use: to buy materials such as blocks, sand, gravel, lime, rods, etc.

location.town: La Mesa, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 46 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell in her stall.

Helen has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending and raising pigs.

Helen aspires to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 37 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Gina has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Grupo Xojola 5 Group

texts.es: Maria (la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía) es una de las pocas mujeres que se esfuerza y apoya a su familia para salir adelante, ella tiene 60 años de edad, es soltera y cuenta con cuatro hijos de las edades entre 12 y 26 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de la aldea Xojola. Maria a pesar de su avanzada edad se dedica al cultivo y venta de café desde hace 20 años, para ella esta labor es muy importante pues es de donde provienen sus ingresos, ella por ser una de las señoras con más liderazgo en su comunidad un grupo de señoras la eligió para ser la representante de un grupo que solicita un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas para el mantenimiento de café.Maria y su grupo tienen las esperanzas puestas en este crédito para que cada una de ellas logre solventar su necesidad. El gran sueño de esta  mujer es que su cultivo de café aumente para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria (the first woman on the right side of the photograph) is one of the few women who strive and support their family to get ahead. She is 60 years old, is single, and has four children between the ages of 12 and 26 years. This humble family lives in a community of the Xojola village. In spite of her advanced age, Maria makes a living by growing and selling coffee and has done so for the last 20 years. This work is very important to her, as it is where her income comes from. 

Because she is one of the women with the most leadership in her community, a group of women chose her to be the representative of a group that is asking for a loan. She will invest her share in buying agricultural supplies to maintain coffee. Maria and her group have put their hope in this loan so that each of them will be able to meet her expenses. This woman's great dream is for her coffee crop to increase in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Lucio Dagoberto

texts.es:
El socio trabaja en una empresa privada,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el sodio por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su familia,el sueño del socio es tener una empresa inmobiliaria.El socio solicita el credito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member works for a private company from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.  He gets his family ahead with this job.  His dream is to have a real estate business.

He's requesting the loan to buy a television set for his house.  He's happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a television set for his home

loans.name: Helen Roche

texts.en:
Helen Roche is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years.

Helen Roche requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Helen Roche would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard used his previous loan to buy a car for use in a transportation business. He is in the transport business mainly with a taxi service, the business he started with the hope of earning an income. He is faced with the hardships of impassable roads due to unpredictable weather changes and changes in fuel prices. However, he has a vision of buying land and constructing a good house. Richard has asked for a loan to buy another vehicle.

loans.use: to buy another vehicle.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is a farmer. She lives with her husband and they have been running their family farm since their young age.

They currently have four cows and ten calves on their farm. Anahit makes cheese and dairy supplies and her husband sells them in the market. They also have a tractor, which is used for organizing rental works for their villagers and is a source of additional income for Anahit and her husband.
   
Currently, Anahit requests this loan to purchase three cows for her farm and enlarge it. 

As this is Anahit's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Anahit get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Anahit and her husband hope to receive lenders' support and develop the farm of their dreams.

loans.use: to pay for three cows for her farm

loans.name: Jenipha

texts.en:
Jenipha is a married woman and she has been blessed with six kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Jenipha has  operated a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over 15 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Jenipha dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Pamella

texts.en: Pamella is married with three children all attending school. She also takes care of additional family members (sisters). She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family, and rent for business. She sells motor spare parts in a shop that she rents. She works for six days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more motor spare parts. Her major business challenges include the high taxes which reduce her profits. She would like to start importing spare parts.

loans.use: to buy more motor spare parts.

loans.name: Alvaro Javier

texts.es: Javier es un chico de 20 años, vive con sus padre y 3 hermanas, Javier se ha estado dedicando a la agricultura desde hace 2 años atrás junto a su padre, Javier se identifica como un joven positivo en cuanto a su personalidad como la mayoría de los chicos, El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y fungicidas para sus cultivos de papas, Javier comenta que le va muy bien en esta actividad y desea mucho incrementarla para asi poder obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida, y de ser posible le gustaría retomar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Javier is a 20 year old, young man. He lives with his father and three sisters. Javier has been working in agriculture since he joined his father two years ago. Javier identifies himself as a positive youth, like the majority of young men, in regards to his personality. 

He is going to invest the loan in buying fertilizer and fungicide for his potato crops. Javier notes that this work is going very well for him and he very much wishes to increase it. In that way he can obtain better earnings and improve his quality of life. If possible, he would like to return to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicide.

loans.name: Wendlassida Moince Group

texts.fr:
Mme FOURATA est responsable du WENDLASSIDA MOINCE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 16ans et le moins âgé a 07ans. Les 03 vont à l’école et elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme fait le maraichage depuis 2009. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
Elle veut s’acheter 01sac d’engrais, 02boites de semence d’oignon. 
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne pouvoir s'acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Ms. Fourata is the leader of the Wendlassida Moince group. She is doing well. She is married and has three children. Her eldest child is 16 years old, and the youngest is seven. All three attend school. Fourata has four dependents. She has been growing vegetables since 2009. She buys her supplies at the nearby markets. 

Fourata would like to buy one bag of fertilizer and two boxes of onions. She plans to use her revenues to bolster her business. Her goal is to be able to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy one bag of fertilizer and two boxes of onion seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fish for sell.

loans.name: Daniela Stefani

texts.es:
Daniela es una mujer de 22 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es emprendedora, optimista, dedicada, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ dónde hicieron su hogar los damnificados del desborde del río, situado a 12 kilómetros del centro de la ciudad. Los pobladores llegaron de las provincias y el resto del país y se asentaron en esta zona que hoy tiene más del 20% del total de la población, Es el distrito más pobre. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Daniela es de tez morena, ojos marrones, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), Chicharrón de Taitetu (Chanchitos de monte ”taitetú” frito), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno de papa y plátano),  ají de panza (panza de res, cebollas, tomate acompañado con arroz), y otros, actividad que realiza en su puesto de venta fijo de lunes a sábado para la hora de almuerzo y cena, “inicié mi negocio por herencia familiar, cocino desde muy niña y es momento de independizarme…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con experiencia en la elaboración de comida, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mesas y sillas para vender comida. Su sueño es tener un restaurante, ella desea realizar la compra de mesas y sillas para independizarse. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica  a esta actividad independientemente.
Es por esos motivos que Daniela solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para independizarse y abrir unrestaurante.
texts.en:
Daniela is a woman of 22. She is single, without children, and her business is selling traditional food.

She is entrepreneurial, optimistic, dedicated, responsible, and very hard-working. Her business is located in the "Plan 3000" zone, where those affected by the overflow of the river make their home, situated 12 kilometers from the center of the city. The population arrived from the provinces and the rest of the country and settled in this zone, which today has more than 20% of the total population. It is the poorest district. It has a warm subtropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade.

Daniel has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair that she ties back in a pony tail, short stature, and a thin build. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks in her area, and she speaks Spanish because of general culture and for her business. She lives in the house of her parents, who work. They live in a house owned by the family and made of brick and cement with a tile roof and cement floor. It has potable water, electrical energy, and a sewer system. 

Her business is selling traditional food such as soup of dried grains (bone soup), fried rinds from little mountain collared peccaries, stuffed necks (necks from creole chickens, stuffed with potatoes and bananas), spicy cow's stomach (beef stomach, onions, and tomatoes accompanied by rice) and other dishes. She carries out her business at her regular sales stand from Monday to Saturday for the lunch and dinner hours. "I began my business out of family tradition. I cooked since I was a little girl, and it is the moment to become independent," she comments.

The advantage of her business is that she has experience in preparing food. This disadvantage is the lack of capital for the purchase of tables and chairs in order to sell food. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She wants to make the purchase of tables and chairs in order to become independent. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the year that she has been working in this business independently.

it is for these reasons that Daniela is applying for a loan for the purchase of tables and chairs to become independent and open a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs in order to become independent and open a restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to enable her get a better harvest.

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Precilla is encouraged that she was granted a PHP 20,000 loan to buy scrap and recyclable materials to sell. Life is indeed hard for the majority of the Filipinos in the Philippines but Precilla and husband try their best to survive and make ends meet for their family.

Precilla is now again humbly asking for a PHP 30000 loan to sustain and grow her junk shop business. She will use the proceeds of her loan to buy metal, copper, aluminum, plastic to sell them to foundries and the like. Being a hardworking and loving mother she invests her time and energy in taking care of her children but in her junk shop as well. She will be very grateful if she can again avail of your financial support, she is thanking God and you for your good heart. Her earnings will surely cover their daily needs and fund her children's education.

Precilla's simple dream is to expand her junk shop and see all her children go to college. She also prays for an abundant life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables, spices, cooking oil, pots, pans, propane gas, etc. in order to continue her business.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina de 56 años en compañía de su cónyuge, habita en Bogotá municipio de Cundinamarca y su idea de negoció surge cuando contrajo nupcias y aprovecho para aperturar una cafetería ubicada en la urbanización donde reside en centro de la ciudad.  En la actualidad cuenta con 31 años de funcionamiento y un buen posicionamiento en el sector, que le ha permitido generar un ingreso seguro para su familia.  Todos los días los transeúntes del sector pueden degustar de bebidas, mecatos, dulces nacionales y extranjeros  con el mejor servicio a precios de oportunidad, hoy en día con la finalidad de mejorar las condiciones del local, Luz Marina está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar un nuevo refrigerador, así mismo surtido de comestibles.  Con esta inversión podrá ofrecer productos bien conservados y todo el surtido de comestibles necesarios para la venta.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar el local y cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en: Luz Marina is 56 years old and she lives with her husband in Bogota, in the municipality of Cundinamarca. The idea for her business arose when she got married and she took advantage of this time to open a café at the center of the city where she lives. She has been in business for 31 years. Her business is in a good location in the area which has allowed her to generate a secure income for her family. Every day passers-by in the area can savor drinks, pastries, and local and imported sweets with the best service and at great prices. Luz Marina is requesting a Kiva loan to improve the conditions of her shop. This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she will use to buy a new refrigerator and stock groceries. With this investment she will be able to offer well-kept goods and all the groceries necessary to sell. Her future goal is to expand her shop and fulfill her obligations.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and stock groceries.

loans.name: Miraflores Group

texts.es:
Margarita es una mujer de 37 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 14 años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, fuerte, decidida, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en la localidad ‘El torno’ comunidad rural ubicada a 32 kilómetros al Sudoeste de la ciudad, caracterizada por su pintoresco paisaje cubierto por vegetación tropical.  Posee una importante riqueza forestal y diversidad de fauna silvestre. Es centro de acopio de productos del campo. Con una temperatura media anual de 24 grados centígrados.
Margarita es de tez trigueña, ojos marrones, cabello castaño largo ondulado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza(a la izquierda, de pie, viste blusa lila obscura). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que trabaja en el comercio de verduras, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la obligaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como;  taller mecánico, venta de verduras, venta de frutas, venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de medicina natural y tejido de mantas, para solicitar un crédito y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos por catálogo de forma ambulante, ella viaja largas distancias en busca de comercios, tiendas de ropa, oficinas, etc. para encontrar clientes y ofrecer su mercadería, su labor la realiza de lunes a viernes en horarios de oficina y los fines de semana improvisa un puesto de venta para vender durante todo el día en las ferias, “las obligaciones y gastos de mi familia me obligan a buscar a nuevos clientes constantemente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son los 7 días de la semana, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mercadería para estabilizar el negocio. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida, ella desea realizar la compra de cosméticos por mayor para estabilizar su negocio y ayudar a sus hijos a pagar sus gastos. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Margarita solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos por mayor para estabilizar su negocio y darle un futuro mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Margarita is a 37-year-old woman who lives with her partner and has two children who are 7 and 14 years old.  Her business is selling cosmetics.  She is a good mother, enterprising, strong, determined, optimistic, responsible, and very hard-working.  She carries out her business as a street vendor in the rural El Torno community, located 32 kilometers southeast of the city.  It is known for its picturesque landscape covered in tropical vegetation.  It has significant forest wealth and diversity of wild fauna.  It is a center for agricultural products, and has an average annual temperature of 24 degrees centigrade.

Margarita is dark skinned; has brown eyes; and long, wavy, brown hair.  She is short and has a robust physique.  Her mother language is the Guaraní that she speaks at home, but she speaks Spanish in general public and for work.  (She is standing on the left, wearing a dark lilac shirt.)  She shares her life with her partner who works selling vegetables.  They live in their own family home, made of brick and cement.  It has a corrugated roof and a cement floor, and has well water extracted by a pump.  It has electricity but no sewage system.  

Her desire to overcome made her form a communal bank of people so that they could seek a loan and improve their activities. Their businesses include a mechanic workshop, the sale of vegetables, the sale of fruit, the sale of food, the sale of secondhand clothing, the sale of natural medicine, and the weaving of blankets.  Margarita's business is selling cosmetics through a catalog as a street vendor.  She travels long distances in search of shops, clothing stores, offices, etc…in order to find customers and sell her merchandise.  She carries out her work Monday through Friday during office hours, and on the weekends she improvises a stall in order to sell all day long at the fairs.  "The obligations and expenses of my family force me to constantly search for new customers…", she says.  An advantage to her business is that her sales are 7 days a week.  A disadvantage is her lack of capital to buy merchandise in order to stabilize her business.  

Her dream is to improve her quality of life.  She wishes to buy wholesale cosmetics in order to stabilize her business and to help her children cover their expenses.  This is her second cycle of loans with the institution in the two years that she has carried out this activity.  It is for these reasons that Margarita seeks a loan in order to buy wholesale cosmetics to stabilize her business and to provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cosmetics in order to stabilize her business and provide a better future for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la actividad agrícola, vende sus productos agrícolas en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y con lo que obtiene de sus ganancia logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: The young man, whose face has been blurred out because he is 25 years old and lives in a high risk area, cultivates corn and beans, and has worked in the field of agriculture for 8 years. He sells the products from his farm in the area around where he lives, and with what he earns from his profits he is settling some household expenses. The young man lives in his own house with his wife. He is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, etc., and to make improvements to his land (depicted in the photograph) in order to make progress with his work.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, etc., and to improve his property.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
El socio Nicanor se dedica al negocio de renovadora de calzados,el socio arregla calzados,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien.El socio solicita el credito para comprar clavos,cueros y pegamentos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nicanor works as a shoe repairman, repairing shoes from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  He has already run this business for several years and it is doing well.  This member is requesting a loan to buy nails, leather, and glue.

Nicanor is pleased with his loan and is committed to fulfilling his loan payments.

loans.use: to buy nails, leather, and glue.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman with five children. She is 56 years old and three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Sarah has a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Sarah has been in this business for two years. In the future, Sarah would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alijandra

texts.en:
Alijandra is 50 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Alijandra is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Alijandra has been farming vegetables for 10 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 62 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane and vegetables in the Philippines. Gloria is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Grupo Mi Group

texts.es:
La comunidad donde se encuentra el "Grupo MI" es una región con raíces de la cultura mazahua donde aún prevalecen tradiciones e iconografía de la etnia indígena. Los habitantes, además, son personas muy trabajadoras y centradas en las prioridades de su hogar. Gran parte de la población se dedica al cultivo de maíz y a la cría de animales, actividad que representa mayores ganancias para las familias. Asimismo existen pequeños negocios como tiendas de abarrotes, tortillerías y verdulerías donde se encuentran legumbres y frutas de gran variedad. 
 Desde pequeño, Luis ha sido una persona muy alegre, actualmente tiene 22 años y mantiene su buen humor. Él está casado con Clarisa y son padres de dos niñas pequeñas que aún no asisten a la escuela.
 "Desde pequeño me ha gustado vivir emociones fuertes, como ir detrás de un volante" comentó Luis quien hace siete años logró cumplir uno de sus sueños cuando su tío le obsequió un taxi para tener su propio negocio. Sin embargo, su gran pasión es la música, "Siempre mostró un interés en cantar y componer canciones" comentó su hermana Candelaria. Es así que junto con su padre y otro hermano, formaron un grupo ahora muy conocido que tiene presencia en eventos sociales como bodas, XV Años y bautizos, entre otros. En este negocio también han invertido parte de los préstamos por lo que se muestran agradecidos con VisionFund, el dinero les ha ayudado a comprar teclados, bocinas y luces. En esta ocasión, Luis invertirá su préstamo en una estructura para solista, ya que la que tiene ahora la compró cuando comenzaron el grupo hace cuatro años. 
 Luis se muestra muy feliz por tener la oportunidad de realizar lo que más ama: estar arriba del escenario y estar detrás de un volante para poder llevar beneficios a su familia. Su meta ahora es renovar el equipo de su grupo musical y tener instrumentos de mejor calidad.  Por otro lado, su gran sueño es cantar en un escenario más grande con público proveniente de distintos lugares. "Quiero componer un disco y que mi música sea reconocida" comentó con anhelo.
 Los demás integrantes del grupo son María Estela y Feliciana Candelaria quienes invertirán su crédito en servilletas y Luis Enrique, en su herrería.
*La fotografía fue tomada junto al taxi de Luis en el centro del municipio, él es quien viste una playera blanca*
texts.en:
The community where "Grupo MI" is located is in an area with roots in the Mazahua culture, where the traditions and the iconography of the indigenous population still prevail. The inhabitants are also very hardworking and focused on the priorities of their home. A large part of the population grows corn and raises animals, a business that represents the bulk of the income for families. There are also small business like grocery stores, tortillerias and vegetable markets where a large variety of fruits and vegetables can be found. 

Since he was a child, Luis has been a very happy person. He is now 22 years old and maintains his good humor. He is married to Clarisa and they are the parents of two small girls who aren't yet in school. "Since I was a child I have liked thrilling experiences, like being behind a wheel," said Luis. Seven years ago he was able to fulfill one of his dreams when his uncle gave him a taxi so that he could have his own business. However, his passion is music, "He always showed an interest in singing and composing," said his sister Candelaria. Luis formed a music group with his father and brother. They are now well known and perform at social events like weddings, sweet sixteen parties, baptisms and other events. He has also invested part of his VisionFund loans in this business and he is very thankful. The money has allowed him to buy keyboards, speakers and lights. 

On this occasion, Luis will invest his loan in a structure for a soloist since the one he currently has he bought four years ago when he first started the music group. Luis is very happy to have the opportunity to do what he loves most: to be on the stage and behind a wheel to be able to provide for his family. His current goals are to restore his musical equipment and to have better quality instruments.  In addition, his big dream is to sing on a larger stage with an audience from different areas. "I want to compose an album and for my music to be well known," he said longingly. The other members of the group are Maria Estela and Feliciana who will invest in napkins and Luis Enrique who will invest in blacksmith materials. 

*The photograph was taken next to Luis's taxi in the center of town, he is the one wearing a white shirt.*

loans.use: to build a new soloist stage.

location.town: San Miguel La Labor, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Veronica Yesenia

texts.es: Verónica  tiene 34 años de edad y vive en casa propia junto a su hijo de 12 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando actualmente. Verónica es la principal responsable de su hogar dado que su compañero de vida emigró al extranjero en busca de mejores oportunidades económicas para dar a su familia una mejor condición de vida. Verónica a diario se gana la vida por medio de la venta de ropa y calzado para dama desde hace tres años, y este negocio le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y dar a su familia lo necesario en el hogar. Verónica anteriormente obtuvo un crédito el cual uso para reparar el techo de su vivienda pero a causa de que el monto no le alcanzo para hacer el cambio por completo ella  solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para continuar la reparación del techo de su vivienda que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado y en tiempo de lluvia el agua se filtra. Por lo anterior ella con el monto otorgado piensa invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos, etc. para continuar con las mejoras del techo de su hogar.
texts.en:
Verónica is 34 years old and lives in her own house with her 12-year-old son, who currently attends school. Verónica is the primary caretaker in her household because her life partner emigrated in search of better economic opportunities to improve their family’s quality of life.

For the past three years, Verónica has been making a living day-to-day selling women’s clothing and footwear. This business has allowed her to support her household and give her family what they need.

Verónica previously obtained a loan to repair the roof of her house, but because the amount didn’t allow her to complete the project, she is requesting a new loan from FUSAI to continue repairing the roof, which is currently deteriorating, and leaks when it rains. Therefore, with the loan, she plans to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails, etc. to continue with improvements to the roof of her home.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails, etc. to continue with improvements to the roof of her home.

loans.name: Elsa Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Elsa de 40 años de edad, vive con su hijo en su casa de habitación ubicada en una aldea de San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras donde se dedica desde hace 08 a la compra y venta de mariscos, sus clientes son amigos, vecinos y personas que visitan el puerto los cuales le prefieren por su buena atención y precios.
Doña Elsa esta actividad la realiza los sábados y domingos, también tiene un trabajo parmente en una dependencia del estado y esto le ayuda a tener mejores ingresos y poder salir adelante con su familia, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mariscos como camarones, jaibas, etc. 
Doña Elsa con el apoyo de este préstamo espera tener más producto para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande  de venta de mariscos y poder trabajar con la mayor parte de los pescadores de la zona. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras  -   Julio del  2015.
texts.en:
Elisa is 40 years old and lives with her son in her home located in a neighborhood of San Lorenzo, Valle in the south of Honduras where she has been selling seafood for eight years. Her customers are friends, neighbors, and people that visit the port and prefer her good service and prices. Elsa works on Saturdays and Sundays, she also has a permanent job with a state agency and this allows her to have a better income and get ahead with her family. 

Elsa is requesting this loan to buy seafood like shrimp, crabs, etc. With the help of this loan, Elsa hopes to have more product to satisfy her customers' demands. Her dream is to have a larger seafood selling business and to be able to work with most of the fishermen in the area.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, crabs, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Gayatri Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Subarna is a 42-year-old mother of two children. She is the one standing on the extreme left in a yellow saree. She lives with her husband and her two children, one daughter and one son, in Koraput district, Odisha, India. Her oldest daughter is studying in a college, and her son is studying in secondary school. 

Her family’s main occupation is goat breeding for meat and mushroom growing. It is said that selling several animals can bring in tens of rupees every year in profit, but it is just enough to cover food. What is left is not enough to invest more in the breeding business to get more income for the family. That is why Subarna really wants to borrow a loan for investing in this purpose. 

Along with her group member Pana, she has requested a loan amount of 24,000 INR and she will use her portion to invest more in the breeding business. She will work hard to earn money to repay Peoples Forum and she hopes that the loan will help her family invest in developing better breeding and her family life will be improved. On behalf of her group, Subarna says, "Thank you, Kiva, for this opportunity".

loans.use: to invest in her goat breeding business in order to generate higher revenue.

loans.name: Gayatri Shg-D Group

texts.en:

Sumitra owns and manages a variety store where she sells sarees (traditional Indian dress), bangles, cosmetics, talcum powder, fashion accessories, etc. She has a plan to enhance her business by bringing in more stock of what she sells and adding some more products like wafers, nail colours, falls (used to attach to the bottom of sarees), shampoos, hair oil, etc. She says that doing so will improve her family’s economic condition. 

Sumitra, together with her group member Mangaldei, has requested a loan of 24,000 Indian rupees (INR) and she will use her portion to purchase the above products. She has a dream of giving a good education to her son and saving some money for her daughter’s marriage.

loans.use: to purchase nail colors, shampoos, hair oils, wafers for her variety store.

loans.name: Mother Teresha Shg-A Group

texts.en:

Praphulakumari works in agriculture, raising poultry. Praphulakumari has been involved in this business for twelve years. She is a very hardworking woman, as she works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily to care for her poultry business. Praphulakumari and her group member Sukanti, are requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. 

This will be her first loan cycle with Peoples Forum. With her business profit, Praphulakumari hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to get good jobs and become well settled.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry in order to raise and sell them in the future.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is a 39-year-old lady who lives in a village named Masalla Patty in Falakata.  She has three children (two sons and one daughter). Her sons are grown up and engaged with some income-generating jobs. 

Maya's husband is engaged in preparing and selling a spicy and delicious snack mixture (it is called ' Chanachur' in Bengali). Maya also helps her husband to prepare the snack mixture. It is a very common and popular snack in India.  It is used on a wide variety with puffed rice or even just to chew plain.  They buy different ingredients like oil, spices, nuts, grams etc. and mix these items and prepare 'Chanachur' in their home and then supply it to local people and shops. 

At present the nominal profit can hardly bear all the household costs of a family. So Maya wants to expand the business by selling more quantity of snack mixture to meet the high demand of customers. Money is the main problem to materialize the dream. So Maya has taken out a loan from Kiva's partner, BJS to purchase required ingredients to enhance their Chanachur business. 

With the help of this loan she will be able to fulfill the demand of the local market, and will earn more profit through this business to handle the growing expenses of her family. 

Maya thanks BJS and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more necessary ingredients to enhance her family-run business.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, sugar, etc. for her food vending business.

Pacita has been in this business for 6 years. Pacita earns additional income from selling charcoal.

Pacita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, sugar, for her food production business.

loans.name: Mother Teresha Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Sabnamrani, the one standing to the left, is the featured borrower of Mother Teresha SHG-E. She is from the village of Christianpeta in Koraput district, Odisha, India. 

She is applying for a loan of 36,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum with her other group member Minati because they have always been neighbours and friends. 

Sabnamrani is a 25-year-old mother of two children who has worked for a year as a saleswoman in a cosmetics shop to cover her needs and expenses. She is a talented lady who has a good reputation, as she is known among her region for her proficiency in cosmetic sales. She is an ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her own business, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Peoples Forum to achieve her dream by opening her own cosmetics store. This loan is very important to Sabnamrani for it will help her make the first step toward a successful future.

loans.use: to open her own cosmetics store.

loans.name: Anita Rani

texts.en:
Anita is a 41-year-old housewife from Falakata in Alipurduar district. Her family consists of six members: herself, her husband, one son and three daughters. Her elder daughter is pursuing her Master's degree, and the other two are in grade 11 and 10 respectively. Her son is in grade 7. Anita is a homemaker who manages her household and looks after her children.

Anita's husband is a driver by profession. His monthly income is totally inadequate to maintain such a large family.  Most of his income is spent on the family expenses.  One of her daughters, Sonali, is a 15-year-old girl who is studying in grade 11 in Falakata Girls' High School. Recently she has passed 10th grade and got good marks. She is intelligent enough but she needs guidance from tutors. Being illiterate (can sign her name only), Anita is unable to help her daughter in her education. Anita and her husband want to provide a better education to Sonali so as to enable her to lead a better life. But their household income is not sufficient to meet her all educational expenses. 

This is why her mother Anita has applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner BJS. She will use the loan amount for coaching fees and will purchase a uniform, bicycle and books for her daughter. She strongly believes that her daughter will benefit from these materials and secure good marks in the forthcoming Higher Secondary exam. She hopes this loan will help her daughter's dream come true.

Anita and Sonali (who you can see in the photo) both are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase necessary study materials and pay fees for her daughter's smooth education.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Mrs. Thon is a generous woman who is 40 years old. She is married and has two children. She is an honest, hardworking, and goal-oriented person. She has many years of practice working the land and keeping livestock  helping her parents. Recently, her husband helps her do to business. 

She wants to gain a good income from her business in order to ensure her children can obtain an education. She is planning to enlarge her business and buy additional livestock. She is requesting this loan to buy livestock. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: To buy livestock to enlarge her business

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Mrs. Linh, 40 years old, is a hardworking woman and the mother of three children for whose sake she has gone through much adversity in life, and nevertheless has always had the strength to get ahead and keep making progress with her family.

For some time she has wanted to start a business breeding fish. This is why she is asking for major financial support to buy some young fish, food, and to equip a tank. With this new business she will be able to earn income for her family, which is everything to her, and will be able to improve the quality of life for her husband and their children. She will work daily to make her business go forward and be a sustainable and profitable enterprise.

loans.use: To buy some young fish, food, and equip a tank

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Mrs. Huong, 50, is married and has two children. To help earn a living, she raises pigs as a source of income for her family. 

To increase her income, she decided to take out a loan to buy feed for the pigs to produce higher quality pigs and increase sales. She plans to save money to renovate her family house.

loans.use: To buy feed for the pigs to produce higher quality pigs and increase sales

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en: Mrs. Tuyet, 41, is divorced and has three children. She earns a living by raising pigs, which she has been doing for 15 years. She also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing  to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins

loans.name: Sau

texts.en:
Mrs. Sau is a hardworking 33-year-old woman. She is married and has a baby. She is in the business of buying and selling livestock. 

She likes her business and takes good care of her livestock. She wants to expand her business and is planning to buy additional livestock, so she appealed to QB WDF and asked for financial support for this. 

She hopes to expand her business and earn money to help her parents. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to expand her business and buy additional livestock.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong is 31 years old; she lives with her husband and two children. The only source of income she has is a general store. She has five years of experience in the business, and is already popular in her community as a responsible and honest person. She needs a loan that she intends to use to purchase oil, rice, beans, juice, snacks, toilet paper, detergent, etc. to improve her business inventory. She hopes to meet her customers' needs and increase her sales to improve her family income. Her vision is to offer good service to her customers and reduce the deficiencies in her home.

loans.use: to use to purchase oil, rice, beans, juice, snacks, toilet paper, detergent, etc. to improve her business inventory

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Mrs. Huong  is a hardworking woman, 41 years old. She is married and has two children. She has been running her own cattle farming business for the past 20 years. She is responsible for fulfilling the needs of her entire family and for managing the household. 

Huong wants to purchase animals for her business purposes, but due to financial constraints she is unable to purchase the cattle. Therefore, she has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner QB WDF. This loan will enable her to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of her business.

loans.use: To purchase animals to expand her business activities

loans.name: Meo

texts.en: Mrs. Meo, 52 years old, is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children. She runs a fishing business and requested a loan through QB WDF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like her general store. She dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and other equipment to expand her business activities
